make this business work, we need capital and need your help.  The Octopurse is going to be huge.  Thanks for your help."
- Bali Bare, now 7-Year Old Entrepreneur 
Keep the Octopurse in your purse, backpack or trunk and ready for action when you have several bags to carry at the grocery store or at the mall.   The Octopurse gives you 8 extra hands when you need it.   From the creativity of a child entrepreneur to something that people use everyday.    If you live in an urban area or bring groceries in from the car, you only need one trip with the Octopurse! 

Overview of the OctopurseBali Bare, at age 5, created the Octopurse to solve a problem for her father.    Her father would carry all the groceries like this video: 

Yet, since Bali was 3 feet 6 inches tall at the time and her father 6 feet 3 inches, it put Bali right at the hand height of her father.     So she saw the real life struggle of adults carrying groceries, much like the video suggests above.
Here is her first video explaining why she invented the Octopurse, at age 5:

"I first saw the problem because Daddy's hands were turning purple and Mom's.  So I said how about we invent the Octopurse?   I'm Bali Bare and I am an Entrepreneur.  I created the Octopurse.  The Octopurse is a sorta thing that can carry your stuff.   It has 8 hooks, arms.  I invented it so your hands don't turn purple.   You need the Octopurse to carry all your things so nobodies hands can suffer anymore.   I want everybody to have the Octopurse, because the Octopurse makes life better." 
- Bali Bare, at age 5 (and already an Entrepreneur!)
Here is the re-created original drawing:


With some design work, the final product has become a proven and tested ergonomic handle that can support up to 60 pounds of groceries.
That is 8.6 Gallons of Milk.  That is 60 Loaves of Bread.  That is 40 Dozen Carton of Eggs.   So we think it will hold your groceries. 
Here is a look at the Patent Application:  

   What We Need & What You Get Invest in an Octopurse:  Never have your hand hurt again carrying groceries from car to counter or store to home.  Support Young Entrepreneurs as 10% of the net proceeds will go to a Young Entrepreneur Charity and the other 90% will go to Bali Bare's College Fund.   All funds will support local 3-D printing and manufacturing the necessary quantities of the Octopurse.  


    Risks & Challenges  There are a few challenges in creating a product with low margin and low cost.   Yet, we are prepared to deliver on the Octopurse one way or another.    We need to get 2,500 minimum Octopurses to break even on manufacturing.   If we are unable to reach 2,500, we will 3-D Print and deliver all the Octopurses as we have perfected 3-D processes and found a unique way to leverage a 3-D printing group.    Other Ways You Can Help Please contribute to Young Entrepreneurs, as 10% of net proceeds will be given to enable Entrepreneurial Education for K-12 through the Checkered Flag Run Foundation.   
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Share with everyone you know to get the word out about the Octopurse. Share this with other Young Entrepreneurs to let them know that they can become an Entrepreneur too.  
Share this in Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest and any other place to grow support for the cause.  

Thank you!
Bali

story:
ATTN: YOU CAN HAVE YOURS BEFORE THE REST OF AMERICA DOES, ALL YOU HAVE TO DO IS CONTRIBUTE!

 

Hi!  My name is Jason.  

 

 

 

I have this friend Eli. Eli had just quit his job and was in need of something EPIC to do.

 

 

 

I had this EPIC idea for a mustache shaped like a slap bracelet so I told Eli, "hey, why not make a slap bracelet in the shape of a mustache?"

 

 

and he was like "Right on!" and I was like "sweet" and he was like "where the hell do we do that" and I said "China"

 

 

and he was like "Right On" and the I showed him the epicness of the Slapstache and told him that I had made it 2 weeks before in China and I needed to do something with it. Eli then responded with, "I know a guy" and I was like "Eli, you always know a guy"

 

 

and he was like "Yeah man, well whatever, I"m in" and I was like "what do we have to lose?" and he was like ".......nada..........." and "I was like "lets do it" and that brings us to today...

 

Oh, yeah. The snowball effect... So we ended up recruiting the help of my brother Sam to take care of the graphics,

 

my best friend Leif to develop a website (that ended up being for another company that we simultaneously started themoofactory.com to help others make thier idea a reality too)

 

and my college buddy Kevin to help organize all of us to actually get theses pieces of Awesomeness to you. -No seriously, he's like totally anal and a nit pick for process and detail.  Great guy to have on 

 

 

I NEED YOUR HELP to make this happen. That means that even if you can't make a contribution,  you can feedback to how you see this idea becoming my reality.

 


..Really...I want to hear from you!

Slapstache \slap-stash\ n:Epic 90's fad in need of revival + iconic symbol of revolutionary meaning.

 

Mo-Jo \mo-jo\ n: What makes you get up in the morning and keeps you awake at night. It's what you are made of.

 

The Slapstache is a fun, trendy, and collectible silicone-covered slapband made in the shape of a mustache.

 

Oh...

One more thing: The easiest way to be heard is to donate. Our goal was to make them in the US, but after several meetings and hours on the phone, we have had little luck other than hearing "WE LOVE THE IDEA, BEST OF LUCK!"

That does not mean we are going to stop trying, that means that we need your help to get an order large enough and make theses bad boys and our dream a reality!

 

*While we may not reach right back out initially, we will do our best to offer a follow, a hug, or an auctionable "Charity Stache" on behalf of your efforts! 

 

 

slapstache@gmail.com

 

A Moo Factory Creation

story:
The QR code

Invented in Japan by the Toyota subsidiary Denso Wave in 1994 to track vehicles during the manufacturing process, the QR Code is one of the most popular types of two-dimensional barcodes. Unfortunately, it's also one of the most boring and ugly things to take in.

Companies across the world have tried unsuccessfully to capitalize on QR codes as marketing tools. They know there's "something there," just not exactly what it is.

Why we took notice

We were eating at a restaurant one day when we saw a Heinz ketchup bottle with a QR code on the back. Because we love technology and marketing, we decided to scan it, which only took us to its Facebook page. Obviously, the goal was to get new "likes," but talk about anti-climatic. To us, it was like going into a state-of-the-art movie theater to see a still image. 

The problems with QR codes

During that lunch we decided to make a list of all of the things that just weren't working as they related to QR codes and why they hadn't taken off in a bigger way. We know that they are on almost everything, but how often do you see people scanning them?

1. Not enough people have a QR reader app on their phone, or incentive to download one.

2. They're boring and ugly to look at and so two dimensional. Companies and people alike have tried all types of ways to vary the design, but since it needs to still be able to be scanned (and it's very finicky in the properties that need to be maintained in order to do so), at most you'll see the occasional rounded edges, maybe a limited contrast in colors, or a logo/image overlay. 

3. If you can even get someone to scan one (like in the Heinz scenario), chances are, they'll never scan that again—primarily due to the content.

4. The QR code takes you to a very specific place and only that place. There's some reusable Qr codes, but they are cumbersome to work with and not very user-friendly. Why is this a problem? What if you printed a thousand invitations to an event with that code and for some reason the destination of that code (i.e. the website it would be directed to) needed to change? Your code on the invitations would no longer be valid. 

5. The final, most pivotal thing that caught our attention, was that they were simply not fun. It's safe to say that 99% (don't hold us to that, just have a look for yourself) of QR Codes go back to the same company with the same theme. You'll always roughly know the content.

The challenge

To create a product that had a QR code on it that:

• always led to interesting and varying content

• never had to have the code changed

• intrigued people enough to want to download a QR reader app

• had an updated, more trendy version of the QR code that hadn't been done before

• could invite users to participate and WANT to participate

• was creative, interesting, entertaining, and thought-provoking

The solution

First we needed a name that involved making something your own, yet still tying in with the "QR" in QR code. After hundreds of names, we chose MIQROBREW.

Then we needed to not only create a QR code that would direct people to a website page in the making, but also make the QR code itself more appealing. We did this by creating The Cube—a three dimensional QR code that can still be read by QR readers.

Next we created an ultra-clean website (miqrobrew.com) that only served a very few purposes:

• Sell one shirt (in all sizes, mens and womens) that had The Cube on it as well as the line, "This shirt changes all the time." The shirts are $29.99 each.

• A blog page that the QR code actually directs to.

• A contact page where people can communicate with us directly and pay for a link to show for a given length of time on a pre-determined day for a small fee ($20—subject to approval [creative, interesting, entertaining, thought-provoking] as we don't want to ever run company ads).

• A Facebook page link where we want people to go and share their link ideas of where the shirts should send people to (facebook.com/miqrobrewlivingtee).

• A Twitter page link where every single scan that has been uploaded can be received via following us on Twitter (twitter.com/miqrobrew).

Finally, we added content. For months we've scoured the internet looking for images and videos that represent everything we found creative, interesting, entertaining, and though-provoking. Several times a day we will be posting only images and videos that represent those categories. We look at every video ourselves and try to find things that fall objectively within those categories on a daily basis. This is why it's like having hundreds and hundreds of shirts in one!

The feedback and what's left

As of right now, the only thing left is to have the shirts printed (which is the most expensive part of this process). Fortunately, we live less than two miles from a great screen printing shop. We have hammered out all of the pricing and quantities and now it's time to fund this. That's where you come in. So far, everyone wants a shirt for the sheer value of no one ever having one like it before. It seems that people like the idea of having a shirt that will always change. Not only will they be scanning it all day (and being rewarded with cool content), but their friends and even random people behind them in line will as well). This is why we call it the Living Tee.

There's just two of us. Pierce and Janice. We have been in business together for over five years. He worked at the world's largest US-Hispanic advertising agency on accounts such as Proctor & Gamble, General Mills, and Nestlé, and she at San Antonio's largest agency for over twenty years and is one of the most awarded designers in the entire region. We hope you'll help us make this project a reality and thank you for taking the time to read this.

Our financial goal

$18,000 is the amount of money it would take (based on our printing costs) to create a decent inventory that will prevent any need for backorders. This allows us to have varying sizes on high quality Hanes Tagless Tees that are 100% cotton. We have to purchase the shirts and then print in quantities of 100 units per size with six different sizes needed.

story:
Behind The Company

Black Autumn comes from the mind of a 19 year old girl from Wisconsin. My name is Breanna, and the idea of starting my own cosmetics company has been in my head for about a year now. Makeup is something that I enjoy doing. I’m 100% against animal testing and all of my products will be vegan.

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise $2,000. I would actually be very grateful to raise just half of my goal! This goal is partly because of the percentage that indiegogo takes out, but also because getting the supplies is expensive. I have many of the supplies needed, however I still need shipping supplies and labels. With these funds I could also buy the supplies for eye shadows or any other cosmetic, or have back up funds in case I run out of something and need to buy more. I have an artist creating an image that I would like to sell as stickers too. I had a seasonal job and what I could take from that was put into my company. Unfortunately, I was only able to get nail polish supplies, so if I were to open I could only sell to the US. I would love to be an international store but there is a law against shipping nail polish via USPS and any other way is expensive.

So this is where you guys come in. Donating is up to you but even just your support is greatly appreciated. If you can’t or do not want to donate, please spread the word! There is a large number of indie companies out there already, so it can be difficult for newer ones to start. Even just a few dollars helps. 

Unfortunately since I am a one-woman company, I cannot offer much for incentives for donating. If I reach my goal, I plan to have giveaways so stick around on the page! 

Questions?

Feel free to contact me at blackautumncosmetics@gmail.com or check out the Facebook page: facebook.com/blackautumncosmetics

story:
We are the Ravensbourne 2015 Fashion Graduates

We are this years graduating Ravensbourne Fashion students and we are really keen on having our final collections shown during Graduate Fashion Week in London. Sadly enough our small specialist industry-focused university sector college is unable to provide us with the full required budget. So we are in need of your help to make our dream come true! 


What is Ravensbourne?

Ravensbourne is an innovative, industry-focused university sector college located in the heart of London. Known for its creativity and collaboration, dedicated to giving learners the specialist skills and opportunities needed for outstanding careers in digital media and design.

It nourishes a community of approximately 1,900 students and offers practically focused digital media and design courses from pre-degree, undergraduate and postgraduate to professional short course level and is renowned for its exceptional industry employability rate.

Ravensbourne BA Fashion

The Ravensbourne Fashion alumni include Kit Neale, Bobby Abbley, Phiney Pet, Kait Bolongaro (Co-founder of All Saints) as well as employing designers at iconic fashion brands as Versace, Alexander McQueen, Vivienne Westwood, Topshop/Topman, Burberry, Acne Studios, H&M, River Island. 
Ravensbourne offers the innovative designer of the future an opportunity to study fashion design with a focus on the use and application of new media. The course is innovative and highly industry focused nurturing the skills vital for working as a designer/practitioner within the industry both now and in the future.


What is GFW?

Graduate Fashion Week is the world’s leading event for fashion graduates.

Showcasing the work of over 1,000 graduates from the most influential and inspiring UK and international universities, Graduate Fashion Week represents the future of creative design talent. Attracting 30,000 guests each June, the annual event features 22 catwalk shows, exhibitions from over 40 universities and an acclaimed Gala Award Show.

An unrivalled platform for the promotion of new talent, Graduate Fashion Week bridges the gap between graduation and employment and is responsible for launching the careers of some of the most successful designers of our time including Christopher Bailey, who was the winner of the first ever Graduate Fashion Week Gold Award, Stella McCartney, Giles Deacon, Matthew Williamson and Julien Macdonald. 

With many graduates populating design studios, buying offices, publishing houses and creative agencies all over the world, Graduate Fashion Week has introduced some of the industry’s brightest stars.



"Graduate Fashion Week was an extremely beneficial event for myself and my peers. Many people gained fantastic opportunities, and I personally feel that it played an important part in my initial success after graduating. I met with employers, received job offers and built great contacts with industry professionals, that I wouldn't have, had we not been at GFW."
Josephine Pettman
Creative Director Phiney Pet

story:
Check it out on The Fancy.

 

BSpoked: "Lets be honest, finding a great pair of shades without breaking the bank is nearly impossible. Elliot Havok Eyewear felt the same way and decided to be a part of the solution."

GearHungry: "Elliot Havok sunglasses, for instance, sport real Rosewood arms on spring-loaded hinges and 9 layer scratch-proof lenses with UV protection and a polarized core - features that typically come at a steep price."

Elliot Havok sunglasses were designed to be practical, affordable, as well as fashionable. It promotes modern sophistication without compromising comfort by combining subtle, but distinguished styles in ergonomic wood and gloss/matte designs.

Designing Elliot Havok SmartShades

We felt the need to design a quality pair that is less mainstream plastic and more refined, as well as practical.

Utilizing aspects from classic designs and reinventing couture,
We designed the first line of Elliot Havok.

Offering 3 Frame Colors

Your pledges on kickstarter will contribute to the production of 3 types of frames.

Each frame will retail at $109.00

  • Rogue - Matte Black w/ Polarized Lens
  • Prestige - Gloss Black w/ Polarized Lens
  • Architect - Gloss Black w/ Clear Lens for Prescription Use

Each pair will also include a 30 by 30 centimeter (about 12x12 in.) microfiber pocket square used to clean the lenses.

ErgoFit

  • Winged Temples to prevent slipping forward
  • Curved Contours to fit all heads
  • Rosewood Temple Arms to provide optimal durability and pliability
  • Unique Grain Patterns and etched logos for each pair

After numerous assessments on a variety of woods like birch, oak, and cherry, it was decided that rosewood had the most suitable strength, pliability, texture and grain patterns.

Taking these aspects into consideration, we engineered Ergofit temple arms that can be effectively worn on all heads.

9-layer Polarized UV Lenses

Some designer shades charge hundreds of dollars to manufacture plastic frames with polycarbonate lens that only prevent cracking, but Elliot Havok provides 9-layer polarized UV lens.

9-Layer Polarized UV Lens

These consist of :

  • 2 Shock Absorbers - to prevent cracking or shattering of lenses 
  • 2 Waterproof Anti-Scratch Layers - to maintain clear vision
  • 4 UV Filters - to fully protect against harmful ultraviolet radiation
  • 1 Polarized Core - to provide optimal contrast and glare reduction.

We join these parts with steel spring loaded hinges that outfit the sunglasses with ample durability and flex during wear.

Prestige Frames w/ Pocket Square
Rogue Frames w/ Pocket Square
Rogue Frames w/ Rosewood Temples

Production:

After numerous assessments on lumber, plastics, and lenses, we have finished designing and testing for a final prototype. We can now start production of the frames for the public with all of your help.

Your Support:

This is where indiegogo comes in. We need funding for manufacturing, packaging, and logistics. With your support, we can start large scale production of the frames, lenses, and temple arms. But more importantly you'll be helping to give an innovative start-up company a chance to provide fashionable, affordable products.

Help today, to make eyewear smarter, tomorrow.

Hi-Res Photos here

For further information, media, and a gallery, refer to: www.elliothavok.com
story_txt:
Check it out on The Fancy.
 
BSpoked: "Lets be honest, finding a great pair of shades without breaking the bank is nearly impossible. Elliot Havok Eyewear felt the same way and decided to be a part of the solution."
GearHungry: "Elliot Havok sunglasses, for instance, sport real Rosewood arms on spring-loaded hinges and 9 layer scratch-proof lenses with UV protection and a polarized core - features that typically come at a steep price."

Elliot Havok sunglasses were designed to be practical, affordable, as well as fashionable. It promotes modern sophistication without compromising comfort by combining subtle, but distinguished styles in ergonomic wood and gloss/matte designs.

Designing Elliot Havok SmartShades

We felt the need to design a quality pair that is less mainstream plastic and more refined, as well as practical.

Utilizing aspects from classic designs and reinventing couture,We designed the first line of Elliot Havok.

Offering 3 Frame Colors
Your pledges on kickstarter will contribute to the production of 3 types of frames.
Each frame will retail at $109.00


Rogue - Matte Black w/ Polarized Lens

Prestige - Gloss Black w/ Polarized Lens

Architect - Gloss Black w/ Clear Lens for Prescription Use

Each pair will also include a 30 by 30 centimeter (about 12x12 in.) microfiber pocket square used to clean the lenses.
ErgoFit


Winged Temples to prevent slipping forward

Curved Contours to fit all heads

Rosewood Temple Arms to provide optimal durability and pliability

Unique Grain Patterns and etched logos for each pair

After numerous assessments on a variety of woods like birch, oak, and cherry, it was decided that rosewood had the most suitable strength, pliability, texture and grain patterns.
Taking these aspects into consideration, we engineered Ergofit temple arms that can be effectively worn on all heads.
9-layer Polarized UV Lenses
Some designer shades charge hundreds of dollars to manufacture plastic frames with polycarbonate lens that only prevent cracking, but Elliot Havok provides 9-layer polarized UV lens.

9-Layer Polarized UV Lens
These consist of :


2 Shock Absorbers - to prevent cracking or shattering of lenses 

2 Waterproof Anti-Scratch Layers - to maintain clear vision

4 UV Filters - to fully protect against harmful ultraviolet radiation

1 Polarized Core - to provide optimal contrast and glare reduction.
We join these parts with steel spring loaded hinges that outfit the sunglasses with ample durability and flex during wear.

Prestige Frames w/ Pocket Square


Rogue Frames w/ Pocket Square


Rogue Frames w/ Rosewood Temples

Production:

After numerous assessments on lumber, plastics, and lenses, we have finished designing and testing for a final prototype. We can now start production of the frames for the public with all of your help.
Your Support:
This is where indiegogo comes in. We need funding for manufacturing, packaging, and logistics. With your support, we can start large scale production of the frames, lenses, and temple arms. But more importantly you'll be helping to give an innovative start-up company a chance to provide fashionable, affordable products.
Help today, to make eyewear smarter, tomorrow.
Hi-Res Photos here
For further information, media, and a gallery, refer to: www.elliothavok.com

story:
We run a non-profit Karate program in the city of santa ana,ca, we charge what family's can pay then we supply the uniforms if they can't afford them .We also pay for sparring gear and the fees to enter them in tournaments..funds are slim...

if you choose we list your name on our wall of fame(supporters)

story:
3rd annual KenYa Dig It coed 4's beach volleyball tournament fundraiser!

Operation Hearts and Home is  an organization dedicated to improving the lives of children in need worldwide through educational programs, medical care, and direct humanitarian aid. 

In the past we have held beach volleyball tournaments that were focused on raising money for projects in Kenya (hence the name KenYa Dig It) and also Ethiopia. This year we have a very specific purpose: to provide support to the eight children that Operation Hearts and Home sponsor from Kolfe Orphanage in Ethiopia. 100% of the proceeds will be used for the education of those eight children. 

(The closest child, Ermias is one of the children sponsored by Operation Hearts and Home)
Come to Cedar Beach Sunday August 10th to play in a beach volleyball tournament and support Operation Hearts and Home! Each team will be paired with a specific child that Operation Hearts and Home sponsors. If your team wins, extra funding will go directly to helping your team's child!  If you cannot come, you can still donate here to contribute to the cause!
Read more about and Operation Hearts and Home's work in Ethiopia on their Facebook page on their website:
www.operationheartsandhome.org


Tournament details:
The first game of pool play will start at 10:30 AM
(Be there by 10 to check in!)

Playoffs will follow after pool play 

Tshirts will be awarded to the 1st place team along with the satisfaction of helping a child in need!

This is a 4's tournamnet- 4 people on the court at all times.

Co-Ed: You must have at least one girl on the court at all times

$80 donation per team
(You can have more than 4 people on one team to use as subs which will lessen individual cost)


If you would like to participate you will need to get a team together and nominate a team captain. The team captain will contact Julie Bies, Erin Bies or Phil Bies with your members names and team name. The $80 donation can be submitted here and once received we will mark your team as paid!

All levels of play are welcomed! If we get enough teams we may break up into two separate divisions.

If you would like to play but do not have a team don't worry you can contact the people listed above to find teammates!

TSHIRT MUST BE PREORDERED THIS YEAR
$15 donation (Can be paid on here-Please post or send desired color and size to Julie, Erin, or Phil)
You can purchase one starting today, up until the tournament. We are keeping the same design as the past two years and changing the color to aqua! You can order any of the three colors (neon yellow, mint green, or aqua) as long as you tell us which one you want.


Cedar Beach will be charging $30 a car for non-residents of the town of Babylon (which I think is most of us). Fill up your cars and divide the cost! Cedar Beach is east of Tobay just passed Gilgo. When you enter, the courts are all the way to the right. 


Thank you for your support! I hope to see you there!


Ken-Ya dig it?!

story:
MayMac is a line of corsets, costumes, clothing and lingerie with a pin up flair.  MayMac will be debuting at The Viva Las Vegas Fashion show in April 2014.  I am asking for your support because the garments are sketched and patterned, but in order to produce enough product, I need some financial backing!  Your pledge will fund fabric, supplies (like zippers, thread, buttons, boning, etc) and production.  I have a lot of great rewards to offer for your pledges!  Everything from a one of a kind MayMac bag to exclusive items you can only get here!  Please consider making a pledge to MayMac and help give this small business the start that it needs!  

Thank you! 

Check out our video for a snip it of MayMac!


The Story Behind The Design...

MayMac is a fashion line in honor of a woman who influenced me, inspired me, and taught me how to sew.  Eunice May MacFadden, or Grandma Eunie. She taught me to sew at a young age, encouraged my creativity and taught me that everything should be made with love.  Grandma Eunie always dreamed of being a fashion designer, to which she would called her line "MayMac", but always said she did not have the confidence to per sue it.  Growing up we made halloween costumes and dresses for my dolls, which surely influenced me to become a fashion and costume designer today! She was a special lady, and despite her passing earlier this year, she still is, and always will be close to my heart.  I am launching MayMac to per sue my dreams, to per sue her dreams, and keep the legacy, talent, and spirit of Eunice May MacFadden alive.

New business cards!

We got a whole 2 pages in the Revolution Magazine! And an ad on the back cover! The article is an About Me and is quite inspiring :) 

 

I was too excited to make myself look fancy for a photo!

But..What's Our Style?

MayMac is heavily influenced by a time when beauty was curvy & sexy, but classy, the music was from big bands with a variety of instruments and charming voices, and the TV was still in black and white.  We love the olden days!   MayMac will strap you into a modern revival of pin up shapewear, curve boasting pencil skirts, and colorful, flirty fabrics. Most of all, we aim to make every woman feel beautiful.  We cater to a variety of sizes and want all women to feel that they are sexy!

Corsets, Curves and Costumes...

 Here at MayMac we focus on a few areas of garment design.  Not only do we enjoy street wear, but we LOVE lingerie!  Oh, and we LOVE corsets, and even more, combining the love for all of these into...costumes! Who ever wanted to stop playing dress up?!

Check out some of the costumes we've made!

"Wild for Pearls"

The Wild For Pearls corset before it got wild! 

And, I'm sorry, but my baby girl Ava looks adorable in her pearls, so I couldn't leave her out!


"Burlesque At Tiffany's"

Carmen Miranda

The Black Widow


Burlesque Zoo: Peacock

Burlesque Zoo: Tiger


Corset in collaboration with Killustrate It 

Phantom of the Opera

Cleopatra as portrayed by Elizabeth Taylor in the Movie Cleopatra


Just for fun, we made these for an 80's prom. I can't help but share this. 

Mrs. Claus


How's It Made?

Grandma Eunie always taught me that everything I made was special.  Today, this translates into every detail, consideration and alteration that is made on every garment.  Each costume is unique and well thought out, each corset and lingerie piece is "test run" and made sure to offer curves and comfort, and all street wear is carefully crafted.  Currently, every piece is made by me, in the MayMac Studio.  Eventually, we hope to be big enough that we will need to send our lingerie and street wear to be mass produced! In the USA of course! However, each costume and corset will still be made in the studio (because, well, its fun!).

Any chance your going to Viva Las Vegas? Come see our debut at the Fashion Show! Friday, April 18th at 12pm.

Keep up with us on Facebook! 

https://www.facebook.com/MaymacDesignStudios

& Twitter @_MayMac_


What We Need & What You Get

Be A Part of Getting MayMac Started!

By choosing to make a pledge to MayMac you are choosing to help fund a small business with BIG dreams!  We have been hard at work! Sewing, designing, patterning, supply shopping, doing photo shoots, networking and so much more preparing for the debut of the MayMac Collection at the fabulous Viva Las Vegas Fashion Show in April 2014.  But we are only one set of hands! (sometimes two when the man of the house gets trapped in the studio) and we need to make sure funding is set so the next few months can be spent working hard on production! We want to have samples for the show, but also stock available for purchase! Because, what good is it to look, if you can't touch (and buy) too?! 

MayMac is looking to raise $1000.00 to start production. Your funding can help! Here is how your pledges will be used:

  • Fabrics
  • Sewing Supplies (like zippers, thread, buttons)
  • Lingerie Making Supplies (Wire, Elastic, Straps, Garter Hooks, Snap Tape)
  • Corset Making Supplies (Spiral Steel Boning, Bone Casing, Specialty Fabric, Grommets)
  • Costume Making Supplies (Rhinestones, Trims, Feathers)

So, where's the incentives?

Let's talk perks, pre orders, and some fabulous opportunities!

REWARDS!!!

There are many rewards that need some explanation! 

$10 Pledge for Reversible Bandana:

LuvABull $25 Pledge

Pit Bull Skirt $50 Pledge

The exclusive to Indiegogo pledge of $50 Satin Leopard Bullet Bra:

Sample 100% Silk Pencil Dress Size 8 Pledge of $50:

$50 Pledge- Pink houndstooth crop top and pill box hat!

Leopard Swing Dress

EXCLUSIVE PRE-ORDER PRICE $90 Pledge (normally $80): 

$75 Pledge:


Sparkle Lace Red Dress- Stretch lace, line with a stretch nude fabric $100

Cherry Me Beautiful Dress EXCLUSIVE PRE-ORDER PRICE $100 Pledge (normally $110):

 High Waisted Panties and Matching Bullet Bra (Gives the Bullet bra shape, but softer and more natural) EXCLUSIVE PRE-ORDER PRICE $100 Pledge (normally $110): Please see below for pattern choices


Corselette and Bullet Bra- garters not included (Please see below for pattern choices) Pledge of $115 (Regularly $130)

Underbust Corset Shaper- Gives you a great hour glass figure without feeling too stiff! These corsets are spiral steal boned (allow for serious waist reduction but won't warp and will allow for easy movement) The side panels are made from a stretch fabric that allows you to keep the shape of your hips while reducing the size of your waist- and best of all- it makes it more comfortable and easier to move! Garters not included. Please see below for pattern choices.  $180 Pledge (Regularly $200!)



Bullet Bra Corset Shaper- Gives you a great hour glass figure without feeling too stiff! These corsets are spiral steal boned (allow for serious waist reduction but won't warp and will allow for easy movement) The side panels are made from a stretch fabric that allows you to keep the shape of your hips while reducing the size of your waist- and best of all- it makes it more comfortable and easier to move! Garters not included. Please see below for pattern choices.  $220 (Regularly $240)


Available Fabrics for High waisted pantie set, garter and bullet bra set, long line bra and garter sets, underbust corset and bra cup corset:


Other Ways You Can Help--

Like What You See? 

Share! Its not nice to keep this little treasure all to yourself! After all, secrets don't make friends! And we love friends! Check us out on Facebook and Share it will all your best buds..and everyone else! https://www.facebook.com/MaymacDesignStudios or on our website: MayMacDesignStudio.com

But There Are Still Questions!!

Is there a question we haven't answered? Some idea you want to share? Maybe tell me my dog is cute? We LOVE to chat! Shoot me an email at Katey@maymacdesignstudio.com any time!

story:
The totally customizable, completely washable, WIRELESS-CHARGING designer smart bag.

 

8 FLAPS TO CHOOSE FROM

 

 

3 OUTER BODY COLORS TO CHOOSE FROM

PLUS A GROWING SELECTION OF MODULAR ADD-ONS

 

SPECIFICATIONS:

Measurements: 27 cm by 28 cm by 10cm

Product weight: 0.7kg with the power unit, 0.6kg without the power unit

Wireless power unit: 10000mAh capacity; USB Type-C input 5V-2A; Micro USB input 5V-2A; Wireless input 5V-1.5A; USB output 5V-2A; Wireless output 5V-1.5A 

 

REWARD LEVELS

 

 

We launched this campaign to get this product to market. Funds raised will allow us to have the machinery and molding made to produce our outer bag shells and our wireless charging base and to produce each item in larger quantities which will reduce our overall carbon footprint from shipping and waste. We have had our modular system, without the added technology, produced for the last two years. Our charging feature was created by an engineering team that boasts dozens of patents and published scientific articles. Our production partners (who also produce bags for luxury brands Valentino, Tosca Blu, Le Tanneur,  and more) are ready to go as soon as we give them the green light. All prototypes have been rigorously tested to ensure each element of the bag is functional - in other words, we are ready to produce your bag! 

 

 

Our Impact

Our handbags are made with ethical manufacturing procedures, including fair wages and safe working conditions. We strive to limit our carbon footprint to help preserve the environment. We use vegan materials that are low-waste. Our EVA compound is extremely durable, long-lasting, and recyclable. When possible, we also use post-consumer content for our inner bags and flaps.

Long-lasting design

EVA is not only extremely durable but it will hold up for decades. Our modular design also lets you switch styles as desired so you never have to buy a complete bag again, this reduces waste and encourages us to use our products for longer.

Reusability and recyclability

We have a take-back program so all recycled EVA shells can be repurposed. Our favorite reuse of EVA is making squishy-soft playground mats.

Vegan

With ethical and environmentally sound materials now readily available, Evolution has made the commitment to only produce vegan products. You can feel confident that any product you purchase from us will not contain animal products.

 

Risks & Challenges

There are always certain risks that can arise at any moment during a project like this. That being said, we’re confident in our ability to produce the Evolution Smart Bag and have taken all the necessary measures to bring this project to life. We have a highly qualified team and have partnered with leading manufacturing and fulfillment companies around the world. We just need your help to bring everything to fruition. Don’t worry, we’re completely prepared to bring the Evolution Smart Bag to you, and we have the manpower to make it happen, but if anything comes up along the way, you’ll be the first to know - we promise.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We can’t thank you enough for checking out our project and helping us make the Evolution Smart Bag a reality. 

We know not everyone will be able to support us with a pledge, but if you like Evolution Smart Bags, please help us spread the word on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, Reddit, and anywhere else you can think of!

There are always certain risks that can arise at any moment during a project like this. That being said, we’re confident in our ability to produce the Evolution Smart Bag and have taken all the necessary measures to bring this project to life. We have a highly qualified team and have partnered with leading manufacturing and fulfillment companies around the world. We just need your help to bring everything to fruition. Don’t worry, we’re completely prepared to bring the Evolution Smart Bag to you, and we have the manpower to make it happen, but if anything comes up along the way, you’ll be the first to know - we promise.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
We can’t thank you enough for checking out our project and helping us make the Evolution Smart Bag a reality. 
We know not everyone will be able to support us with a pledge, but if you like Evolution Smart Bags, please help us spread the word on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, Reddit, and anywhere else you can think of!

story:
Aloha Dear Reader,

You're about to discover the coziest, classiest, Eco-friendliest robe you've never worn... yet!

Welcome to Imbued!

Your purchase of an Imbued robe will fund the manufacturing of your robe— which is also a cloak for Imbued's commitment to give back a portion of proceeds to Hawaii non-profits.

Here's the story...

 

Join the Fashion Revolution

By supporting Imbued, you'll be contributing to the #fashionrevolution, a.k.a the Slow Fashion Movement: A mindful approach to fashion, which considers environmentally friendly and humane processes in clothing manufacturing.

Each Imbued robe is a sustainably made, premium-quality, long-lasting garment imbued with integrity and values.

 

The Clear Choice: Sustainably Certified Modal Fabric

Imbued robes are made with Modal fabric derived from beech trees, a low-water demand tree that is pesticide free + renewable + biodegradable.

﻿Imbued's Tencel Modal fabric is Lenzing certified— which verifies that the fabric was made with wood harvested through sustainable forestry methods.

Also, Imbued's Tencel Modal fabric is certified by OEKO-TEX Standard 100—a third party system that tests for harmful substances during every stage of production. 

 

Why Certification Matters

Inexpensive Modal exists, but Imbued chooses not to use it...

Because if the Modal is not Lenzing certified then it poses a high risk that Indonesian rainforests were slashed and burned to grow the beech trees.

And without the OEKO-TEX STANDARD 100 certification, the Modal fabric could potentially be laden with chemicals that pose a risk to your health and the health of the planet. 

For more information click here.

 

The Difference Is In The Details: Italian Olive Wood Buttons

That's why the button that fastens your robe to the curves of your body, is hand-carved from Italian Olive Wood.

Shell buttons were the first choice because they're beautiful, ....and hey, Imbued was born in Hawaii!  But doing a deeper-dive, it was discovered that shell buttons are often unsustainably cultivated.

Of course, plastic buttons would be cheaper, but we're swimming in a sea of plastic that isn't biodegradable.

 

For more information about:

  • Shell Buttons click here.

  • Plastic Buttons click here.

 

Consciously Created Labels That Grow Chamomile Flowers!

Your garment hangtag will grow Chamomile!

Wait, ...what?

Yep... the hangtag on your robe is handmade paper made from 100% recycled ingredients, and it's embedded with Chamomile seeds!

Yes; plant your hangtag, and help it grow!

Also, unlike most "hangtags" these use no chemicals, dyes or additives, and are made one sheet-at-a-time by artisans in sunny San Diego, CA. 

For more information click here.

But that's not all!...

The "care" label on the inside of your robe is a heat transfer label, which means it's a tagless tag that requires no additional fabric!

 

From Imbued's Heart to Your Door with Environmentally Thoughtful Packaging 

Your Imbued robe will arrive at your door in a biodegradable apparel mailer made from 100% recycled paper, developed as a strong, flexible, plastic-free way to ship garments.

If that isn't Eco-friendly enough...

even Imbued's postage label is the world's most sustainable sticker option—a Zero Waste label that is 100% curbside recyclable!

For more information about:

  • Biodegradable Apparel Mailer click here.
  • Zero-Waste Label click here.

 

Ethically Made in the U.S.A.

Equal to Imbued's environmental commitment is a commitment to the ethical treatment of workers.

Which is why Imbued robes are being sewn at a Los Angeles sew factory, 9B Apparel which has a twenty-year reputation for maintaining ethical and healthy working conditions, right here in the U.S.A!

Using this U.S. based sew factory allows you the consumer to get a 1st-hand glimpse into production.

How?

Through Imbued's newsletter, and social media updates where I'll share the process as it unfolds, providing ethical transparency and the support of U.S. jobs.

For more information click here.

 

Benefiting The Future of a Non-profit

Every time Imbued launches an apparel collection, 5% of the proceeds will be donated to a chosen non-profit.

For this 1st collection Imbued has selected a local Kauai based organization called Kauai Animal Education Center or KAEC.

KAEC, is an animal rescue farm, an education center for all ages, a developing cultural space and a supportive place for people recovering from trauma and addiction. 

For more information about Kauai Animal Education Center click here.

 

 

So Here's The Deal...

  1. Imbued robes are a limited-edition collection through this campaign. 
  2. Funding proceeds will be used to produce your robe…mahalo for your patience.
  3. No extra inventory will be available after the production is finished!
  4. 5% of Imbued's proceeds will go to a Kauai non-profit...another 5% will go towards Indiegogo's platform fee and 2.9% towards a transaction handling fee. 

  5. Lastly, a BIG thank you, for sharing with friends, family, and followers, that you've backed this project!  You can post on social media, send texts or emails by saying; "I just backed @Imbued.co on @Indiegogo! Check out this awesome project: https://igg.me/at/imbued" 

 

Why Imbued crowdfunded? 

Crowdfunding is an excellent choice to share Imbued's story, grow a community around the Slow Fashion Movement, test the market and raise funds to launch a dream.

 

(Note:  Imbued chose to do limited edition collections through pre-order fundraising to make it easier to take 5% of the total sales for non-profit donation.  And for those wanting a short robe, that option will be offered later, so stay tuned, ...your long robe will arrive just in time to keep you cozy and warm for the cooler seasons.)

 

CONSCIOUS, COZY & CLASSY

Fern Frond, a luxurious, gentle green to inspire the jungle goddess within!

Classic Long Robe / Color: Fern Frond / Sizes: S, M, L

 

GET YOUR ROBE ON!

Drape yourself in Ocean Pool blue, imbued with serenity, and sensuousness!

Classic Long Robe / Color: Ocean Pool Blue / Sizes: S, M, L

 

IMBUED WITH ALOHA AND STYLE...

Imbued with a whole lotta "oo-la-la," the Smooth Lava black is island hot!

Classic Long Robe / Color: Smooth Lava / Sizes: S, M, L

 

Your robe has pockets! And even better, it was designed for versatility and function.

Get creative and explore your free-spirited style!

 

The Future Of Imbued...

Thanks to your participation in this first collection, another sustainable clothing business will be born, and the fashion revolution will continue!

The 2nd Imbued collection is in the works with a Mommy and Daughter theme, designed with organic fabric options.

Robes will be one part of a multi-functional collection that can be worn night or day, as your spirit chooses!

Make sure you're signed up for Imbued's newsletter at www.imbued.co to know when it's time to place your order!

Get your Imbued robe on and join this mission... POSSIBLE!

Choose a perk that fits you best— whichever you choose will be perfect!

From my bold heart to yours,

Mahalo,

Chief Creative Instigator of Imbued

 

Want to find out more about Imbued?  Checkout the following...  

Website  |  Instagram |  Facebook  |  Twitter

 

SPECIAL THANKS...

Shannon Lor @Factory45 / Tarini Bauliya @whatshesaid / Erica Taniguchi @kalaleaphotography /  Nicolette Aguinaldo @fotopopkauai / Saisha Whitlock @saishaphotography / Videographer Keith Kethchum @keithketchumphotography / Art Rahbar @9bapparel

 

Risks and Challenges

Please allow a 3 month timeline for production. I appreciate your understanding! Excellent quality takes time. It's important to note that if any minor changes occur during the production process it will be well communicated with backers, i.e. if the fabric is on backorder and/or if another fabric color option will be offered.

 

Return Policy

Imbued is all about fair business practices and aiming to please.  If expectations aren't met when your robes arrives and you wish to return it...no problem!  Please mail your robe back to Imbued within 30 days from the shipment date and you will be given a full refund.  Return shipping cost will be your responsibility.  

 

Shipping

As much as we've all become accustomed to free shipping, Imbued is just a "wee babe" in the big world of business.  Eliminating shipping costs for future collections is in the process. Mahalo for your understanding!

 

Some of you may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • You can get the word out about Imbued by sharing this Indiegogo link.  Simply cut and paste the message below and send it via text, email, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter or any other way that works!

 

“I’m supporting a revolution called the Slow Fashion Movement and I’m recruiting YOU! Check out what this new Hawaii based business is doing. It's eye opening! I think you’ll be surprised after you watch the video.  Please help with this mission and forward this message to spread the word!” Here’s the link to find out more..…https://igg.me/at/imbued

 

  • You can also use the Indiegogo share tool!

 

You can do this! We can do this!...

story:
*** ENGLISH BELOW***

Ciao!

Siamo Elena e Sara, co-founders di Atelier Riforma e con noi ci sono Davide e Teresa, recentemente unitisi al team.

Atelier Riforma è una startup innovativa a vocazione sociale che ha l'obiettivo di ridurre l’impatto ambientale del settore della moda attraverso l'economia circolare e la creatività sartoriale.

Come forse molti di voi sapranno, ad oggi il settore della moda è tra quelli più inquinanti al mondo. Sappiamo, pero, che la chiave per renderla più sostenibile sta nella durata della vita di utilizzo dei vestiti: allungare anche solo di 9 mesi la vita di un capo, può ridurre il suo impatto ambientale dal 20 al 30%.

Che cosa fa Atelier Riforma a questo scopo? Raccogliamo abiti usati da chi vuole disfarsene e li affidiamo alla nostra rete di realtà sartoriali che, attraverso il processo di trasformazione (chiamato “upcycling”), dà loro nuovo valore. Una volta trasformati, i capi vengono da noi venduti e possono avere così una seconda vita.

               

La trasformazione degli abiti è per noi anche uno strumento per creare lavoro, crescita e inclusione: in altre parole, vogliamo che Atelier Riforma, attraverso l’upcycling degli abiti usati, unisca tutte quelle realtà sartoriali che desiderano impegnarsi nella tutela dell’ambiente e nella costruzione di una società più giusta.

L'idea di Atelier Riforma è nata durante il progetto della Fondazione CRT "Talenti per l'Impresa", un corso di alta formazione volto a formare i giovani sull'imprenditoria. In un anno siamo passati da essere una semplice idea, a una startup. Abbiamo raccolto oltre 1500 capi e creato una rete di nove realtà, tra designers, sarte, brand sostenibili e sartorie sociali in cui lavorano persone provenienti da condizioni di fragilità. Abbiamo anche stretto due collaborazioni con scuole di moda affinché gli studenti, i professionisti di domani, si avvicinino alla moda sostenibile e imparino l’arte dell’upcycling. Inoltre, collaboriamo con due associazioni non profit (il Progetto ABITO di Torino e l'Associazione Abraham di Nichelino), donando loro gli indumenti che possono essere utili alle persone in difficoltà economico-sociale. Da pochi giorni è attivo il nostro e-commerce, ma siamo solo all’inizio!

Vogliamo fare molto di più. Vogliamo realizzare un sistema di tracciabilità che garantisca a chi ci dona i propri capi la trasparenza sulla loro destinazione. Allo stesso tempo, vogliamo permettere a chi acquista di scoprire chi ha realizzato il lavoro sartoriale sul capo che ha acquistato e comprendere il proprio impatto positivo sull’ambiente, generato dall’acquistare un nostro abito riformato.

Per realizzare tutto questo abbiamo bisogno di più risorse umane e finanziarie: proseguendo al ritmo attuale, il prossimo anno serviranno almeno due persone dedicate a seguire il sistema di tracciabilità e di misurazione dell’impatto ambientale. Inoltre, servirebbe un investimento nell’etichettatura e nei dispositivi informatici (importo stimato per l’intero investimento 30.000 euro).

Sono obiettivi ambiziosi, per questo abbiamo deciso di procedere a piccoli passi e di chiedere aiuto alle persone che credono nei nostri valori.

Con questa campagna vogliamo raggiungere l’obiettivo di 8.000 euro che ci permetterà di iniziare a investire sul sistema di tracciabilità: daremo la possibilità a chi ci dona i propri capi di scoprire la loro destinazione, inserendo sul nostro sito un codice.

Se vuoi aiutarci a fare questo primo passo, prendi parte a questa campagna!

Come ricompensa alla tua donazione, in base al tuo contributo, potrai ricevere uno di questi prodotti in anteprima:

  • bracciale realizzato da vecchie t-shirts dalle sarte della nostra rete;
  • pochette realizzata da jeans usati e tessuto wax dalla sartoria sociale il Filo d’Alga;
  • zainetto realizzato da jeans usati e tessuto wax dalla sartoria sociale il Filo d’Alga;
  • t-shirt multicolor da maglie usate realizzata dalla sartoria sociale il Gelso;
  • maglione di filato rigenerato lavorato dalla magliaia Sonia Oberto.

Scopri maggiori dettagli nella sezione dedicata alle ricompense (perks).

Se abbracci la nostra missione, ma non hai la possibilità di donare, puoi comunque aiutarci condividendo questa campagna per farla conoscere ai tuoi contatti!

Ogni piccolo gesto per noi è importante. 

P.S. Scegliendo di donare riceverai prodotti derivati dall’upcycling di indumenti usati e starai già contribuendo a rendere la moda più sostenibile! Scopri tutte le ricompense :-)

Elena, Sara, Davide e Teresa per Atelier Riforma

 

Si ringrazia Matteo Trevisan per il montaggio video!

 

***ENGLISH VERSION***

Hello!

We are Elena and Sara, Atelier Riforma’s co-founders, together with Davide and Teresa, who recently joined our team.

Atelier Riforma is an innovative startup for social good, which aims to reduce the environmental impact of the fashion industry through circular economy principles and sartorial creativity.

For us, second-hand clothes, which are no longer worn and would be thrown away, are a resource!

What do we do in practice? We collect used clothes from those who want to get rid of them and give them to our network of tailoring realities which, through a tailoring process of transformation (called "upcycling"), gives them a new value. Once transformed, the garments are sold by us and can thus have a second life.

Our brand wants to represent all the people who look for environmentally friendly and ethical clothes.

The upcycling of used clothes is for us also a means to create job opportunities, growth and inclusion: in other words, we want our startup to connect, through the upcycling of used clothes, all the tailoring realities who want to commit themselves in the environmental protection and in building a more equal society.

The idea of ​​Atelier Riforma was born during CRT Foundation's project "Talenti per l'Impresa", an advanced training course aiming at training young people on entrepreneurship. After one year we turned a simple idea into a startup. We have collected over 1500 garments and created a network of nine realities, including designers, tailors, sustainable brands and social tailorings where people from conditions of fragility find a job. We have also established a partnership with two fashion schools so that students, tomorrow's professionals, approach sustainable fashion and learn the art of upcycling. We also collaborate with two non-profit associations, donating them clothes that can be useful for people in social-economic difficulties.

A few days ago we started to sell our clothes on our e-commerce website, but we are just getting started!

We want to do more. We want to create a traceability system which guarantees transparency about the destination of the clothes people give us. At the same time, we want to allow those who buy to find out who made the tailoring work on the garment they purchased and understand their positive impact on the environment, generated by buying a reformed item.

To achieve all this, we need more human and financial resources: going on at the current rhythm, next year we will need at least two people dedicated to working on the traceability and measurement of environmental impact systems. In addition, an investment in digital labels and IT devices will be needed (we estimate an amount for the whole investment of 30.000 €).

These are ambitious goals, so we decided to proceed step by step and to ask the people who believe in our values to support us.

With this campaign, we aim to reach the goal of 8.000 euro, which will enable us to start investing in the traceability system. Thanks to your support, we will give the opportunity to people who donated us their clothes to find out their destination by entering a code on our website.

If you want to help us to take this first step, take part in this campaign!

As a reward for your donation, based on  your contribution, you will receive one of these products in preview:

  • a bracelet realized from old t-shirts by the tailors of our network:
  • a pochette made from recycled jeans and wax fabric by our social tailoring “Il Filo d’Alga”
  • a backpack realized from recycled jeans and wax fabric by the social tailoring “Il Filo d’Alga”
  • a multicolor t-shirt made from second-hand shirts by the social tailoring “Il Gelso”
  • a sweater of regenerated yarn realized by our knitter Sonia Oberto.

Look for more details of perks in the dedicated section.

If you embrace our mission, but you do not have the possibility to donate, you can still help us by sharing this campaign with your contacts!

Every small action is important to us.

P.S. by choosing to receive these products derived from the upcycling of old clothing, you are already contributing to making fashion a bit more sustainable! Look for the different kind of perks:-)

Elena, Sara, Davide e Teresa for Atelier Riforma

 

We thank Matteo Trevisan for video making!

In launching an eco-minded clothing brand the effort put into the brand DNA and company culture has equal standing with the effort put into the design/ manufacture of the product itself.

At Good Shirt the company ethos and clothing design are based around a simple yet profound fact that “The fashion industry is the second largest polluter in the world.

So are we going to be another clothing company that shamelessly plays their part in the polluting of our planet?, or are we going to be a sustainable company that makes a conscious effort in playing a role in restoring a balance in the natural world, and reducing mankind's impact on the environment?

It’s a no brainer really, we're taking the sustainable route. In doing so we'll follow in the footsteps of companies like legendary outdoors company Patagonia, whose light shines brightest of all clothing companies as a sustainable producer and environmentally aware company and has no doubt inspired many like us to take this less trodden but ultimately the more rewarding path.  

Collaboration is another integral component of our Brand DNA and in launching Good Shirt Collab Tees with an eclectic collection of Tee Print art as chosen by the “Dream Team” of Collaborating Photographers we're kicking things of in the positive way we plan to continue.

The Travel & Adventure theme of our first Collab really sets the tone, is a big part of what we love and insync with the eco-active range we’re launching with.

Between them this “Dream Team” of Photographers have clocked some serious miles both in the air and on the ground, and so we celebrate this world we love in all it’s diversity through their awesome range of photographic prints on our Limited Edition Good Shirts Collab Tees, the QAD Pro Camera Straps & the Slim Jim Minimalist Wallets.

With more good stuff to come, follow our journey and get involved, who knows we may be collaborating with you in the future.  

Prior to launching we had a supporter based "Design Refine" on the Collab Tee Print Art, the votes are being tallied so we'll update this Lookbook with the Tee Print Art deemed most popular by you our supporters.  
 
Got some sweeeet images of your own you'd like to see on a Collab Tee, Pre-order the "One of a Kind" Perk and we'll work with you to create the Tee Print Art.
 

Our low profile Slim Jim Minimalist Wallets from the GS eco-minded accessory range are great for carrying cash & cards in your front pocket, the compact size making them ultimately more comfortable and less likely to be pickpocketed when travelling than a regular wallet.

The Dream Teams Collab Art featured on the range of Slim Jim Minimalist Wallets  sure to add some verve to your day. 

​Our Patent Pending Quick Attach / Detach Camera Strap enables you to remove or attach the QAD Pro from your camera body in seconds. 
ART meets Functional Design with the verve of the images as supplied by the "Dream Team" of Collab Artists whose work features on the QAD PRO's neck/ shoulder section.

Good Shirt's "Adventurers Club", is more of a Privilege Card than your standard loyalty card.

With Good Shirt's Eco-minded approach to business and it's relationship to the Natural World through our sustainable product and collaborative model, our omni-channel sales places a great emphasis on  B2B sales with our Partner Clients businesses operating in the Adventure Tourism Experiences  space. Given that these businesses spend their days providing their guests with experiences based in the outdoors, their duty of care to the Natural World in which their respective businesses operate is very high, so a good synergy with our stated goals and range of eco-savvy goods. 

Through our Adventurers Club, in addition to stocking GS Collab Tees, our B2B Client Partners may choose to offer seasonal deals to GoodShirt Adventure Club cardholders.

Every purchase of a Good Shirt Collab Tee or Accessories comes with a FREE GS Adventurers Club card for you to enjoy special offers from our Partner Clients when in season. Think Bike Tours, Diving, Stand Up Paddle Boarding, Swimming with Whale Sharks, Ballooning, Vineyard Tours, Sky Diving, Kayaking ........ and so the list goes on. 

Good Shirt's Free digital e-zine "Good Stuff"  hosted on issuu, is well, packed full of good stuff! Interviews with Collaborating Artists, Photo Galleries, Features on Environmental Issues that resonate with us. 

Together with  travel stories which may feature our Partner Clients businesses  we'll add to the mix articles on music, food and other topics of interest to keep things fresh. Stay tuned the 1st issuu of Good Stuff dropping later this week.

  

 
 

With all of the time, effort and monies put into the developing Good Shirt as an eco-savvy company has been self funded to this point, Indiegogo is a great platform to launch our brand on introducing Good Shirt to the world.

We can introduce ourselves to you and as a visitor/ supporter of our launch, and you get a look behind the scenes and learn more about Good Shirt as a responsible brand.

If you like what you see, as way of thanking you for your support we’ve got some special Indiegogo pricing for the pre-order perks so a great way to kick things off for both ourselves, and our supporters.  

Going into our first production run of Good Shirt range with your help, the pre-orders made on Indiegogo will help us to reach the minimum order quantities required for production, with a successful campaign resulting in zero waste with all goods being made to order directly by you the end user.

With our collaborative model, for the launch we’re also giving you the option to see your own work on a Good Shirt through our “One of a Kind” pre-order perk, and so engaging with our supporters not only online but also in creating some unique tee print art together with you.

More details about all the good things we’ve been able to pack into the humble tee are outlined here, but if there’s anything specific you would like to ask feel free to reach out. 

As a sustainable/ eco-minded company Good Shirt will also actively champion environmental causes that we are passionate about.

At Good Shirt we’re kicking off our first Corporate Social Responsibility initiative with Conservation Photographer/ Eco Warrior Paul Hilton's Collab Tees.

One of these Collab Tees featuring the hashtag #SaveLeuserEcosystem designed to raise awareness of the environmental travesty that is taking place there with large scale industrial development for palm oil, pulp and paper plantations and mining which threaten the entire ecosystem.

Paul together with other committed individuals and organisations are on a mission to help preserve this the most bio diverse region in the world and home to the Sumatran Tiger, Sumatran Elephant, Sumatran Rhino and the Orangutang to name just a few of the Leuser Ecosystems inhabitants that are being pushed to the brink of extinction.

So a portion of our profit from sale of GS Collab Tees & Accessories will be donated to help with the ongoing funding of an Elephant Patrol unit operating in the Leuser Ecosystem which is structured to mitigate the human/ wildlife conflict occurring as a result of the loss of their natural habitat.

Please Note:  With the structure of our Collab Model, it doesn’t matter which Good Shirt product you buy from the entire range, Good Shirt will be donating regardless.

 

 

 

 

The fabric used in Good Shirts is a polyester single jersey made incorporating recycled PET plastic, with both Dri-Cool & Antimicrobial performance functions and is a bluesign® approved fabric produced by a bluesign® approved textile mill.

WORLDWIDE RESPONSIBLE ACCREDITED PRODUCER (WRAP) (www.wrapcompliance.org) Is an independent, objective, non-profit team of global social compliance experts dedicated to promoting safe, lawful, humane and ethical manufacturing around the world through certification and education.

 
 
 
 
While Good Shirt is a new brand, I have been involved in the fashion industry for over 17 years and have long term working relationships with manufacturing partners who have been in the business of garment manufacturing for over 25 years so together we are well versed in getting a quality product produced and working to a fixed delivery timeline.
 
The Manufacturer we’ve worked with for the sampling and our upcoming production of the Good Shirt range, is a leading edge sustainable manufacturer, working with global brands such as Arc'teryx, The North Face, Salomon, so not our first rodeo when it comes to producing high quality product delivered to a timeline.
 
With the completion of the Good Shirt Collab Indiegogo Launch, the first thing we'll do is send you the order survey form where you can select the Style/ Size/ Colourway/ Print Art based on the selected "Perk" you ordered and return the completed form to us.
 
Then we're into the pre-production/ production phase and with production completed  the logistics and delivery of your order directly to your door.
 
Of course if for any reason there is a delay in production we will be transparent and update you with this information together with the revised delivery schedule. We have already built in a time buffer to allow for unforeseen delay and not disrupt our delivery schedule so we're not expecting any delay to the delivery schedule, simply our style to plan for all eventualities.
story_txt:
In launching an eco-minded clothing brand the effort put into the brand DNA and company culture has equal standing with the effort put into the design/ manufacture of the product itself.
At Good Shirt the company ethos and clothing design are based around a simple yet profound fact that “The fashion industry is the second largest polluter in the world.
So are we going to be another clothing company that shamelessly plays their part in the polluting of our planet?, or are we going to be a sustainable company that makes a conscious effort in playing a role in restoring a balance in the natural world, and reducing mankind's impact on the environment?
It’s a no brainer really, we're taking the sustainable route. In doing so we'll follow in the footsteps of companies like legendary outdoors company Patagonia, whose light shines brightest of all clothing companies as a sustainable producer and environmentally aware company and has no doubt inspired many like us to take this less trodden but ultimately the more rewarding path.  


Collaboration is another integral component of our Brand DNA and in launching Good Shirt Collab Tees with an eclectic collection of Tee Print art as chosen by the “Dream Team” of Collaborating Photographers we're kicking things of in the positive way we plan to continue.
