story: COLORS TO CHOOSE FROM
story_txt:
COLORS TO CHOOSE FROM
























STITCHING COMBINATIONS (OPTIONAL)
Columbia w/ Black Stitch

Venetian w/ Black Stitch

Cerise w/ Spearmint Stitch

Champagne w/ Indigo Stitch

Phantom w/ Slate Stitch

Indigo w/ Black Stitch

Caramel w/ Indigo Stitch

Phantom w/ Red Stitch

Bone w/ Marina Stitch

Columbia w/ Venetian Stitch

Caramel w/ White Stitch

story:
About two years ago, I became so frustrated after having received poor quality clothing over and over again that I had ordered online. Some pieces I could wear once and it fell apart or had shrunken significantly after one washing, other pieces' measurements were extremely off (read: a size S fitted as an XXL, no joke). 
What I was missing was quality clothing in accurate sizes (following 1 size guide) that's stylish, comfortable and affordable at the same time. Oh, and preferably made of more natural fabrics (away with those synthetic fabrics, no more wearing plastic!), so it's ideal for me and other women while on the go or traveling as well as better for the environment and our future generations.
This is how the idea of creating my own clothing collection was born. 

Sololu's mission is to bring value to the world by providing high-quality, comfortable, stylish and affordable clothing that contributes to a better everyday life, whether at home or abroad.

With your help in contributing any amount or pre-ordering one or more of the products I'm offering through this Indiegogo campaign (see the collection below), I will be able to have the clothing created in bulk and I'll be able to add even more designs that include all those characteristics I was missing. 

 

 

I myself travel on a regular basis to different places all over the world. The first collection is based on the clothing styles and pieces I love to bring on my own travels and is handmade in an ethical work environment in Bali, Indonesia. It consists of 10 clothing designs, 1 sarong and 1 bag that can be worn year-round and mixed and matched together easily. 

Quality is the most important to me – I want to focus on clothing designs that last, rather than clothing designs that need to be thrown out within a year of purchasing them. As I wanted to stay away from synthetic fabrics, I decided to use more natural fabrics – also because natural fabrics are breathable, which is ideal for travel. The characteristics of the fabrics I use for the clothing are soft, lightweight, breathable and biodegradable. All of the pieces are pre-washed to make sure they all maintain their original measurements as much as possible after washing.

The plan is to create and add new styles to the collection on a regular basis after the Indiegogo campaign has ended. I aim to offer a large range of seasonless, stylish pieces that make it easy for you to create outfits you feel most confident in – year-round.

Here below you can find all the details of each piece in the collection. All 10 clothing designs will be available in the sizes: XS, S, M, L and XL. The preferred size can be selected when you check out. For measurements, please refer to the "Size Guide" section further down. 

 

The Sololu jute tote bag is made of jute material and is the perfect tote to bring to the beach, markets or anywhere else. It is cotton lined, lightweight, sturdy and has our logo + website printed on one side. 

  • Measurements: 40cm x 35cm x 10cm  //  15.8" x 13.8" x 3.9" (LxHxD) 

 

The white strapless top comes with a neck tie/choker and looks amazing on our shorts, skirt, pants and wide leg pants (designs 04, 07, 09 and 11, all below). However, you could also just wear them with your bikini bottoms and a straw hat for the ultimate chic beach look! 

  • 100% Rayon
  • Fully lined
  • Not sheer

 

This is a piece I carry with me at all times when traveling. It’s the perfect piece to bring to the beach to sit on, to use as a dress or skirt, to use as a cover-up, to use as a shawl, to use as blanket or towel and even to use as a decoration piece in your home. It comes in black/white, which will go with anything!

  • Approximate measurements: 165cm x 110cm  //  65" x 43.3" (LxW) 
  • Not sheer

 

These shorts are perfect to bring on your travels! They feature a bohemian-inspired pattern in wine red/black and elasticated waistband. They’re comfortable and flattering, and the trim adds a nice detail to the look. 

  • 100% Rayon
  • Unlined
  • Semi sheer

 

The black/wine red reversible V-neck top goes well with anything and comes with me at all times. It looks great with anything, but I love it most on denim bottoms to create a casual chic look, or tucked into the skirt (design 07 below) to create the perfect evening look. 

  • 100% Rayon
  • Adjustable straps (the adjusters will be black)
  • Not sheer

 

The white long sleeve off the shoulder top is a perfect piece to wear on jeans, skirts or shorts – it goes well with anything. I love it on the shorts or pants (designs 04 and 09).

  • 100% Rayon
  • Full length sleeves with elasticated cuffs
  • Body lined
  • Not sheer

 

The camel colored skirt with slit is the perfect piece to dress up or down and is super comfortable. Wear it with a T-shirt and sneakers for a more casual look or wear it with the reversible top (design 05) and a pair of heeled sandals for a perfect date-night look.

  • 90% Cotton, 10% Elastane
  • Rib texture
  • Unlined
  • Fitted design
  • High waist
  • Stretch fabric
  • Not sheer

 

Hit the streets wearing this beautiful white off shoulder dress that can be worn different ways. The dress comes with a waist/neck tie, so you can wear it the way you like!

  • 100% Rayon
  • Full length flared sleeves
  • Body lined
  • Not sheer

 

These sand/beige colored pants are a full length style and feature an elasticated waistband with 100% cotton drawstring tassels. Wear this comfortable pair of pants as high waisted or low rise, drop crotch style.

  • 100% Rayon
  • 100% Cotton drawstring tassels
  • Pocket on each side
  • Unlined
  • Not sheer

 

The striped knit sweater is handmade from a 100% cotton fabric and features a round neckline, full length sleeves, black/white horizontal stripes and curled edge trims. It's the perfect piece for cool days.

  • 100% Cotton
  • Unlined
  • Relaxed fit
  • Not sheer

 

The wide leg pants instantly make your legs look longer! They feature a bohemian-inspired pattern in wine red/black and elasticated waistband. They’re super comfortable and perfect for any occasion as the pair can be dressed up or down.

  • 100% Rayon
  • Flared legs
  • Pocket on each side
  • Unlined
  • Semi sheer

 

The black/wine red reversible maxi dress is a versatile piece and features a high neckline, low back and a side slit at the hem. Wear it with heels or sandals to create a chic evening look, or casual day look. 

  • 100% Rayon
  • Adjustable straps (the adjusters will be black)
  • Not sheer

 

*Size worn in the photos is a size S (small). My (yes it's me!) measurements are: bust 82 cm, waist 66 cm, hips 86 cm, length 1.68 m  //  bust 32", waist 26", hips 34", length 5'5".

 

All perks will be shipped with a 20% off discount coupon that can be used for a future order on my website www.sololu.com after the campaign has ended. 

All contributors will be added to the Sololu newsletter list and will receive exclusive offers, the latest news about Sololu, updates on new arrivals + restocked goods, and much more.

 

Before placing your order, please check the measurements below to make sure you order the right size. Measurements should be taken directly on your body.

Bust: Measure your chest over the fullest part of your bust while wearing a bra that fits.

Waist: Measure your waist at the narrowest point.

Hips: Your hips measurement should be measured around the fullest part of your hips.

If the item you've ordered doesn't fit right, you will have 14 days from the receipt of the order to contact me at hello@sololu.com to request an exchange and send back the item. Once I've received your item, I will send you the right size (I can assist you with deciding on the right size). Shipping costs for an exchange will be your responsibility.

 

As the Handwoven Bracelets and Sarongs have been made already, these can be shipped out right after the campaign ends. The Jute Tote Bags and clothing are expected to be shipped out in August 2017.

 

Sololu is founded and started by me, Rosanne Hertogh, out of my passion for traveling and style. After a study in visual merchandising, interior design/styling and fashion styling, I moved with my family from the Netherlands to Canada in 2011 to start a new life. It has always been a dream to start my own fashion brand, so after some years of working in Canada and traveling through Asia, I decided to go for it. 

My adventurous spirit has not only helped cause an emigration with my family from the Netherlands to Canada, it has also led me to places all over the world and it helps me to live life to the fullest by trying new things and taking risks – stepping outside of my comfort zone. From living and working in Italy to hiking the Himalayas in Nepal and from kiteboarding in Mexico to skiing in the Alps, I've experienced it and am grateful for it! However, there’s still so much more to discover and experience. Exploring the world and enjoying its beauty will never get old, it makes me feel most alive.

Sololu is a reflection of my personal style and my ideal lifestyle – being wherever you’re happy, doing whatever makes you happy and sharing this with whoever makes you happy.

 

You are the key to my success. I would greatly appreciate it if you could spread the word and share my campaign. You can also follow Sololu on social media – the social media buttons below will send you to Sololu's profile on each platform, or subscribe to the Sololu newsletters at the bottom of my website www.sololu.com.  

Thank you so much for your support and for being a part of this journey! 

                    

 

Where will you ship from?

All orders will ship from Ontario, Canada.

Do you ship worldwide?

Yes, orders within Canada will be shipped for $4 - $25, order to the USA will be shipped for $6 - $30 and international orders will be shipped for $10 - $60 depending on your selection and the weight of the products.

When can I expect my order to arrive?

All orders will ship within 1-8 weeks from the last day of the campaign. Shipping within Canada should take 2-9 days from the date of shipment. Shipping to the USA should take 4-8 days from the date of the shipment and shipping internationally should take 6-14 days from the date of the shipment. 

Does shipping include tracking?

All Canada + USA orders will include tracking. All international orders don't have tracking included, as I want to keep shipping costs as low as possible for you. International shipping that includes tracking, is often double in cost. If you are willing to pay for shipping that includes tracking, please email me at hello@sololu.com.

Contributors living outside of Canada will be responsible for the charges of duties and import taxes. These are charged once the package reaches its destination country and vary from country to country. They will not be included in the cost of shipping. You may contact your local customs office for further information related to customs charges.

What if I purchased the wrong size?

If the item you've ordered doesn't fit right, you will have 14 days from the receipt of the order to contact me to request an exchange and send back the item. Once I've received your item, I will send you the right size. Shipping costs for an exchange will be your responsibility. Please, make sure to check the size guide before placing an order.

Is there a return policy?

As I use the funding from Indiegogo to get the bulk production started (to make the clothing collection available to everyone around the globe), I won’t be able to accept returns.

What if an item is not the color I thought it was?

Please keep in mind that due to different computer monitors and display settings the actual product's colors may vary slightly from the colors in the product photos. I have made every effort to display the colors and images of the products as accurately as possible. However, I cannot guarantee that your computer monitor's screen displays the colors accurately. 

Is there a physical Sololu store I can visit?

At this time Sololu is exclusively based online at www.sololu.com. The clothing is currently only available on Indiegogo. 

 

If you have any other questions, please email me at hello@sololu.com.

 

I've worked on my clothing collection for almost two years, perfecting it and making sure it's exactly how I want it to be. I've been able to build a good relationship with my manufacturer in Bali, Indonesia over this past year and am confident that the clothing can be finished in July 2017. However, if my goal gets exceeded and I have to increase the bulk order quantity, delays may occur. Of course, I will make sure to keep you updated about the entire process.

I aim to offer a large range of seasonless, stylish pieces that make it easy for you to create outfits you feel most confident in – year-round.Here below you can find all the details of each piece in the collection. All 10 clothing designs will be available in the sizes: XS, S, M, L and XL. The preferred size can be selected when you check out. For measurements, please refer to the "Size Guide" section further down.  The Sololu jute tote bag is made of jute material and is the perfect tote to bring to the beach, markets or anywhere else. It is cotton lined, lightweight, sturdy and has our logo + website printed on one side. Measurements: 40cm x 35cm x 10cm  //  15.8" x 13.8" x 3.9" (LxHxD)  The white strapless top comes with a neck tie/choker and looks amazing on our shorts, skirt, pants and wide leg pants (designs 04, 07, 09 and 11, all below). However, you could also just wear them with your bikini bottoms and a straw hat for the ultimate chic beach look!

My (yes it's me!) measurements are: bust 82 cm, waist 66 cm, hips 86 cm, length 1.68 m  //  bust 32", waist 26", hips 34", length 5'5". All perks will be shipped with a 20% off discount coupon that can be used for a future order on my website www.sololu.com after the campaign has ended. All contributors will be added to the Sololu newsletter list and will receive exclusive offers, the latest news about Sololu, updates on new arrivals + restocked goods, and much more. Before placing your order, please check the measurements below to make sure you order the right size. Measurements should be taken directly on your body.Bust: Measure your chest over the fullest part of your bust while wearing a bra that fits.Waist: Measure your waist at the narrowest point.Hips: Your hips measurement should be measured around the fullest part of your hips.If the item you've ordered doesn't fit right, you will have 14 days from the receipt of the order to contact me at hello@sololu.com to request an exchange and send back the item. Once I've received your item, I will send you the right size (I can assist you with deciding on the right size). Shipping costs for an exchange will be your responsibility. As the Handwoven Bracelets and Sarongs have been made already, these can be shipped out right after the campaign ends. The Jute Tote Bags and clothing are expected to be shipped out in August 2017. Sololu is founded and started by me, Rosanne Hertogh, out of my passion for traveling and style. After a study in visual merchandising, interior design/styling and fashion styling, I moved with my family from the Netherlands to Canada in 2011 to start a new life. It has always been a dream to start my own fashion brand, so after some years of working in Canada and traveling through Asia, I decided to go for it. My adventurous spirit has not only helped cause an emigration with my family from the Netherlands to Canada, it has also led me to places all over the world and it helps me to live life to the fullest by trying new things and taking risks – stepping outside of my comfort zone. From living and working in Italy to hiking the Himalayas in Nepal and from kiteboarding in Mexico to skiing in the Alps, I've experienced it and am grateful for it! However, there’s still so much more to discover and experience. Exploring the world and enjoying its beauty will never get old, it makes me feel most alive.Sololu is a reflection of my personal style and my ideal lifestyle – being wherever you’re happy, doing whatever makes you happy and sharing this with whoever makes you happy. You are the key to my success. I would greatly appreciate it if you could spread the word and share my campaign. You can also follow Sololu on social media – the social media buttons below will send you to Sololu's profile on each platform, or subscribe to the Sololu newsletters at the bottom of my website www.sololu.com.  Thank you so much for your support and for being a part of this journey!                      Where will you ship from?All orders will ship from Ontario, Canada.Do you ship worldwide?Yes, orders within Canada will be shipped for $4 - $25, order to the USA will be shipped for $6 - $30 and international orders will be shipped for $10 - $60 depending on your selection and the weight of the products.When can I expect my order to arrive?All orders will ship within 1-8 weeks from the last day of the campaign. Shipping within Canada should take 2-9 days from the date of shipment. Shipping to the USA should take 4-8 days from the date of the shipment and shipping internationally should take 6-14 days from the date of the shipment. Does shipping include tracking?All Canada + USA orders will include tracking. All international orders don't have tracking included, as I want to keep shipping costs as low as possible for you. International shipping that includes tracking, is often double in cost. If you are willing to pay for shipping that includes tracking, please email me at hello@sololu.com.Contributors living outside of Canada will be responsible for the charges of duties and import taxes. These are charged once the package reaches its destination country and vary from country to country. They will not be included in the cost of shipping. You may contact your local customs office for further information related to customs charges.What if I purchased the wrong size?If the item you've ordered doesn't fit right, you will have 14 days from the receipt of the order to contact me to request an exchange and send back the item. Once I've received your item, I will send you the right size. Shipping costs for an exchange will be your responsibility. Please, make sure to check the size guide before placing an order.Is there a return policy?As I use the funding from Indiegogo to get the bulk production started (to make the clothing collection available to everyone around the globe), I won’t be able to accept returns.What if an item is not the color I thought it was?Please keep in mind that due to different computer monitors and display settings the actual product's colors may vary slightly from the colors in the product photos. I have made every effort to display the colors and images of the products as accurately as possible. However, I cannot guarantee that your computer monitor's screen displays the colors accurately. Is there a physical Sololu store I can visit?At this time Sololu is exclusively based online at www.sololu.com. The clothing is currently only available on Indiegogo.  If you have any other questions, please email me at hello@sololu.com. I've worked on my clothing collection for almost two years, perfecting it and making sure it's exactly how I want it to be. I've been able to build a good relationship with my manufacturer in Bali, Indonesia over this past year and am confident that the clothing can be finished in July 2017. However, if my goal gets exceeded and I have to increase the bulk order quantity, delays may occur. Of course, I will make sure to keep you updated about the entire process.

story:
YOU CAN NOW SHOP ALL OF OUR STYLES AT

LES-SUBLIMES.COM

 

 

CLIQUEZ ICI POUR LA VERSION FRANÇAISE

 

 

 

 



 

BEAUTIFUL WARDROBE ESSENTIALS. WITHOUT THE COMPROMISE.

 

 

 

 

We offer a curated closet of stylish investment pieces and beautiful wardrobe essentials for today’s global citizen. Designed to carry us effortlessly from brunch in Brooklyn to a safari in the Serengeti, these are the stylish yet simple pieces that we wear again and again. Our favorite essentials that we can’t live without.

 




 

OUR STORY

 

At Les Sublimes we create clothing that helps you make better quality shopping choices - essentials that embody your convictions, respect your integrity and enhance your style. No compromise necessary.

Proudly from Paris, all of our products are infused with luxury, comfort and effortless beauty. And by choosing to sell them directly to you online, they are still wallet-friendly. Most important of all, our entire collection is produced responsibly. Every Les Sublimes product is manufactured from start to finish with the intention to preserve our planet’s delicate ecosystems and improve the lives of the hardworking people who make each piece.

Who says we can't have it all?

 

 

 

 

 

WE BELIEVE IN

 

1. Style

Re-creating your favorite essentials with a fit that is just right, we infuse modern trends with an effortless, female aesthetic.

 

2. Luxury

We select high quality fabrics that are incredibly comfortable, soft and easy to wear. Then we transform them using superior craftsmanship into thoughtful, long-lasting designs.

 

3. Accessibility

By being online-only, we are able to make responsibly-made products available to you 24/7, no matter where you you live, and at a much more affordable price - no middlemen or expensive store-fronts needed here!

 

4. Low Environmental Impact

 

Being eco-friendly is our priority. Collections are made from organic, sustainably-harvested natural resources, using innovative technology that reduces water consumption, recovers waste & preserves neighboring ecosystems.

 

5. Living Wages

 

Our business model supports non-exploitative and gainful employment, providing good jobs in our home country of France and throughout our supply chain abroad.

 

 

6. Changing Lives

Every piece we sell directly supports garment workers, artisans, farmers, working mamas and families with a healthy wage and the freedom that comes with it. Good jobs lift families out of the cycle of poverty. Good jobs create permanent solutions.

 

 

Back to Top


 

GIVING BACK

 

 

WE BELIEVE THAT YOUNG GIRLS HAVE THE POWER TO END POVERTY AROUND THE WORLD.

 

WHEN A GIRL IS GIVEN THE CHANCE TO STAY IN SCHOOL...

  Gain access to reproductive education,  

  And delay marriage and pregnancy, 

 

SHE IS MUCH MORE LIKELY TO FIND GAINFUL EMPLOYMENT,

  Contribute financially to her household, 

  And earn the respect of her partner, family and community. 

 

BREAKING THE CYCLE OF POVERTY.

 

AND IT ALL STARTS WITH

ONE GIRL

 

Multiply that by the millions of girls living in poverty worldwide.

Imagine what a difference we can make!

 

 

 

 

Education For Girls

As girl bosses, global citizens and social innovators, we believe that all women have the same rights to freedom and happiness. Females are the single biggest solution to poverty worldwide. When a girl completes high school, she is much more likely to avoid teen pregnancy, find gainful employment, contribute financially to her household and earn the respect of her partner and community.  Thus breaking the cycle of poverty.

Our Les Sublimes supporters choose to be part of this long-term solution. Every time you purchase a piece of clothing from Les Sublimes, we pay it forward by supporting 1-month of education for a young girl in need. Because that's what being Sublimes is all about!
 

ONE PIECE. ONE GIRL. ONE MONTH.

Back to Top



 

THE

MADE IN FRANCE

COLLECTION

 

We don't change our styles every season. Instead, we offer a permanent collection of essential items. The everyday pieces that you want to wear all the time. We then build on our existing assortment by adding complimentary styles, seasonal colors and special fabrics.

 

We are proud to be a French brand. So we've decided to support home first. Introducing the Made in France Collection.

REWARDS TIMELINE

 

 

 

 

♥  We will ship your orders by September 30th, 2016  ♥

 

Back to Top



 

OUR PURPOSE

"Our purpose at Les Sublimes is to make people happy while respecting mother nature, and to represent a hope for a better future. This is the soul of what we do.

 

 

 

Les Sublimes exists to demonstrate that design, thoughtfulness and sustainability can be married in our consumption choices. We make people proud of the clothes they wear and the choices they make, proud that each decision can make a net-positive contribution to our natural surroundings, and demonstrate a new way of doing business for a collective future.

We know that a for-profit business with purpose can change people’s lives. Every time you shop Les Sublimes, you demand to see a new world. A world of beauty, mutual respect and integrity. That is what it means to be Sublimes.

 

 

A RESPONSIBLE COMPANY

 

We believe that integrity is just as important as style, price, quality and convenience. That’s why honesty and sustainability are integrated into every aspect of our business - from design and manufacturing, to killer customer service.

 

Availability & Accessibility

By engaging directly with our proud supporters online and working outside the traditional industry model, we are able to make sustainable products available to so many more people, at a much more affordable price. And that means that the social and environmental benefits of sustainable products can have a larger impact on the world around us. So much better, right?

 

Transparent Production

We believe that you have a right to know exactly where the products you love come from and how they are produced. As a responsible company, being transparent holds us accountable to everyone connected with our brand. But it also gives you the freedom to select only the best products available.

 

The Atelier

Confection Pérard in Renaison, France

It took us 6 months to find the perfect manufacturing partner to launch our Made in France collection. Confection Pérard is a small town atelier of master craftspeople specialized in making high quality knitwear. A 2nd-generation family business run by Thierry and Madame Pérard (mother + son), the atelier is one of the few surviving garment producers in the region. They credit their survival to their ethical values. Confection Pérard invests in training employees with a wide skill base, offers a flexible work schedule and guarantees high workplace standards. Many of their sewers have been with the company for over 20 years.

 

About The Founders

KACHEN HONG  ♥  Sustainability Guru

Holding a Masters degree from Sciences Po Paris, Kachen has over 7 years of work experience as a sustainability professional in Paris. She started her career as a consultant with BearingPoint, later moving to a boutique consulting firm specialized in sustainability and environment. Her expertise spans sustainable strategy development, green sector market analysis, and environmental policy assessment and advising. Born in Taiwan, Kachen split her youth between Taiwan, Venezuela and France, developing a strong penchant for travel and exotic cuisine.

ALEXIS ASSOIGNON  ♥  Fashion Expert

Alexis has over 8 years of experience working in the luxury fashion industry in New York City, London and Paris. A Finance graduate with a specialty in Fashion Marketing from Parsons The New School of Design, her professional expertise includes Wholesale, Merchandising, PR and Consulting. She has worked for notable brands including Michael Kors, Calvin Klein, Christian Louboutin and Dior. Originally from Canada, Alexis currently lives in Paris. She spends her spare time exploring Paris and traveling to far off destinations. 

 

Back to Top
 

 

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

 

We are asking for your support to order our first rolls of sustainable fabric! To make this first order a reality, we are raising € 10,000.

Fabric suppliers typically apply a 50% surcharge to smaller orders, making it impossible for us to maintain our affordable pricing and still earn a profit. By ordering our fabrics in bulk, we are able to get them at a much better price. And by selling our pieces directly to you online, we eliminate rent, middlemen and wholesale markups. Then we pass these savings on to you! That's how we can sell our clothes at between 25%-40% of the price of the luxury brands. Without any compromise.

 

    STRETCH GOALS

     

    Starting small doesn’t mean we can't dream big. Here are some of the things we are currently working on:

    If we surpass our target of € 10,000, we will re-invest the additional funds into growing Les Sublimes, adding 2 additional colors (grey and navy) and 5 new styles to our Made in France Collection.  We have already begun sourcing other luxurious, sustainable fabrics to add to our offering, including French linen, Peruvian organic pima cotton and cruelty-free cashmere from nomad communities in Mongolia.

    Staying true to our worldly roots, we are also planning to expand our network of manufacturing partners outside of France so that we can incorporate more of the incredible craftsmanship found all over the world. Our underlying motivation is to share a fair and honest social production model that breaks from traditional textile industry practices. 

     

     

    RISKS & CHALLENGES

     

    We've spent over a year planning our first collection and Indiegogo launch because we want to make sure that we get everything just right!

    Production Partner: We've visited our knitwear manufacturer in person to inspect their facility, meet their employees and review every single detail of their manufacturing process. With over 45 years of experience, we have full confidence in our little atelier and can tell you that they are just as excited about our project as we are.

    Ship date:  We've built in extra time for production and are confident we'll ship by the estimated dates, but there is always a small chance that things will take longer than planned. We'll keep you updated if anything changes :)

    Collection Items:  We have worked back and forth for 6 months with our sample and pattern makers to get the fit of our styles perfect and to ensure that everything is done to the highest quality and comfort standards.

    Our samples are production ready and our factory is simply waiting for us to place our first Les Sublimes order! We don't anticipate any problems, but should any hiccups arise, we'll keep you updated and in the loop on any new timelines.

    Learn about trust on Indiegogo

     

    Back to Top



     
       

      PLEASE NOTE

       

      Duty/VAT charges: If you live outside of the E.U., you will be responsible for any applicable duty/VAT charges that get applied during shipping.

       

      Exchanges: NOT QUITE WHAT YOU EXPECTED? NO WORRIES! We stand behind the products we create. If you need a different size, or if your order has arrived with a defect, please get in touch so that we can make it right. Email us at hello@les-sublimes.com within 14 days of receiving your order to get started. As a young brand, Les Sublimes cannot be responsible for paying any shipping charges for exchanges, except in the case of defective product.

      *We plan to also be able to offer returns in the near future when Les Sublimes is a bit bigger :)
       

       

       

       

       

       

       

       

      WWW.LES-SUBLIMES.COM

       

      Have a question but don't see the answer above, email us anytime at hello@les-sublimes.com and we will get back to you asap!

       

       

       

      Thank you for your support!

       

       

       

      A special thanks to everyone who made this campaign a reality. We couldn't have done it without you!

      • All of the amazing people on team Sublimes (Eva Liu, Joanna Fann, Dimitris Alevizos, Emma Moore & Camille Deybach) for working tirelessly these past months to make our launch a success - you guys rock our world!

      • Last but not least, our friends and family for their incredible support throughout the last year as we pursue our dreams

      VERSION FRANÇAISE

       

       

       

       

       

      ESSENTIELS DE LA GARDE-ROBE. SANS COMPROMIS.

       

       

      Les Sublimes offrent des essentiels de la garde-robe, classiques mais dans l’air du temps, pour les femmes inspirées par des voyages et des rencontres. Créées pour être portées à un brunch à Brooklyn ou en safari dans le Serengeti, ces pièces sont des parfaits intemporels que l’on souhaite porter encore et encore. Le tout sans aucun compromis sur l'éthique ou l'écologie. Aucun.

       




       

      NOTRE HISTOIRE

       

      Chez les Sublimes, nous créons des vêtements qui vous aident à faire un meilleur choix d’achat - des essentiels qui portent nos convictions, respectent notre intégrité et mettent en valeur notre style. Sans compromis.

      Les Sublimes offrent aux femmes un shopping différent, celui qui embellit le look et met du baume au cœur. Nos produits sont infusés de luxe, confort et style. Vendus directement aux consommateurs, leur prix reste accessible. Mais pas que. Chaque produit Les Sublimes est fabriqué avec l’intention de préserver l’écosystème délicat de notre planète et d’améliorer la vie des personnes ayant participé à la fabrication.

      Qui a dit qu’on ne pouvait pas tout avoir ?

       

       

       

       

       

      SIX MOTS POUR DEFINIR LES SUBLIMES

       

      1. Style

      En recréant nos essentiels favoris avec une coupe parfaite, nous infusons les tendances modernes avec un esthétisme féminin et chic-nonchalant.

      2. Luxe

      Nous sélectionnons des matières de grande qualité avec un confort incroyable, doux et facile à porter. Puis nous les confectionnons en France pour bénéficier du savoir-faire français, donnant naissance à des modèles bien pensés et intemporels.

      3. Prix abordable

      100% en ligne et sans intermédiaire, ce modèle nous permet de proposer nos produits de qualité luxe à prix abordable : environ 40% du prix pratiqué par des maisons de luxe.

      4. Faible impact environnemental

       

      La réduction des impacts environnementaux de nos produits est notre priorité. La collection est réalisée à partir de matières premières naturelles, et transformées en utilisant des technologies de pointes qui réduisent la consommation d’eau et d’énergie, favorisent la réutilisation des déchets et préservent l’écosystème local.

       

      5. Juste traitement

       

      Les artisans et ouvriers ayant contribué à fabriquer nos produits reçoivent un salaire décent et bénéficient des droits fondamentaux au travail. Nous comptons exporter ce modèle social engagé vers nos futurs partenaires étrangers.

       

       

      6. Espoir

      Nous souhaitons apporter des solutions permanentes aux travailleurs de l’industrie du textile, avec des bons emplois qui briseraient la transmission de la pauvreté.

       

       

      Retour en haut


       

      REDONNER A LA SOCIÉTÉ

       

       

      NOUS PENSONS QUE LES FILLES SONT LA SOLUTION POUR METTRE FIN A LA PAUVRETÉ DANS LE MONDE.

       

      En tant qu’entrepreneuses, citoyennes du monde et innovatrices sociales, nous croyons que toutes les femmes ont les mêmes droits à la liberté et au bonheur dont nous sommes heureuses de proclamer. Les femmes sont une grande solution contre la pauvreté dans le monde. 

      Une fille qui termine son parcours scolaire a meilleure chance d’éviter une grossesse adolescente, trouver un emploi, contribuer financièrement au foyer, gagner le respect de ses partenaires et de sa communauté. Ainsi elle brise le cercle de la pauvreté.

      Chaque fois que vous achetez une pièce chez Les Sublimes, nous nous engageons à financer un mois d’école à une jeune fille au Kenya et au Népal, à travers des ONG locales. Soyez Sublimes jusqu’au bout!

       

      UNE PIÈCE. UNE FILLE. UN MOIS.

       

      Retour en haut



       

      UNE COLLECTION

      MADE IN FRANCE

       

      Nous offrons une collection permanente de pièces incontournables. Les essentiels de tous les jours que vous désirez porter tout le temps. Puis, nous rajoutons régulièrement des styles nouveaux, couleurs tendance ou matières en édition limitée.

       

      Il nous a semblé naturel de produire chez nous. Non pas sans fierté. 

      Voici la collection Made in France.

      COMMENT ACHETER?

Saisissez vos coordonnées, puis cliquez sur "Se connecter à PayPal" (pas d'inquiétude, vous n'avez pas besoin  de créer un compte). Saisissez les données de votre carte bleue comme pour un achat en ligne classique. Et le tour est joué!

      A PROPOS DE STOCKHOLM

      Une version ravissante d’un classique casual, notre t-shirt vous rendra prête pour toutes les occasions. On dit qu’il est addict. Portez-le à vos propres risques.

       

       

      DETAILS

      LUXUEUX T-SHIRT MANCHES LONGUES «POKHARA»

      59 €

       

       

       

       

      A PROPOS DE POKHARA

      Le plus doux des t-shirts que l’on sent à peine. Notre t-shirt luxueux à manches longues fait le compagnon discret des jeans, jupes ajustées ou tout simplement de votre pièce préférée.

      DETAILS

      Tailles XS - XL // Disponible en rosé, blanc et noir

      94% Lenzing Micro-Modal ©, 6% Élasthanne // Lavage à l'eau froide

       

       

       

       

      LUXUEUX DÉBARDEUR «TOKYO»

      45 €

       

       

       

       

      A PROPOS DE TOKYO

      La grâce d’une ballerine rencontre la simplicité moderne d’une femme dans cet essentiel casual féminin. Tokyo offre un petit twist par rapport au débardeur simple, est-ce le petit détail qui change tout ? oh oui.

      DETAILS

      LA ROBE «LONDON»

      89 € 

       

       

       

       

      A PROPOS DE LONDON

      Cette robe confortable est faite pour les jours où vous ne voulez pas avoir à choisir entre le style, la fonctionnalité ou le confort. La simplicité de London vous suivra sans efforts du jour à la nuit. Changez juste votre rouge à lèvre.

      DETAILS

      Tailles XS - XL  //  Disponible en gris

      97% Coton bio certifié GOTS, 3% Élasthanne  //  Lavage à l'eau froide

       
       

      LA ROBE NOIRE «BUENOS AIRES»

      109 €

       

       

       

      A PROPOS DE BUENOS AIRES

      Inspirée par de longues soirées en ville, Buenos Aires est la robe parfaite pour célébrer la soirée. Enfilez-la et vous êtes prête à passer la porte. Elle est classique, casual-chic et incroyablement féminine. Tout en un.

      DETAILS

      Sizes XS - L  //  Disponible en noir

      94% Lenzing Micro-Modal ©, 6% Élasthanne //  Lavage à l'eau froide



       

      SAC DE SHOPPING «MES AVENTURES EN TOTE»

      10 €

       

       

       

       

       

      DETAILS

      Disponible en écru / sérigraphie rose

      37cm x 35cm //  100% Coton bio certifié GOTS

      Lavage à l'eau froide

       

      Retour en haut



       

      NOS FIBRES

       

       

       

       

      Lenzing Modal

       

       

      Le modal que nous utilisons est réalisé à base de pulpe de bois de hêtre, issu de forêts autrichiennes certifiées. La pulpe est traitée par la très innovante entreprise autrichienne Lenzing qui utilise un procédé peu gourmand en énergie et eau, et dont les substances chimiques sont recyclées à 95%. Le tout a lieu en Autriche. Cette fibre est ensuite tricotée par une entreprise autrichienne. 

      Certifié  OekoTex Standard 100.

       

       

       

       

       

       

      Coton bio certifié GOTS

       

      Le coton utilisé chez Les Sublimes est certifié GOTS. Il est issu de l’agriculture biologique (absence d’insecticide, de pesticide, d’engrais chimiques, d’OGM ; consommation d’eau réduite de moitié ; rotation des cultures). Ensuite, à toutes les étapes de transformation, les procédés utilisés sont respectueux de l'environnement et de la santé (les métaux lourds, les formaldéhydes, les enzymes OGM et les amines cancérigènes sont interdits). De plus, les agriculteurs et les travailleurs reçoivent une rétribution financière juste (prix d’achat du coton ou salaires), et bénéficient de bonnes conditions de travail. C’est donc du commerce équitable. Le coton est ensuite filé en Italie, puis édité par une grande maison française située dans l'Aube. 

      Certifié  OekoTex Standard 100.

       

       

       

      Retour en haut


       
       

      CALENDRIER

       

      La campagne dure 31 jours (du 20/06/2016 au 21/07/2016). La production des tissus aura lieu en août, puis la fabrication des vêtements en septembre.

       

      ♥  Les produits seront livrés fin septembre 2016.  ♥

       

       

      Retour en haut


       
       

      UNE ENTREPRISE RESPONSABLE

       

      Nous sommes convaincus que l'empreinte sociale et environnementale est tout aussi important que le style, le prix, la qualité et le confort. C’est pourquoi nous avons intégré des critères sociaux et environnementaux tout au long de notre chaîne, du design à la production, sans oublier le transport et le packaging.

       

      Production transparente

      Nous pensons que vous avez le droit de connaître exactement où les produits que vous adorez proviennent et comment ils ont été produits. Etant une entreprise responsable, nous avons une responsabilité envers chaque personne liée à notre marque.

       

      Notre Atelier

      Confection Pérard à Renaison, France

      Nous allons produire notre première collection dans un atelier familial à Renaison, en région roannaise, où 10 personnes sont employées en CDI. La région, comme beaucoup d’autres, a été ravagée par la délocalisation de l’industrie du textile. En 2005, il y avait encore 100 ateliers de confection à Renaison, et aujourd’hui il n’en reste que 9.

      90% du prix de vente de nos vêtements est directement injecté dans l'économie locale, soutenant 4 PME françaises. La production 100% européenne garantie également les conditions de travail et le salaire des travailleurs.

       

      Les co-fondatrices

      KACHEN HONG  ♥  Sustainability Guru

      Diplômée de Sciences Po Paris, Kachen a 7 ans d’expériences professionnelles dans le conseil en développement durable. Elle a commencé sa carrière en tant que consultante généraliste chez un grand cabinet, avant de rejoindre un cabinet spécialisé dans le développement durable. Ses domaines d’expertises sont : développement de stratégies environnementales, analyse de « green » secteurs, évaluation de politiques environnementales et conseil opérationnel. Née à Taiwan, Kachen a passé son enfance à Taiwan, au Venezuela et en France, d’où sa passion pour les voyages et les cuisines exotiques.

      ALEXIS ASSOIGNON  ♥  Fashion Expert

      Alexis a travaillé pendant 8 ans dans des grandes maisons de la mode à New York, Londres, Paris et Vancouver. Diplômée d’un bachelor en Finance, elle s’est spécialisée en Marketing de la Mode à la Parsons School de New York. Son éventail d’expertise inclut la vente, le marketing, les relations publiques et le conseil. Elle a travaillé pour des grandes maisons comme Michael Kors, Calvin Klein, Christian Louboutin et Dior. Originaire du Canada, Alexis vit aujourd’hui à Paris. Elle passe son temps libre à explorer la ville et voyager dans des destinations lointaines.

       

      Retour en haut
       

       

       

      OBJECTIF

       

      10 000 euros. Les fonds collectés serviront à l’achat des tissus en grande quantité, afin de bénéficier d’un prix sans majoration. En effet, à faible quantité, une majoration de 50% est appliquée. Les fonds au-delà des 10 000 euros serviront à ajouter des couleurs (bleu marine et gris) et styles à la collection.

       

         

        Retour en haut



         
           

          A NOTER

           

          Frais de douane: Si vous résidez en dehors de l’UE, des taxes supplémentaires peuvent être appliquées à la douane et restent à votre charge.

           

          Echanges: Vos achats seront produits après la commande, il nous est donc difficile de procéder à un remboursement. En revanche, nous pouvons vous proposer un échange de produit. Les frais de port resteront à votre charge sauf en cas de produit défectueux.
           

           

           

           

           

           

           

           

          WWW.LES-SUBLIMES.COM

           

          Si vous avez des questions, n'hésitez pas à nous envoyer un petit mail au hello@les-sublimes.com

YOU CAN NOW SHOP ALL OF OUR STYLES ATLES-SUBLIMES.COM  CLIQUEZ ICI POUR LA VERSION FRANÇAISE   
  
 BEAUTIFUL WARDROBE ESSENTIALS. WITHOUT THE COMPROMISE.
 
   
We offer a curated closet of stylish investment pieces and beautiful wardrobe essentials for today’s global citizen. Designed to carry us effortlessly from brunch in Brooklyn to a safari in the Serengeti, these are the stylish yet simple pieces that we wear again and again. Our favorite essentials that we can’t live without.
 
 OUR STORY
 
At Les Sublimes we create clothing that helps you make better quality shopping choices - essentials that embody your convictions, respect your integrity and enhance your style. No compromise necessary.
Proudly from Paris, all of our products are infused with luxury, comfort and effortless beauty. And by choosing to sell them directly to you online, they are still wallet-friendly. Most important of all, our entire collection is produced responsibly. Every Les Sublimes product is manufactured from start to finish with the intention to preserve our planet’s delicate ecosystems and improve the lives of the hardworking people who make each piece.
Who says we can't have it all?
 

 
 
 
 
WE BELIEVE IN 
1. Style
Re-creating your favorite essentials with a fit that is just right, we infuse modern trends with an effortless, female aesthetic.

 
2. Luxury
We select high quality fabrics that are incredibly comfortable, soft and easy to wear. Then we transform them using superior craftsmanship into thoughtful, long-lasting designs.
 
3. Accessibility
By being online-only, we are able to make responsibly-made products available to you 24/7, no matter where you you live, and at a much more affordable price - no middlemen or expensive store-fronts needed here!
 
4. Low Environmental Impact
 
Being eco-friendly is our priority. Collections are made from organic, sustainably-harvested natural resources, using innovative technology that reduces water consumption, recovers waste & preserves neighboring ecosystems.
 
5. Living Wages
 
Our business model supports non-exploitative and gainful employment, providing good jobs in our home country of France and throughout our supply chain abroad.
 
 
6. Changing Lives
Every piece we sell directly supports garment workers, artisans, farmers, working mamas and families with a healthy wage and the freedom that comes with it. Good jobs lift families out of the cycle of poverty. Good jobs create permanent solutions.
 
  Back to Top GIVING BACK
 
 
WE BELIEVE THAT YOUNG GIRLS HAVE THE POWER TO END POVERTY AROUND THE WORLD. WHEN A GIRL IS GIVEN THE CHANCE TO STAY IN SCHOOL...
  Gain access to reproductive education,       And delay marriage and pregnancy,       SHE IS MUCH MORE LIKELY TO FIND GAINFUL EMPLOYMENT,
  Contribute financially to her household,      And earn the respect of her partner, family and community.       BREAKING THE CYCLE OF POVERTY. AND IT ALL STARTS WITH
ONE GIRL Multiply that by the millions of girls living in poverty worldwide. 
Imagine what a difference we can make! 
 
    Education For GirlsAs girl bosses, global citizens and social innovators, we believe that all women have the same rights to freedom and happiness. Females are the single biggest solution to poverty worldwide. When a girl completes high school, she is much more likely to avoid teen pregnancy, find gainful employment, contribute financially to her household and earn the respect of her partner and community.  Thus breaking the cycle of poverty.Our Les Sublimes supporters choose to be part of this long-term solution. Every time you purchase a piece of clothing from Les Sublimes, we pay it forward by supporting 1-month of education for a young girl in need. Because that's what being Sublimes is all about! ONE PIECE. ONE GIRL. ONE MONTH. Back to Top THE
MADE IN FRANCE
COLLECTION
 
We don't change our styles every season. Instead, we offer a permanent collection of essential items. The everyday pieces that you want to wear all the time. We then build on our existing assortment by adding complimentary styles, seasonal colors and special fabrics.
 

We are proud to be a French brand. So we've decided to support home first. Introducing the Made in France Collection.

  Back to Top OUR FABRICS
    
Lenzing Modal
 
 
94% Lenzing Micro-Modal ©, 6% Spandex
OekoTex Standard 100
 
  
 
  GOTS Organic Cotton
97% Organic Cotton, 3% Spandex
Global Organic Textile Standard ♥ OekoTex Standard 100
 
 
 

  Back to Top  REWARDS TIMELINE 
 
 
 ♥  We will ship your orders by September 30th, 2016  ♥
  Back to Top OUR PURPOSE

"Our purpose at Les Sublimes is to make people happy while respecting mother nature, and to represent a hope for a better future. This is the soul of what we do.
 
 
 Les Sublimes exists to demonstrate that design, thoughtfulness and sustainability can be married in our consumption choices. We make people proud of the clothes they wear and the choices they make, proud that each decision can make a net-positive contribution to our natural surroundings, and demonstrate a new way of doing business for a collective future.
We know that a for-profit business with purpose can change people’s lives. Every time you shop Les Sublimes, you demand to see a new world. A world of beauty, mutual respect and integrity. That is what it means to be Sublimes.
  A RESPONSIBLE COMPANY We believe that integrity is just as important as style, price, quality and convenience. That’s why honesty and sustainability are integrated into every aspect of our business - from design and manufacturing, to killer customer service.
 
Availability & Accessibility
By engaging directly with our proud supporters online and working outside the traditional industry model, we are able to make sustainable products available to so many more people, at a much more affordable price. And that means that the social and environmental benefits of sustainable products can have a larger impact on the world around us. So much better, right? Transparent Production
We believe that you have a right to know exactly where the products you love come from and how they are produced. As a responsible company, being transparent holds us accountable to everyone connected with our brand. But it also gives you the freedom to select only the best products available. The Atelier
Confection Pérard in Renaison, France

It took us 6 months to find the perfect manufacturing partner to launch our Made in France collection. Confection Pérard is a small town atelier of master craftspeople specialized in making high quality knitwear. A 2nd-generation family business run by Thierry and Madame Pérard (mother + son), the atelier is one of the few surviving garment producers in the region. They credit their survival to their ethical values. Confection Pérard invests in training employees with a wide skill base, offers a flexible work schedule and guarantees high workplace standards. Many of their sewers have been with the company for over 20 years.
 
About The Founders
KACHEN HONG  ♥  Sustainability Guru 
Holding a Masters degree from Sciences Po Paris, Kachen has over 7 years of work experience as a sustainability professional in Paris. She started her career as a consultant with BearingPoint, later moving to a boutique consulting firm specialized in sustainability and environment. Her expertise spans sustainable strategy development, green sector market analysis, and environmental policy assessment and advising. Born in Taiwan, Kachen split her youth between Taiwan, Venezuela and France, developing a strong penchant for travel and exotic cuisine.
ALEXIS ASSOIGNON  ♥  Fashion ExpertAlexis has over 8 years of experience working in the luxury fashion industry in New York City, London and Paris. A Finance graduate with a specialty in Fashion Marketing from Parsons The New School of Design, her professional expertise includes Wholesale, Merchandising, PR and Consulting. She has worked for notable brands including Michael Kors, Calvin Klein, Christian Louboutin and Dior. Originally from Canada, Alexis currently lives in Paris. She spends her spare time exploring Paris and traveling to far off destinations.  
Back to Top 
  WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET We are asking for your support to order our first rolls of sustainable fabric! To make this first order a reality, we are raising € 10,000.
Fabric suppliers typically apply a 50% surcharge to smaller orders, making it impossible for us to maintain our affordable pricing and still earn a profit. By ordering our fabrics in bulk, we are able to get them at a much better price. And by selling our pieces directly to you online, we eliminate rent, middlemen and wholesale markups. Then we pass these savings on to you! That's how we can sell our clothes at between 25%-40% of the price of the luxury brands. Without any compromise.
 


STRETCH GOALS Starting small doesn’t mean we can't dream big. Here are some of the things we are currently working on:
If we surpass our target of € 10,000, we will re-invest the additional funds into growing Les Sublimes, adding 2 additional colors (grey and navy) and 5 new styles to our Made in France Collection.  We have already begun sourcing other luxurious, sustainable fabrics to add to our offering, including French linen, Peruvian organic pima cotton and cruelty-free cashmere from nomad communities in Mongolia.
Staying true to our worldly roots, we are also planning to expand our network of manufacturing partners outside of France so that we can incorporate more of the incredible craftsmanship found all over the world. Our underlying motivation is to share a fair and honest social production model that breaks from traditional textile industry practices.   
RISKS & CHALLENGES We've spent over a year planning our first collection and Indiegogo launch because we want to make sure that we get everything just right!
Production Partner: We've visited our knitwear manufacturer in person to inspect their facility, meet their employees and review every single detail of their manufacturing process. With over 45 years of experience, we have full confidence in our little atelier and can tell you that they are just as excited about our project as we are.
Ship date:  We've built in extra time for production and are confident we'll ship by the estimated dates, but there is always a small chance that things will take longer than planned. We'll keep you updated if anything changes :)
Collection Items:  We have worked back and forth for 6 months with our sample and pattern makers to get the fit of our styles perfect and to ensure that everything is done to the highest quality and comfort standards.
Our samples are production ready and our factory is simply waiting for us to place our first Les Sublimes order! We don't anticipate any problems, but should any hiccups arise, we'll keep you updated and in the loop on any new timelines.
Learn about trust on Indiegogo
 
Back to Top
 
 PLEASE NOTE Duty/VAT charges: If you live outside of the E.U., you will be responsible for any applicable duty/VAT charges that get applied during shipping. Exchanges: NOT QUITE WHAT YOU EXPECTED? NO WORRIES! We stand behind the products we create. If you need a different size, or if your order has arrived with a defect, please get in touch so that we can make it right. Email us at hello@les-sublimes.com within 14 days of receiving your order to get started. As a young brand, Les Sublimes cannot be responsible for paying any shipping charges for exchanges, except in the case of defective product.*We plan to also be able to offer returns in the near future when Les Sublimes is a bit bigger :)         WWW.LES-SUBLIMES.COM Have a question but don't see the answer above, email us anytime at hello@les-sublimes.com and we will get back to you asap!    Thank you for your support!   A special thanks to everyone who made this campaign a reality. We couldn't have done it without you!
All of the amazing people on team Sublimes (Eva Liu, Joanna Fann, Dimitris Alevizos, Emma Moore & Camille Deybach) for working tirelessly these past months to make our launch a success - you guys rock our world!
Louise Kragh from Louise Kragh Photography

Dan Delgado from Makeup by Dan Delgado

Fanny Marty - Campaign Video Filmmaker + Director (fannymarty@ymail.com)
Tom Barratt-Larcombe - Campaign Video Film Editing + Post Production

Suada Rrahmani - our photoshoot model

Julia Antunes-Vallerey - our film model
Last but not least, our friends and family for their incredible support throughout the last year as we pursue our dreams
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
   VERSION FRANÇAISE     ESSENTIELS DE LA GARDE-ROBE. SANS COMPROMIS.  
Les Sublimes offrent des essentiels de la garde-robe, classiques mais dans l’air du temps, pour les femmes inspirées par des voyages et des rencontres. Créées pour être portées à un brunch à Brooklyn ou en safari dans le Serengeti, ces pièces sont des parfaits intemporels que l’on souhaite porter encore et encore. Le tout sans aucun compromis sur l'éthique ou l'écologie. Aucun.
 
 NOTRE HISTOIRE
 
Chez les Sublimes, nous créons des vêtements qui vous aident à faire un meilleur choix d’achat - des essentiels qui portent nos convictions, respectent notre intégrité et mettent en valeur notre style. Sans compromis.
Les Sublimes offrent aux femmes un shopping différent, celui qui embellit le look et met du baume au cœur. Nos produits sont infusés de luxe, confort et style. Vendus directement aux consommateurs, leur prix reste accessible. Mais pas que. Chaque produit Les Sublimes est fabriqué avec l’intention de préserver l’écosystème délicat de notre planète et d’améliorer la vie des personnes ayant participé à la fabrication.
Qui a dit qu’on ne pouvait pas tout avoir ?
 

 
 
 
 
SIX MOTS POUR DEFINIR LES SUBLIMES 
1. Style
En recréant nos essentiels favoris avec une coupe parfaite, nous infusons les tendances modernes avec un esthétisme féminin et chic-nonchalant.

2. Luxe
Nous sélectionnons des matières de grande qualité avec un confort incroyable, doux et facile à porter. Puis nous les confectionnons en France pour bénéficier du savoir-faire français, donnant naissance à des modèles bien pensés et intemporels.
3. Prix abordable
100% en ligne et sans intermédiaire, ce modèle nous permet de proposer nos produits de qualité luxe à prix abordable : environ 40% du prix pratiqué par des maisons de luxe.
4. Faible impact environnemental
 
La réduction des impacts environnementaux de nos produits est notre priorité. La collection est réalisée à partir de matières premières naturelles, et transformées en utilisant des technologies de pointes qui réduisent la consommation d’eau et d’énergie, favorisent la réutilisation des déchets et préservent l’écosystème local.
 
5. Juste traitement
 
Les artisans et ouvriers ayant contribué à fabriquer nos produits reçoivent un salaire décent et bénéficient des droits fondamentaux au travail. Nous comptons exporter ce modèle social engagé vers nos futurs partenaires étrangers.
 
 
6. Espoir
Nous souhaitons apporter des solutions permanentes aux travailleurs de l’industrie du textile, avec des bons emplois qui briseraient la transmission de la pauvreté.
 
  Retour en haut REDONNER A LA SOCIÉTÉ
 
 
NOUS PENSONS QUE LES FILLES SONT LA SOLUTION POUR METTRE FIN A LA PAUVRETÉ DANS LE MONDE.
 
En tant qu’entrepreneuses, citoyennes du monde et innovatrices sociales, nous croyons que toutes les femmes ont les mêmes droits à la liberté et au bonheur dont nous sommes heureuses de proclamer. Les femmes sont une grande solution contre la pauvreté dans le monde. 
Une fille qui termine son parcours scolaire a meilleure chance d’éviter une grossesse adolescente, trouver un emploi, contribuer financièrement au foyer, gagner le respect de ses partenaires et de sa communauté. Ainsi elle brise le cercle de la pauvreté.
Chaque fois que vous achetez une pièce chez Les Sublimes, nous nous engageons à financer un mois d’école à une jeune fille au Kenya et au Népal, à travers des ONG locales. Soyez Sublimes jusqu’au bout! UNE PIÈCE. UNE FILLE. UN MOIS.
  Retour en haut UNE COLLECTION
MADE IN FRANCE
 
Nous offrons une collection permanente de pièces incontournables. Les essentiels de tous les jours que vous désirez porter tout le temps. Puis, nous rajoutons régulièrement des styles nouveaux, couleurs tendance ou matières en édition limitée.
 

Il nous a semblé naturel de produire chez nous. Non pas sans fierté. 
Voici la collection Made in France.
 

Robe London
  
Robe London
  
Débardeur Paris Tank + Sac de shopping "Mes aventures en tote"
 

Débardeur Paris Tank + Sac de shopping "Mes aventures en tote"
  
T-shirt manches longues Pokhara
 
  Retour en haut  
COMMENT ACHETER?
Vous pouvez sélectionner un des "paniers d'achat" affichés en colonne sur la partie droite de la page, en cliquant sur "Obtenir cette contrepartie". Saisissez vos coordonnées, puis cliquez sur "Se connecter à PayPal" (pas d'inquiétude, vous n'avez pas besoin  de créer un compte). Saisissez les données de votre carte bleue comme pour un achat en ligne classique. Et le tour est joué!
 
   
LUXUEUX DÉBARDEUR «PARIS»
45 €
 
Offre spéciale « Early bird » 35€ (50 articles disponibles à ce prix)
  
 
 
 
 A PROPOS DE PARIS
Cette adaptation française d’un basique sans manches vous laisse vous sentir tout sauf ennuyeuse. La coupe décontractée couplée avec une encolure élégante vous garde chic et tendance, sans sacrifier un instant de confort toute la journée.
 
 
DETAILS
Tailles XS - XL // Disponible en rosé, blanc et noir
94% Lenzing Micro-Modal ©, 6% Élasthanne // Lavage à l'eau froide
  LUXUEUX T-SHIRT MANCHES COURTES «STOCKHOLM»
49 €
 
Offre spéciale « Early bird » 39€ (50 articles disponibles à ce prix)
  
 
 
 A PROPOS DE STOCKHOLM
Une version ravissante d’un classique casual, notre t-shirt vous rendra prête pour toutes les occasions. On dit qu’il est addict. Portez-le à vos propres risques.
 
 
DETAILS
Tailles XS - XL // Disponible en rosé, blanc et noir
94% Lenzing Micro-Modal ©, 6% Élasthanne // Lavage à l'eau froide
    LUXUEUX T-SHIRT MANCHES LONGUES «POKHARA»
59 € 
 
 
 A PROPOS DE POKHARA
Le plus doux des t-shirts que l’on sent à peine. Notre t-shirt luxueux à manches longues fait le compagnon discret des jeans, jupes ajustées ou tout simplement de votre pièce préférée.
DETAILS
Tailles XS - XL // Disponible en rosé, blanc et noir
94% Lenzing Micro-Modal ©, 6% Élasthanne // Lavage à l'eau froide
    LUXUEUX DÉBARDEUR «TOKYO»
45 € 
 
 

 
A PROPOS DE TOKYO
La grâce d’une ballerine rencontre la simplicité moderne d’une femme dans cet essentiel casual féminin. Tokyo offre un petit twist par rapport au débardeur simple, est-ce le petit détail qui change tout ? oh oui.
DETAILS
Tailles XS - XL // Disponible en rosé, blanc et noir
94% Lenzing Micro-Modal ©, 6% Élasthanne // Lavage à l'eau froide
    LA ROBE «LONDON»
89 €  
 
 
 A PROPOS DE LONDON
Cette robe confortable est faite pour les jours où vous ne voulez pas avoir à choisir entre le style, la fonctionnalité ou le confort. La simplicité de London vous suivra sans efforts du jour à la nuit. Changez juste votre rouge à lèvre.
DETAILS
Tailles XS - XL  //  Disponible en gris
97% Coton bio certifié GOTS, 3% Élasthanne  //  Lavage à l'eau froide
  LA ROBE NOIRE «BUENOS AIRES»
109 € 
 

 
A PROPOS DE BUENOS AIRES
Inspirée par de longues soirées en ville, Buenos Aires est la robe parfaite pour célébrer la soirée. Enfilez-la et vous êtes prête à passer la porte. Elle est classique, casual-chic et incroyablement féminine. Tout en un.
DETAILS
Sizes XS - L  //  Disponible en noir
94% Lenzing Micro-Modal ©, 6% Élasthanne //  Lavage à l'eau froide
 SAC DE SHOPPING «MES AVENTURES EN TOTE»
10 €  
 
 

 
DETAILS
Disponible en écru / sérigraphie rose
37cm x 35cm //  100% Coton bio certifié GOTS
Lavage à l'eau froide
 
Retour en haut NOS FIBRES
    
Lenzing Modal
 
 
Le modal que nous utilisons est réalisé à base de pulpe de bois de hêtre, issu de forêts autrichiennes certifiées. La pulpe est traitée par la très innovante entreprise autrichienne Lenzing qui utilise un procédé peu gourmand en énergie et eau, et dont les substances chimiques sont recyclées à 95%. Le tout a lieu en Autriche. Cette fibre est ensuite tricotée par une entreprise autrichienne. 
Certifié  OekoTex Standard 100.
 
 
 
 
  Coton bio certifié GOTS
 
Le coton utilisé chez Les Sublimes est certifié GOTS. Il est issu de l’agriculture biologique (absence d’insecticide, de pesticide, d’engrais chimiques, d’OGM ; consommation d’eau réduite de moitié ; rotation des cultures). Ensuite, à toutes les étapes de transformation, les procédés utilisés sont respectueux de l'environnement et de la santé (les métaux lourds, les formaldéhydes, les enzymes OGM et les amines cancérigènes sont interdits). De plus, les agriculteurs et les travailleurs reçoivent une rétribution financière juste (prix d’achat du coton ou salaires), et bénéficient de bonnes conditions de travail. C’est donc du commerce équitable. Le coton est ensuite filé en Italie, puis édité par une grande maison française située dans l'Aube. 
Certifié  OekoTex Standard 100.
 
 
  Retour en haut  CALENDRIER La campagne dure 31 jours (du 20/06/2016 au 21/07/2016). La production des tissus aura lieu en août, puis la fabrication des vêtements en septembre. ♥  Les produits seront livrés fin septembre 2016.  ♥
 
  Retour en haut  UNE ENTREPRISE RESPONSABLE Nous sommes convaincus que l'empreinte sociale et environnementale est tout aussi important que le style, le prix, la qualité et le confort. C’est pourquoi nous avons intégré des critères sociaux et environnementaux tout au long de notre chaîne, du design à la production, sans oublier le transport et le packaging.
 
Production transparente
Nous pensons que vous avez le droit de connaître exactement où les produits que vous adorez proviennent et comment ils ont été produits. Etant une entreprise responsable, nous avons une responsabilité envers chaque personne liée à notre marque. Notre Atelier
Confection Pérard à Renaison, France

Nous allons produire notre première collection dans un atelier familial à Renaison, en région roannaise, où 10 personnes sont employées en CDI. La région, comme beaucoup d’autres, a été ravagée par la délocalisation de l’industrie du textile. En 2005, il y avait encore 100 ateliers de confection à Renaison, et aujourd’hui il n’en reste que 9.
90% du prix de vente de nos vêtements est directement injecté dans l'économie locale, soutenant 4 PME françaises. La production 100% européenne garantie également les conditions de travail et le salaire des travailleurs.
 
Les co-fondatrices
KACHEN HONG  ♥  Sustainability Guru 
Diplômée de Sciences Po Paris, Kachen a 7 ans d’expériences professionnelles dans le conseil en développement durable. Elle a commencé sa carrière en tant que consultante généraliste chez un grand cabinet, avant de rejoindre un cabinet spécialisé dans le développement durable. Ses domaines d’expertises sont : développement de stratégies environnementales, analyse de « green » secteurs, évaluation de politiques environnementales et conseil opérationnel. Née à Taiwan, Kachen a passé son enfance à Taiwan, au Venezuela et en France, d’où sa passion pour les voyages et les cuisines exotiques.
ALEXIS ASSOIGNON  ♥  Fashion ExpertAlexis a travaillé pendant 8 ans dans des grandes maisons de la mode à New York, Londres, Paris et Vancouver. Diplômée d’un bachelor en Finance, elle s’est spécialisée en Marketing de la Mode à la Parsons School de New York. Son éventail d’expertise inclut la vente, le marketing, les relations publiques et le conseil. Elle a travaillé pour des grandes maisons comme Michael Kors, Calvin Klein, Christian Louboutin et Dior. Originaire du Canada, Alexis vit aujourd’hui à Paris. Elle passe son temps libre à explorer la ville et voyager dans des destinations lointaines. 
Retour en haut 
  OBJECTIF 10 000 euros. Les fonds collectés serviront à l’achat des tissus en grande quantité, afin de bénéficier d’un prix sans majoration. En effet, à faible quantité, une majoration de 50% est appliquée. Les fonds au-delà des 10 000 euros serviront à ajouter des couleurs (bleu marine et gris) et styles à la collection.
 

 
Retour en haut
 
 A NOTER Frais de douane: Si vous résidez en dehors de l’UE, des taxes supplémentaires peuvent être appliquées à la douane et restent à votre charge. Echanges: Vos achats seront produits après la commande, il nous est donc difficile de procéder à un remboursement. En revanche, nous pouvons vous proposer un échange de produit. Les frais de port resteront à votre charge sauf en cas de produit défectueux.         WWW.LES-SUBLIMES.COM Si vous avez des questions, n'hésitez pas à nous envoyer un petit mail au hello@les-sublimes.com

story:
Short Summary

Dear Friends, Family, Loved Ones and World,

My name is Samantha Erbe and I am a first time mother of Baby Tabitha. She is a miracle baby who saved her parent's life. Her father and I were in the middle of deep, dark addiction when we found we were pregnant. We investigated all options. At first, we thought abortion was the most loving option but I found that choice was not in my truth and I couldn't follow through so, I instantly got sober. The next path was adoption. I met with multiple agencies and even a few couples who will hopefully be wonderful parents one day but nothing felt right for my baby. So, I investigated parenting and discovered a reason to live.

2 weeks after my daughter was born, I committed myself to an intensive inpatient treatment program (Tabitha was able to come with me). We were in treatment for 14 weeks and the therapy and training I received is invaluable. I am extremely grateful for the opportunity, the help I have received thus far and most importantly for my primary motivation, Baby Tabitha.

Tabitha's father is also sober (he's on the fourth step) and we are consciously working together daily to create a healthy, sober environment for each other and for our baby. We just decided to live life again and we are on our way back up. I feel confident. I feel strong. I know we are going to make it.

And we could use your help.

Although we are both just now getting back to work, we need a few things to get us started. I believe we need to work for the things we want in life and put value on them and hold them sacred. However, I am willing to put my pride aside and realize my daughter's needs come first and I have listed the specific things I would be buying with your contributions.

What We Need & What You Get

My intention for running this campaign is to give back to my daughter. She requires all of the wonderful things a new baby deserves in this life. We need a stroller, a car seat, a diaper bag, formula, diapers, a diaper genie and winter clothes. For all of these items, I am raising $2,500 and anything short of complete funding or anything left over will all go in an effort to care for my sweet daughter.

Now comes the fun part: THE PERKS:

For a $5 donation, you will receive the satisfaction of knowing that you assisted a young, deserving family the ability to get on their feet.

For a $10 donation, you will receive a picture of Baby Tabitha smiling at you and wearing an outfit of your favorite color.  

For a $25 donation, you will receive a short video of Tabitha giggling (everyone loves the sound of a baby laugh).

For a $50 donation, we will try to make one of her first words be your name AND you will receive the title of "Aunt" or "Uncle".

For a $100 contribution, you will get access to an iphoto album which will be updated weekly with new pictures of Baby Tabitha for a whole year.

For a $200 contribution, you will receive all of the above perks PLUS, an 8 x 11 poster with her hand and feet prints.

For a $500 contribution, you will receive all of the above perks PLUS, a personalized copy of her first year scrap book.

For any contribution made, you will receive a new friend.

The Impact

By contributing to this campaign, you will be helping make this world a better place. If we all came together and helped each other in times of need, communities would be stronger, families would be closer and humans would experience a higher quality of life. It is our obligation to show up in situations like these and provide value where we can. If this sounds like a better world, a world you want to live in, a world you want to raise children in, then please, be the change you want to see in the world and make a decision to take action now. You can start with a really simple step of making a donation to this campaign and spreading the word. One action will lead to another and sooner than later, you will see all the ways love is surrounding us.

Other Ways You Can Help

Besides making a donation, you can contribute to our family by spreading the word. Word of mouth is an amazing way to make a difference so please, post this on your Facebook, email this to your friends or use the share tools below and post this campaign on your social network with a few kind words.

We are open to all kinds of assistance, if you maybe have some of these items or care to contact us directly to see how you can help, please feel free to email me at samerbe4444@gmail.com. 

Looking forward to hearing all the opportunities that await,

Samantha
