story:
As Seen On:

#40DaysToGreatness

Why Custom? Why Dresses?

HelenJean wants to change the way women feel about themselves by creating custom fit, made to measure dresses that shift the focus away from their bodies (which are perfect by the way) and towards each woman's gifts and talents. Our goal is to create clothes for women to wear in their boldest moments, from landing jobs, to signing deals, to wowing on first dates. 

We launched last fall in Vancouver, Canada and have been hosting trunk shows for almost a year now. This summer, we're planning our Fall 2013 collection and we want to reach the women who can't make it out to a trunk show. With our experience from the past year and a growing team of designers, developers and fit specialists, we'll create a new interactive web platform that brings our latest collection (and the trunk show experience) to women everywhere. 

Where did we get this idea?

Have you ever picked out a bunch of items while shopping and then tried them all on, only to realize that nothing actually fit? Did you then wish that some part of you was smaller or bigger or just somehow better? That was founder Katie Jeanes' experience. Shopping trips with her friends resulted in changeroom therapy sessions and the final realization that perhaps, it wasn't her body at all. Perhaps it was the clothes. So, she decided to start her own line of dresses, where each dress is custom made for the wearer.

"What if, rather than trying to fit our bodies into pre-made clothes, we made clothes that were custom fit for our bodies?" - Katie Jeanes, HelenJean founder

Having had a custom suit made in Bali, Indonesia, Katie knew the amazing shift that could happen when women are able to forget about their flaws and focus on something greater. Coming home from Bali, she could only find custom options for men. Companies like Indochino and J. Hilburn were providing made to measure suits, but there was nothing for women. Yet. HelenJean aims to change that, basing our model on a blend of successful menswear brands.

What have we done so far?

In September, we launched our first collection with six dresses inspired by incredible women we look up to. Katie's mum Lori, her namesake Katharine Hepburn, as well as bloggers and authors Heather White, Danielle LaPorte, Marie Forleo and Gabrielle Bernstein were our muses for Fall 2012. We held our first trunk show to test out the concept with a small group of women and it was a huge success.

"I love my HelenJean dress! I love that it's made just for me and how the intention tag reminds me that I'm beautiful." - Lindsey, recruiter

The best part of the dress is the intention tag. Since we have no need for size numbers we ask women how they want to feel when they wear their dress and put that word into the back of each dress. Dubbed "intention tags", women can choose whatever word they like, and we've seen everything from beautiful to strong to really, really good looking. 

We launched our Spring/Summer 2013 collection in May and debuted another six dresses. Even with a late start to Spring, we hosted over 50 women at our Vancouver trunk show. We know the demand is out there, and we know we have the ability to create beautiful clothes, as well as the ability to help women gain the confidence to really go after what they want in life. Our Fall 2013 collection is scheduled to launch August 15th. We already have women signing up for trunk shows, but we need your help to get there. 

What happens at HelenJean?

We're all about helping women own their greatness. That includes the women that create each dress in Bali, Indonesia. We work with two village-owned tailoring cooperatives which provide jobs for both men and women in each village. When you order a dress, we send it over to Bali, they source just enough fabric as needed (waste not, want not), create a custom pattern, sew your dress, and then send it back over here so we can have a final look at it before we send it off to you. Our close relationship with our manufacturers means we get to know the team of people behind each dress, and make sure that they are all happy, healthy and owning their greatness as well. 

Each dress takes three weeks from the time of ordering to arriving at your front door. Just in case it's not a perfect fit, we include a $50 tailoring credit with each purchase, so you can go get it tailored locally, and then send us the bill.

"It is so amazing to put on a dress that fit you exactly and you know you look fabulous walking into any situation." - Lori, college professor

What will the funds be used for?

Our goal is to raise enough money to fund the next 6 months of growing HelenJean across Canada and the US. We have the costs of creating our Fall 2013 collection, as well as building our new interactive website and doing outreach for the next 6 months. Some of the expenses include:

  • pattern making
  • sample sewing
  • design tools and supplies
  • Fall trunk show venue rental
  • packaging and printing
  • website development
  • website hosting
  • accounting and legal services
  • software: CRM, finance, presentation

How can you help?

First and foremost, we welcome your dollars! There are hard costs associated both with growing a fruitful, long-term venture like this. We've got some great perks to say thank you. (Did we mention we were thinking big? We know women wear more than dresses and we want to make some suits, skirts and jackets too)

Perks

$10 - Intention Tag Wall Paper

Five Sets of Inspiring Phone and Laptop Wall Paper Tailored To Your Intention

$25 - Girl Power Playlist (curated from the best women in the business)

$50 - Limited Edition HelenJean Scarf (options may vary depending on availability)

$100 - Limited Edition HelenJean Silver Bracelet (options may vary depending on availability)

$150 - Any Existing HelenJean Dress at 25% Off

$250 - Custom Designed HelenJean Dress (sample design)

$500 - HelenJean Power Outfit

Scarf, Bracelet, Custom Designed Dress, AND a Pair of Sunnies

$1000 - Fall Collection Sponsor

All Six Styles From The Fall Collection at a Special Pre-Sale Price

Second, we'd love your help getting the word out about HelenJean—both this fundraiser and the project in general. We can't be everywhere and we don't know everyone who'll want to be involved—yet, anyway—so we really need your help. Sharing on Facebook, Twitter, G+ or your favorite online or real-life networks of choice increases our chances of getting more women in HelenJean, chasing down their dream like its the last bus of the night. 

To facilitate this, we created a few pre-rolled some <140-character messages for your tweeting convenience:

Can you always find the perfect thing to wear? Don't click here: http://ow.ly/mBJCm

Think women+fashion=vapid & materialistic? Think again! http://ow.ly/mBJCm

Help women own their greatness! #leaningin http://ow.ly/mBJCm

Wish the women in your life knew how beautiful they are? Put your $ where your heart is: http://ow.ly/mBJCm

Changing the face of fashion, one dress at a time: http://ow.ly/mBJCm

Women+fashion+custom fit= a better world. Support @HelenJeanCo http://ow.ly/mBJCm

 

Our thanks...

... to you for supporting our campaign and spreading the word, and to many fine people who have helped us get this far:

Lori Becker and Emily Key: for helping get HelenJean off the ground last Fall!

Our colleagues have very generously jumped in to support, making it possible for us to focus time and attention to the project. We are lucky to work with such great people:
- Rachel McHollister of SocialModPr
- Stacelynn Caughn of The Idea Lounge
- Lisa Hemingway of Backyard Creative

Darrell Kopke, Bix Bickson and Aaron Vidas of instituteB provide us much wise advice.

Meredith Powell at U Can't Buy Cool stepped in to help us navigate the colliding worlds of fashion and tech, sharing her deep experience and expertise in everything from public relations to fundraising.

Joanna Waterfall of Waterfall Creative designed our awesome logo and business cards; she makes us look good. Also Andrea Shillington of Brands for the People for hooking us up with Joanna.

Bre DiGiammarino offered indispensable support and generously shared the expertise she gained from coaching many an Indiegogo campaign.

Jason Carvalho, Alex Shipillo, Mike Rowlands, Cory LePage and Matt Quetton, who have fielded many a frantic question over the past year and have always made time in their busy schedule for emails, walks, coffee and pep talks.

Abid Virani, Asha Suppiah, Athena Theny, Corey Cook, Graham Anderson, Kelly Lovell, Patrick Shannon, Saksham Uppal, Scott Oldford, Simon Pickup, Sonam Swarup, Linda Liu, Olivia Khalili, April Dutheil, Smita Satiani, Elisha Muskat and everyone else at Ashoka & American Express Emerging Innovators Bootcamp: without your fire, support and stunning example, there's a good chance this wouldn't be happening!
story_txt:
As Seen On:

#40DaysToGreatness
Why Custom? Why Dresses?
HelenJean wants to change the way women feel about themselves by creating custom fit, made to measure dresses that shift the focus away from their bodies (which are perfect by the way) and towards each woman's gifts and talents. Our goal is to create clothes for women to wear in their boldest moments, from landing jobs, to signing deals, to wowing on first dates. 

We launched last fall in Vancouver, Canada and have been hosting trunk shows for almost a year now. This summer, we're planning our Fall 2013 collection and we want to reach the women who can't make it out to a trunk show. With our experience from the past year and a growing team of designers, developers and fit specialists, we'll create a new interactive web platform that brings our latest collection (and the trunk show experience) to women everywhere. 
Where did we get this idea?
Have you ever picked out a bunch of items while shopping and then tried them all on, only to realize that nothing actually fit? Did you then wish that some part of you was smaller or bigger or just somehow better? That was founder Katie Jeanes' experience. Shopping trips with her friends resulted in changeroom therapy sessions and the final realization that perhaps, it wasn't her body at all. Perhaps it was the clothes. So, she decided to start her own line of dresses, where each dress is custom made for the wearer.
"What if, rather than trying to fit our bodies into pre-made clothes, we made clothes that were custom fit for our bodies?" - Katie Jeanes, HelenJean founder
Having had a custom suit made in Bali, Indonesia, Katie knew the amazing shift that could happen when women are able to forget about their flaws and focus on something greater. Coming home from Bali, she could only find custom options for men. Companies like Indochino and J. Hilburn were providing made to measure suits, but there was nothing for women. Yet. HelenJean aims to change that, basing our model on a blend of successful menswear brands.
What have we done so far?
In September, we launched our first collection with six dresses inspired by incredible women we look up to. Katie's mum Lori, her namesake Katharine Hepburn, as well as bloggers and authors Heather White, Danielle LaPorte, Marie Forleo and Gabrielle Bernstein were our muses for Fall 2012. We held our first trunk show to test out the concept with a small group of women and it was a huge success.


"I love my HelenJean dress! I love that it's made just for me and how the intention tag reminds me that I'm beautiful." - Lindsey, recruiter


The best part of the dress is the intention tag. Since we have no need for size numbers we ask women how they want to feel when they wear their dress and put that word into the back of each dress. Dubbed "intention tags", women can choose whatever word they like, and we've seen everything from beautiful to strong to really, really good looking. 
We launched our Spring/Summer 2013 collection in May and debuted another six dresses. Even with a late start to Spring, we hosted over 50 women at our Vancouver trunk show. We know the demand is out there, and we know we have the ability to create beautiful clothes, as well as the ability to help women gain the confidence to really go after what they want in life. Our Fall 2013 collection is scheduled to launch August 15th. We already have women signing up for trunk shows, but we need your help to get there. 


What happens at HelenJean?
We're all about helping women own their greatness. That includes the women that create each dress in Bali, Indonesia. We work with two village-owned tailoring cooperatives which provide jobs for both men and women in each village. When you order a dress, we send it over to Bali, they source just enough fabric as needed (waste not, want not), create a custom pattern, sew your dress, and then send it back over here so we can have a final look at it before we send it off to you. Our close relationship with our manufacturers means we get to know the team of people behind each dress, and make sure that they are all happy, healthy and owning their greatness as well. 
Each dress takes three weeks from the time of ordering to arriving at your front door. Just in case it's not a perfect fit, we include a $50 tailoring credit with each purchase, so you can go get it tailored locally, and then send us the bill.

"It is so amazing to put on a dress that fit you exactly and you know you look fabulous walking into any situation." - Lori, college professor

What will the funds be used for?
Our goal is to raise enough money to fund the next 6 months of growing HelenJean across Canada and the US. We have the costs of creating our Fall 2013 collection, as well as building our new interactive website and doing outreach for the next 6 months. Some of the expenses include:

pattern making
sample sewing
design tools and supplies
Fall trunk show venue rental
packaging and printing
website development
website hosting
accounting and legal services
software: CRM, finance, presentation

How can you help?
First and foremost, we welcome your dollars! There are hard costs associated both with growing a fruitful, long-term venture like this. We've got some great perks to say thank you. (Did we mention we were thinking big? We know women wear more than dresses and we want to make some suits, skirts and jackets too)

Scarf, Bracelet, Custom Designed Dress, AND a Pair of Sunnies
$1000 - Fall Collection Sponsor
All Six Styles From The Fall Collection at a Special Pre-Sale Price
Second, we'd love your help getting the word out about HelenJean—both this fundraiser and the project in general. We can't be everywhere and we don't know everyone who'll want to be involved—yet, anyway—so we really need your help. Sharing on Facebook, Twitter, G+ or your favorite online or real-life networks of choice increases our chances of getting more women in HelenJean, chasing down their dream like its the last bus of the night.

story:
One of the most amazing feelings in the world is the feeling you get when you help someone truly in need. It’s a feeling that we, at The Mirrored Project, hope everyone can experience.

The Mirrored Project brings you one step closer to the real experience. You may not have the opportunity to travel to Africa or India and provide humanitarian service to people in need, but you still want to help. You still want to see the faces of those people whose lives you bless. We at The Mirrored Project want to give you that experience.

Our model is simple. For every product that is sold, The Mirrored Project will give away a product or service to a child in need. Each product or service upon distribution will be photographed with the child who receives it. These photos are then uploaded onto our website for you to see. On every product we sell is printed an individual serial number, which is also printed on each charitable product distributed. These numbers are then linked to each child's photo when uploaded onto our website. So by visiting our website and entering your serial number, you are able to track and see the picture of the person you helped with your purchase. Helping you see all the good you are doing in the world.

We realized that helping people is such a special experience that it needed to be accompanied by a very special product. The type of product that you love to wear. First, because it makes you look AMAZING! Second, because every time you put it on, you are reminded of the person whose life you blessed when you bought it.



At The Mirrored Project, we want to be able to help as many people in as many ways as we can. In order to accomplish this, we partner with great charities to help those in need. Each month we will identify a specific group of children and organize a special campaign (with our partner charity) to help those children. Percentages from sales for that month will go to that campaign. Campaigns may come in a wide variety, anything from food and clothes, to medical and school supplies. Whatever is most needed. This way we can truly bless and make an impact on the lives of those we help around the world.


If you really want to make a difference and change the world, the best place to start is with the person in the mirror. You have to be the change, and then you will see the change in the world. You be the change and we will show you the change you are making .

With Christmas just around the corner, we, at The Mirrored Project, want to help children in poor living conditions around the world to have a great Christmas. We will be giving a special Christmas care package to a child in need with every coat sold on Indiegogo. These boxes will be filled with special gifts, including toys, clothing, school supplies, and hygiene supplies.

Please HELP US spread the word. Follow us on FACEBOOK

story: The process in dealing with my bike theft has been long and arduous. For the first time in my life I did the responsible thing and had renters insurance (great job me). I figured this protected me and didn't give it a second thought. Then came that fateful afternoon when I got home from work, pulled into the "secured" garage to find my bicycle gone, lock cut. I was less than happy and immediately called the police and filed a report etc. In their own words the police basically told me I was screwed and should call my insurance agency. After dealing with the insurance agency for 2 weeks I was told they would send a check for the full replacement cost of the bike (hooray!). About a week after that I called to check on the status of the check only to be transfered around 3 times and to finally be told "oh the deductible on this plan is $500 so your brand new bike and lock dont exceed that amount so you will get nothing". Obviously upset, I thanked them for their time and  let them know how happy I was to find out this information 3 weeks into the process isntead of immediately when the agent, with my policy in front of them, was reviewing my claim. So I figured I would contact my apartment complex because it was stored in their "secure" garage. I was told that they are not responsible for anything taken from their parking garage secure or not....not entirely sure how a place can get away with calling their garage "secure" while doing nothing to ensure the security of said secure garage. My favortie part was when I told the fine folks at my apartment complex about the theft they then informed me they have an open investigation with Seattle police and someone had been breaking into the garage and stealing stuff over the previous months.....maybe I am an idiot but to me that seems like the type of thing that would be communicated to their tennants so people could take proper precautions to protect their belongings. You may be asking yourself, "why do i care about this guy who got his bike stolen...bikes get stolen all the time"...and that would probably be my reaction too until it happened to me. It is incredibly heart breaking to work hard for something and only get to enjoy it for a week before some jerk steals it. This whole experience has taught me a valuable lesson...the criminals always win. I am hoping to have my faith in hummanity restored by the kindness of strangers. I would not ask this of anyone had I the means to replace this myself but my wife and I are having some financial issues currently and i just want my damn bike back.

If I do not make my goal this year I will sadly have to postpone this event to next year, but the funds will be saved and used for the next event.

story:
We might keep updating our product gallery, keep an eye on  www.portraiteyewear.com

ALL OUR PRODUCTS ARE UNISEX

(except for model #3, model # 10 and model #11 that are for women)









NEW PERKS!

ART-PIECES BY EMILIANO DONAGGIO

1. Present buggy - man 

Acrylic, fountain pen and pencil on paper bag.

Dimensions 63 x 30,5 cm.

Unique piece that makes part of a 50 paper-bag's limited edition.

2. Present- Prince

Acrylic, fountain pen and pencil on paper bag.

Dimensions 63 x 30,5 cm.

Unique piece that makes part of a 50 paper-bag's limited edition.


ART-PIECES BY FIN DAC

1. Odettia - Tangled #2 

Paper collage.

Dimensions approx. 49cm x 78cm.

Unique piece.


2. Odettia - Undertow #2 

Paper collage.

Dimensions approx. 52cm x 76cm.

Unique piece.


3. Agent O - Orange Crush #1 

Paper collage.

Dimensions approx. 49cm x 78cm.

Unique piece.


4. Agent O - Pale Erosion #1 

Paper collage.

Dimensions approx. 49cm x 78cm.

Unique piece.


5. Agent O - Lightning Strike #2 

Paper collage.

Dimensions approx. 49cm x 78cm.

Unique piece.


6. Agent O - Pale Erosion #2 

Paper collage.

Dimensions approx. 49cm x 78cm.

Unique piece.



NOTE: The pieces will be directly delivered from the Artist's studio. The shipping costs are included in the price. The art-pieces' sales go to the artist, following our cooperation policies, PORTRAIT Eyewear doesn't take any commission. 


OUR DREAM

We are a brother and sister team who live between Italy, Spain and UK and dreamed of creating a design-focused eyewear brand that embraces the contemporary fashion trends, while respecting the actual market's needs through a fair prices policy, making the best use of current technologies and returning to the genuine artisan craftsmanship. 


PORTRAIT Eyewear preserves the traditional quality and elegance of a hand-made luxury product through an original-contemporary design at a fair-trade price. 

To make such a formula possible, Portrait Eyewear cuts the middle-man through a straight-to-the-providers relationship strategy and by commercializing itself through an e-commerce platform. We have optimized general costs and have reduced profit margins to ensure that our product is aligned with the principles of a socially responsible and sustainable business.

Whereas a luxury hand-made product like ours would normally cost around 300 GBP, even our most expensive product will be sold for around half that price. 

PORTRAIT Eyewear strives to be completely produced in Italy and support  small-artisans companies. Due to its manufacturing process -which combines high technology and traditional handcrafting- the product would be labeled as “100% Handmade in Italy”.



For personal passion and a profound admiration towards genuine artists, those who risk everything to give a deeper meaning to society Portrait Eyewear represents an opportunity to highlight such a laudable talent, setting the basis for a cooperative symbiosis with emerging artists by sponsoring their image -as extraordinary real people- through our product's communication strategy.

Our intention is to continuously increase our artists' network by honoring their work and letting them be known beyond their immediate arena.

WHERE DO THE FUNDS GO TO

To be able to realize this project at a substantial scale, we would need approximately 60.000 GBP (see scenario # 3) that include:

- The production of 1050 pieces (7 different models at a minimum amount of 150 pieces required by the craftsmen, divided in 5 different colors each).

- Website design and development.

- Eyewear online try-on software development to allow users to try-the-product-on virtually.

- 360° product-photographs to allow users to see the product in detail.

- Brand's international trade-mark registration.

- Artists' campaign for at least 15 different people. More specifically, our artists' campaign costs will include all travel expenses and hosting for the photo-shoot (done by ourselves), as well as the web-marketing and SEO investment that has been agreed with them, to assure a win-win situation and a proper visibility of their work, outside of their close network.

- General development and other costs related to the legal business documents, paperwork and initial set-up requirements. 

OUR GOAL'S SCENARIOS

Nevertheless we are asking only part of the costs, that is, 20.000 GBP that would help us alleviate some of the product development's costs, allowing the craftsmen to be half-covered before starting with the final production, and the Artist's campaign to be partially done, that is, starting with 6 people.

IN REWARD FOR YOUR SUPPORT WE CAN OFFER YOU SOME UNIQUE OPPORTUNITIES AND PERKS

1. A Thank You Note for 10 GBP

We will display all our collaborators’ and fund providers’ names in a specific area within our website. This section will remain visible for a year.

2. A Post within our website's News-Section for 30 GBP (Reserved for designers, stylists, hand-crafters and emerging artists) 

We will have an entire section dedicated to News related to our product-brand, as well as to our continuous design and art research. This section is also planned to be a channel to communicate eventual product's reviews, and of course, our campaign artists' works and exhibitions.

In this section we can also offer, to those who came to know about us through our crowd-funding campaign, the possibility of showing their work (with a picture and a write-up of it), chronologically displayed in a time-line. 

3. Product pre-order at a Preferential Price, from 84 GBP:

A luxury hand-made item like this, would normally cost around 300 GBP.

Our product's cost depends on the materials and available colors they are made of. Our final price list will vary from around 99 GBP to 158 GBP, and the shipping costs will be charged to the final customer.

As a special offer to our first potential customers and funders, we would like to pre-sell it from 84 GBP and free-shipping worldwide!

This is a unique opportunity as you could own an exclusive design product, totally hand-made in Italy with extreme care, love and passion.

4. Become a part of our Campaign. With a small contribution and by sending us your CV/PORTFOLIO.

At this stage we might not be able to consider all the artists we would love to work within our Project's Campaign. Our goal is to be a means for emerging artists to be known out of their immediate network, as a symbol of honor and recognition. For that, we will use an important part of the web-marketing and SEO budget to assure them as much visibility as possible.


In a few words, we will for sure carefully study your profile and consider it for our ongoing campaign. Subject to the final budget and relevance to the brand appeal, we will do our best to try to make it happen. It will take us time to check every CV/ Portfolio and carefully read them, which is why we are asking for a small contribution.

Currently, we live between Spain, UK and Italy, which already gives us the possibility of moving around these countries easily. Other state's artists, could be included depending on budget limitations and on the goal's achievement.


WHY PORTRAIT EYEWEAR?


We believe that in this rapidly and ever more increasingly transparent society, the new economic models need to have the courage to build something up from a true essence, with a sustainable approach that supports network developments instead of classic pyramids; reducing the distance between perceived and real value and generating cooperative environments.

Our product design is totally original. Our shapes recall the vintage genre but have been carefully studied to create a product with a NEW character. Most of the brands that offer vintage-inspired eyewear, tend to copy old shapes, revisiting them by only implementing new materials and technologies.

When creating PORTRAIT Eyewear, we dedicated a long time to the study of  the shapes, choosing a distinctive way to recall the vintage genre without becoming a repetition. To this matter, other than implementing original materials and new technologies, we offer shapes whose inspiration comes from elements associated to the visual arts fields in general, such as the polygon-art trend and the  minimalistic-contemporary design.  

ORIGINAL FEATURES

- Original shapes and design.

- Flat contemporary design and use of sharp shapes. 

- Low-relief milling above the nose bridge and sharp milling in the temples, all details that recall a brand character and identity without using any logos. 

- End-pieces acetate inserts. Usually these elements are metallic to facilitate the product manufacture. PORTRAIT Eyewear instead, has small acetate inserts on the frames' end-pieces. This supposes a complex and precious workmanship (totally attached by hand) .

- No presence of visible logos.

- Original upper rim outlining that combines classic precious materials with contemporary plain colors. 

From our business plan, we realized that most of the hand-made brands have exorbitant prices (around 300 GBP) and only very few could be considered, more affordable. Those we analyzed as potentially direct competitors -within our market research, might still be a little over-priced.

Our product intends to become the best price-quality ratio product of its kind in the eyewear market. And we believe, after a long design study and intensive research, that we might be ready to face the challenge.

Our most inexpensive product, might still involve a richer material combination than the basic material eyewear offered by average brands.

At the same time, we want our costs' optimization to remain socially responsible along the whole supply-chain. For this reason, we count on the support of small to medium artisan companies that assure their staff an excellent work-environment, a proper reward and true dignity. Ours is a slavery-free product. 

Besides, our production process, in all its steps, strongly adheres to environmentally- friendly practices. All of our suppliers have an energy-efficient philosophy and follow the principles of a sustainable business.

Even the last supply-chain step, that is, our product packaging production, counts on FSC recycled cardboard; its design is totally foldable (no-glue needed) and completely original. It ensures safe product delivery, combining the principles of a design-product-wrapping and a resistant delivery packing.

SELLING HAND-MADE EYEWEAR THROUGH THE INTERNET

Our main challenge, apart from the common entrepreneurial risk of starting a new venture willing to compete in a saturated market, regards the difficulties of selling a wearable product, such as eyewear, through an e-commerce platform.

Having the stock stored in UK, we might be able to offer a free delivery service to allow customers to try the product on before buying it, in a short-term scenario. But a global free-of-charge delivery might be impossible at the beginning. 

To solve this handicap, we will count on a customized and improved try-on software, that allows users to get a good idea of the product look on their faces.

There are similar products in the market, but none of them satisfy our expectations, in terms of precision, versatility, real-time rendering and customizable interface. We count on the right developer's team to make it happen, with your contribution, we hope to be able to realize it. 

 CAN'T HELP THROUGH FUNDS?

Our project doesn't limit its goal to creating a new brand and making a new venture possible. Through PORTRAIT Eyewear, you are directly contributing to the local-market and supporting genuine craftsmen, as well as a group of emerging artists, both of which are roles that are in great danger in the actual market currently. 

You can be of great help by sharing our campaign through your social network profiles, by emailing it or just by talking about it. 

Your opinion is also very important to us, please feel free to send it through the following email: crowdfunding@portraiteyewear.com

Thanks for your support!!


FAQ

1. When is the product going to be ready? When will I get my pair?

Production will start once the 45 days of crowd-funding campaign are over if the goals are met, and it will last for an entire month. If we don't get any delays, the shipments will start by the second half of October.

2. Do you have other colors available? 

Right now, in the concept phase, our project includes 35 different kinds of glasses (mixing models and colors). As a consequence of budget restrictions, we have been able to fully develop 7 base models, resulting in a total of 17 different kinds of glasses. If we succeed in meeting the project goals, you can keep checking our official page www.portraiteyewear.com , where we will keep updating the product line.

3. Where is the stock based and where does the shipping come from? 

The product will be shipped from London, UK. In the future, the shipment costs will be covered by the user. Right now as a special Indiegogo promotion, all shipping costs will be free as long as the crowd-funding goes on.

* For outside EU deliveries: some customs may charge duties for the item coming into the country.

4. What do I get by purchasing a pair of PORTRAIT (or anything else indicated as part of your purchase)? 

Your PORTRAITs come in a design cardboard box presentation. This package is made entirely from recycled materials and has an FSC certificate. The package includes a microfiber glasses bag for your new PORTRAITs protection, made in Italy, a warranty-brochure and the original design recycled cardboard box.

5. Do you sell glasses with prescription?

Sorry, but we do not. Our brand sells frames for prescription glasses that the buyer then needs to take to a qualified optometrist to be fitted with the corresponding prescription. We also sell Sunglasses that includes all the lenses-filters, produced according to the European Community top quality standards.

6. How can I purchase a model that is not currently available?

There are two models that are not currently available within our perks, these models are #3 and #13.  However, if you are interested in any of these items you just have to purchase a different model for the same price and send us a message to crowdfunding@portraiteyewear.com specifying the model you want.

We will immediately reply and keep track of your personal info (name, delivery address, eyewear choice, etc) to make sure you'll get the right glasses/sunglasses. The only reason we do not have an specific perk for these items is that the maximum amount of perks allowed per campaign is 20 and we wanted to leave room for some of the artist's work.

ALL OUR PRODUCTS ARE UNISEX
(except for model #3, model # 10 and model #11 that are for women)

Unique piece.





NOTE: The pieces will be directly delivered from the Artist's studio. The shipping costs are included in the price. The art-pieces' sales go to the artist, following our cooperation policies, PORTRAIT Eyewear doesn't take any commission. 

OUR DREAM
We are a brother and sister team who live between Italy, Spain and UK and dreamed of creating a design-focused eyewear brand that embraces the contemporary fashion trends, while respecting the actual market's needs through a fair prices policy, making the best use of current technologies and returning to the genuine artisan craftsmanship. 







PORTRAIT Eyewear preserves
the traditional quality and elegance of a hand-made luxury
product through an original-contemporary design at
a fair-trade price. 


To make such a formula
possible, Portrait Eyewear cuts the middle-man through
a straight-to-the-providers relationship strategy and by
commercializing itself through an e-commerce platform. We have optimized general costs and have reduced profit margins to ensure that our product is aligned with the principles of a socially responsible and sustainable business.



Whereas
a luxury hand-made product like ours would normally cost around 300
GBP, even our most expensive product will be sold for around half
that price. 









PORTRAIT
Eyewear strives to
be completely produced in Italy
and support  small-artisans
companies. Due to
its manufacturing process -which combines high technology and
traditional handcrafting- the product would be labeled as “100%
Handmade in Italy”.
















For personal passion and a profound admiration towards genuine artists, those who risk everything to give a deeper meaning to society Portrait Eyewear represents an opportunity to highlight such a laudable talent, setting the basis for a cooperative symbiosis with emerging artists by sponsoring their image -as extraordinary real people- through our product's communication strategy.






Our intention is to
continuously increase our artists' network
by honoring their work
and letting them be known beyond their immediate arena.




WHERE DO THE FUNDS GO TO

realize this project at a substantial
scale,
we would need
approximately
60.000
GBP (see
scenario # 3) that include:



- The production of 1050 pieces (7
different models at a minimum amount of 150 pieces required by the
craftsmen, divided in 5 different colors each).
- Website design and development.

- Eyewear online try-on software development to allow users to try-the-product-on virtually.

- 360° product-photographs to allow users to see the product in detail.
- Brand's international trade-mark registration.
- Artists' campaign for at least 15 different people. More specifically, our artists' campaign costs will include all travel expenses and hosting for the photo-shoot (done by ourselves), as well as the web-marketing and SEO investment that has been agreed with them, to assure a win-win situation and a proper visibility of their work, outside of their close network.
- General development and other costs related to the legal business documents, paperwork and initial set-up requirements.

story:
Our first crowd funding launch was successful in gaining us the deposit for our entry fee into New York Fashion Week - Fashion Palette runway show.

We have learnt so much from this experience being our first ever campaign and have seen where we could improve on our exposure and background efforts to entice you and others to join our journey! 

In order to capitalize on being the ONLY Adelaide designer among 20 Australian designers showcasing at the New York Fashion Week and to address the request of those who expressed a wish to contribute but missed the opportunity, we have re-launched our campaign until August 23rd so that we can raise more to promote Simmone Standing The Label, Adelaide Fashion and South Australia to the world in New York!


Hi, we are the team behind Simmone Standing The Label and we have had the immense pleasure of being invited to showcase our Spring /Summer 2016 Collection on the Fashion Palette New York runway in September.

This is an amazing opportunity not only for the head designer Simmone, but also her team of enthusiastic volunteers who get to be involved in the ‘behind the scenes’ view of a runway show and gain knowledge in developing a story around a collection. 

Contributing to this campaign means that parallel to assisting the head designer Simmone showcase her designs on an international platform, you will also be encouraging other young aspiring designers who come to Simmone for mentorship to see that there is always opportunity and a means to follow their dreams!  No ambition is too big or out of reach if you have the passion to make it happen!


“Something Starting Right Now” Spring Summer collection sought to create a range of garments that are adventurous in the wearing, that tickle the inner girl of the most sophisticated woman and inspire new dimensions of wearing statement pieces. 

This is to be Simmone Standing The Label’s second collection and like the previous collection has a unique story all of its own. Thinking ocean shapes mixed with crisp detailing and decisive cuts head designer Simmone has let the whimsy of Disney’s “The Little Mermaid” and the sheer sophistication of Katherine Hepburn amalgamate into her inspiration; androgyny with seashells…

This campaign will release sneak peak shoots showing minor detail, colours and shapes to keep you excited with anticipation but will predominantly be kept secret until it hits the runway in New York shhh… 

To be involved in this amazing opportunity we need to raise money to cover the following costs: 

· $15,000 entry fee 

· Flights 

· Accommodation 

· Insurance

· Venue Hire 

· Models 

· Makeup 

· Hair Stylists 

· Advertising 

· Promotion

· Photography

· VIP gifting opportunities 

· Celebrities wearing garments 

In the event we exceed our expectations it will provide more areas of opportunity for our enthusiastic team of volunteers with behind the scenes and runway experiences. It will also assist us promote production and enable us to go for stronger marketing prospects. 

All donations will receive a personal email to say thank you for your support. 
All perks from "Thank you post card" onwards will also receive a post card and be "Named AMAZING!" on our marketing website as an extra thank you for your support!! Please indicate if you would not wish to be named on the website- but we still think you are amazing!!

All perks do not include travel, flights or accommodation

All perks will not be honoured until after campaign has ended

Custom designed tote bag made exclusively for New York campaign
Leatherette tote bag with insignia and sheer insert.
Black or White available.
Black leatherette will be paired with black sports mesh.
White leatherette will be paired with an edgy white lace!
We will send you an email on completion of the campaign for your colour preference. Shipping within Australia Free but please provide your address.
[International Contributors please add $20 AUD for shipping]

A $200 gift voucher for a Simmone Standing The Label designed outfit from any of her collections.
This offer is only available for the Come Stand with me in New York campaign so don't miss out! - Buy one for yourself or a friend for Christmas.

Valid for 12 months from receipt of voucher which will be emailed to you.

Well lets face it… YOU ARE! 

To say a very public thank you for your support as every dollar counts we would like to add your name to our list of AMAZING people on our standinginnewyork.com website! 

Couldn't imagine going all this way and not taking amazing photos with our upcoming collection in the iconic streets of New York! 

To say thank you for experiencing this journey with us we want to turn one of these images into a personalised postcard and send it to you anywhere in the world to show our deepest appreciation!! 

Keep a piece of the beginning!! 

This is a new brand that is hoping to build into a well established company in the near future; Simmone would like to offer you a hand drawn sketch of one of her idiosyncratic designs from the "Starting Something Right Now" collection.

This uniquely numbered keepsake will be sketched onto A4 fine linen paper and enclosed in a cushioned postage bag to maintain its integrity. 

[February 2016 delivery date gives time for the designer to create your images as well as work on the next collection. Images will be sent as they become available. If you need it earlier for a special occasion please let us know] 

Simmone has built a wealth of knowledge and is always learning more about the career path she has decided is the only path for her. A coffee with this designer could be an invaluable eye opener for you to pick up tidbits of her incredible journey and business savvy that could translate into your own fashion/creative career and how to start building a platform for yourself! 

Pick your favourite Adelaide cafe or one of Simmone's favourites and spend an hour soaking up her fashion know how. 

[December 2015 delivery date gives flexibility for yourself and designer to catch up for coffee without short timeframe] 

(Please read "Coffee with designer - Adelaide" first) 

Fashion always includes travel and for Simmone Standing The Label's team we make frequent visits to Melbourne and Sydney to promote and build our brand. This makes a great opportunity for our team to meet with you and buy you a coffee for that personal thank you touch and discuss not only where we have been but also; Where are you going?

Pick your favourite Melbourne or Sydney cafe or let Simmone Standing The Label pick and spend an our with the team and the head designer soaking up their fashion know how. 

[March 2016 delivery date gives flexibility for yourself, designer and team to catch up for coffee without short timeframe]

(Please read "Coffee with designer - Adelaide" first) 

Even as busy busy busy as we will be promoting our brand in the short time we will be in New York, it would be our utmost pleasure to meet you somewhere in Manhattan and shout you a coffee for that personal thank you touch and a little Australian fashion gossip!! 

Pick your favourite Manhattan cafe or let Simmone Standing The Label pick and spend an our with the team and the head designer soaking up their fashion know how.

(Please read "Coffee with designer - Adelaide" first) 

Simmone Standing The Label has been privileged enough to build a team of enthusiastic, knowledgable and humorous fashion devotees that would love for you to accompany us on one of our hot lunch dates as part of the team; discuss fashion, photography, opportunities and share with us your story and where you would like to see yourself going on your own creative path. 

Soak up the afternoon at one of the head designers favourite cafes or restaurants in Adelaide and let us shout you lunch to say thank you!!

[March 2016 delivery date gives flexibility for yourself, designer and team to catch up for lunch without short timeframe]

(Please read "Coffee with designer - Adelaide" first) 

Simmone Standing The Label has been privileged enough to build a team of enthusiastic, knowledgable and humorous fashion devotees that would love for you to accompany us on one of our hot lunch dates as part of the team; discuss fashion, photography, opportunities and share with us your story and where you would like to see yourself going on your own creative path. 

Pick your favourite Manhattan cafe/resturaunt or let Simmone Standing The Label pick and soak up the afternoon with our team and their Australian fashion know how and let us shout you lunch to say thank you!!

Get involved behind the scenes on a Simmone Standing The Label campaign shoot! 

See how a creative vision is translated in front of a camera and the whole process that makes the shoot a success for high quality branding images. These photo shoot days are high energy but a lot of fun and are generally a full day process!! 

Come share in the teams adventure, work and camaraderie with food provided and the opportunity to see collections before they are released!! 

[July 2016 delivery date gives flexibility for more photo shoot opportunities for you to attend]

Have you ever dreamed what it would be like to hang out backstage at a fashion show and receive the VIP treatment? 

If you decide you want to be one of the high end contributors and take part in this unique perk, Simmone Standing The Label's team would love to invite you backstage to hang out with the models and the team, get your hair and makeup done by our amazing beauty artists, share in the food, wine and camaraderie with the team and then to complete the experience sit front row with your own name board side by side with the fashion elite on the runway!!! 

This experience will be exclusive to Simmone Standing The Labels upcoming shows after New York that will be held in Australia; travel expenses, flights and accommodation are not included. Minimum 2 months notice will be given for dates. 

Inclusive to the VIP Experience we would also like to offer you a 20% discount on your choice of Simmone Standing The Label garments, to help you dress like the VIP that you are! 

[This perk has been given an end date of July next year and availability for a further 12 months after the campaign has ended as showcases are booked due to demand. This timeframe also provides you with more showcase options as you may not be able to make each one. You will be provided with a personal invitation and notice of upcoming showcases minimum of two months prior to the event]

*As Simmone Standing The Label is a South Australian based brand, showcase opportunities will predominately be in Adelaide. 

Designed and produced solely in Adelaide Australia Simmone Standing The Label is a new clothing line that launched in late 2014 in conjunction with winning the Adelaide Fashion Festival Emerging Designer Award.

It is very important to the head designer that each piece is unique and makes a statement all of its own, she likes them to be thought provoking and inspire the woman that wears it to stand out from the crowd. 

“She is the kind of person who loves current trends but doesn’t compromise her own flair and direction by following clique fashion ideals” 

Simmone Standing, head designer and founder of Simmone Standing The Label decided early in 2014 to utilise her 20 years of fashion “affliction” and garment development knowledge to launch this brand with a fresh direction and innovative ideas and the desire of inspiring young creative individuals. 

After making the logical decision to launch this new brand, Simmone was encouraged to enter the Adelaide Fashion Festival’s Emerging Designer award; where upon winning she established recognition for her idiosyncrasy, refined cut and innovation. 

Utilising the knowledge gained in the development of the brand Simmone has become driven by the purpose of building a business that offers support as well as creating exposure and opportunity for aspiring young designers and creatively minded individuals; a business that shares resources and provides business experience.

Looking into the future for the brand, Simmone and her team's prominent goal is to branch out and stock Simmone Standing The Label in high end boutiques around Australia and internationally.  

Follow our story further and keep updated with everything that happens with the brand and our New York campaign on all our social media platforms

Stay connected with our story, our team of enthusiastic volunteers and all our adventures that build our brand. 

Understandably contributing financially is not always an option for some, however there are so many other ways for you to help our campaign and connect with us on a more meaningful level. Please share this campaign through the Indiegogo share tools or through our social media links! 

Tell your friends, tell your family, hey even tell the guy that makes your coffee!! 

Any help you can give will make our campaign amazing and would be greatly appreciated!! 

If you have any suggestions for rewards or feedback on our campaign we would love to hear from you!

Facebook: www.facebook.com/pages/Simmone-Standing-The-Label

Instagram: @simmone_standing_the_label

Hashtag: #simmonestandingthelabel #sstlexclusive #startingsomethingrightnow

Simmone Standing The Label has created an elaborate marketing campaign with a broad outreach for their lead up to and during our New York showcase that utilises a strong web presence as well as social media and external interviews. 

Simmone Standing The Label would like to invite you to take up the opportunity to support our brand as well as promote your company by becoming a sponsor. 

Please email us at brandmanager@simmonestanding.com.au for our sponsorship proposal and marketing plan. 

Simmone Standing The Label’s Head Designer Simmone and her wonderful team would like to thank you for your contribution helping the brand.

story_txt:
Our first
crowd funding launch was successful in gaining us the deposit for our entry fee
into New York Fashion Week - Fashion Palette runway show. 
We have
learnt so much from this experience being our first ever campaign and have seen
where we could improve on our exposure and background efforts to entice you and
others to join our journey! In order to capitalize on being the ONLY Adelaide designer among 20 Australian designers showcasing at the New York Fashion Week and to address the request of those who expressed a wish to contribute but missed the opportunity, we have re-launched our campaign until August 23rd so that we can raise more to promote Simmone Standing The Label, Adelaide Fashion and South Australia to the world in New York!
Hi, we are the team behind Simmone Standing The Label and we have had the immense pleasure of being invited to showcase our Spring /Summer 2016 Collection on the Fashion Palette New York runway in September.
This is an amazing opportunity not only for the head designer Simmone, but also her team of enthusiastic volunteers who get to be involved in the ‘behind the scenes’ view of a runway show and gain knowledge in developing a story around a collection. 
Contributing to this campaign means that parallel to assisting the head designer Simmone showcase her designs on an international platform, you will also be encouraging other young aspiring designers who come to Simmone for mentorship to see that there is always opportunity and a means to follow their dreams!  No ambition is too big or out of reach if you have the passion to make it happen!


“Something Starting Right Now” Spring Summer collection sought to create a range of garments that are adventurous in the wearing, that tickle the inner girl of the most sophisticated woman and inspire new dimensions of wearing statement pieces. 
This is to be Simmone Standing The Label’s second collection and like the previous collection has a unique story all of its own. Thinking ocean shapes mixed with crisp detailing and decisive cuts head designer Simmone has let the whimsy of Disney’s “The Little Mermaid” and the sheer sophistication of Katherine Hepburn amalgamate into her inspiration; androgyny with seashells…
This campaign will release sneak peak shoots showing minor detail, colours and shapes to keep you excited with anticipation but will predominantly be kept secret until it hits the runway in New York shhh… 

To be involved in this amazing opportunity we need to raise money to cover the following costs: 
· $15,000 entry fee 
· Flights 
· Accommodation 
· Insurance
· Venue Hire 
· Models 
· Makeup 
· Hair Stylists 
· Advertising 
· Promotion
· Photography
· VIP gifting opportunities 
· Celebrities wearing garments 
In the event we exceed our expectations it will provide more areas of opportunity for our enthusiastic team of volunteers with behind the scenes and runway experiences. It will also assist us promote production and enable us to go for stronger marketing prospects. 


All donations will receive a personal email to say thank you for your support. All perks from "Thank you post card" onwards will also receive a post card and be "Named AMAZING!" on our marketing website as an extra thank you for your support!! Please indicate if you would not wish to be named on the website- but we still think you are amazing!!
All perks do not include travel, flights or accommodation
All perks will not be honoured until after campaign has ended


Custom designed tote bag made exclusively for New York campaignLeatherette tote bag with insignia and sheer insert.Black or White available.Black leatherette will be paired with black sports mesh.White leatherette will be paired with an edgy white lace!We will send you an email on completion of the campaign for your colour preference. Shipping within Australia Free but please provide your address.[International Contributors please add $20 AUD for shipping]


A $200 gift voucher for a Simmone Standing The Label designed outfit from any of her collections.This offer is only available for the Come Stand with me in New York campaign so don't miss out! - Buy one for yourself or a friend for Christmas.
Valid for 12 months from receipt of voucher which will be emailed to you.

Well lets face it… YOU ARE! 
To say a very public thank you for your support as every dollar counts we would like to add your name to our list of AMAZING people on our standinginnewyork.com website! 

Couldn't imagine going all this way and not taking amazing photos with our upcoming collection in the iconic streets of New York! 
To say thank you for experiencing this journey with us we want to turn one of these images into a personalised postcard and send it to you anywhere in the world to show our deepest appreciation!! 

Keep a piece of the beginning!! 
This is a new brand that is hoping to build into a well established company in the near future; Simmone would like to offer you a hand drawn sketch of one of her idiosyncratic designs from the "Starting Something Right Now" collection.
This uniquely numbered keepsake will be sketched onto A4 fine linen paper and enclosed in a cushioned postage bag to maintain its integrity. 
[February 2016 delivery date gives time for the designer to create your images as well as work on the next collection. Images will be sent as they become available. If you need it earlier for a special occasion please let us know] 

Simmone has built a wealth of knowledge and is always learning more about the career path she has decided is the only path for her. A coffee with this designer could be an invaluable eye opener for you to pick up tidbits of her incredible journey and business savvy that could translate into your own fashion/creative career and how to start building a platform for yourself! 
Pick your favourite Adelaide cafe or one of Simmone's favourites and spend an hour soaking up her fashion know how. 
[December 2015 delivery date gives flexibility for yourself and designer to catch up for coffee without short timeframe] 

(Please read "Coffee with designer - Adelaide" first) 
Fashion always includes travel and for Simmone Standing The Label's team we make frequent visits to Melbourne and Sydney to promote and build our brand. This makes a great opportunity for our team to meet with you and buy you a coffee for that personal thank you touch and discuss not only where we have been but also; Where are you going?
Pick your favourite Melbourne or Sydney cafe or let Simmone Standing The Label pick and spend an our with the team and the head designer soaking up their fashion know how. 
[March 2016 delivery date gives flexibility for yourself, designer and team to catch up for coffee without short timeframe]

(Please read "Coffee with designer - Adelaide" first) 
Even as busy busy busy as we will be promoting our brand in the short time we will be in New York, it would be our utmost pleasure to meet you somewhere in Manhattan and shout you a coffee for that personal thank you touch and a little Australian fashion gossip!! 
Pick your favourite Manhattan cafe or let Simmone Standing The Label pick and spend an our with the team and the head designer soaking up their fashion know how.

story:
Featured On








Bathroom Collection

Customize Your Order!

Choose from 5 universally functional base shapes:

  1. Make-Up Brush / Toothbrush Holder
  2. Tissue Box
  3. Candle Holder (Small or Large) with Fresh Bamboo Scented Candle
  4. Soap Dish
  5. Tray

Then, choose from 5 interchangeable Metal Charms
Metal Charms are made locally in Southern California and use only recycled metal





Creating the Charms

Bodhi Tree Collections is proud to support local businesses as well. The Casting Place is located in Los Angeles, California and does beautiful work. Watch the video below to see the process!





Creating the Bamboo Base Shapes

Step 1: Bodhi Tree Collections uses bamboo from wild bamboo forests in Southeast Asia. Bamboo, which is a type of grass, is one of the fastest growing plants on the planet, much more than hard wood.
Step 2: Once the bamboo is collected, it is soaked in local ponds for four months to a full year. This method naturally fumigates the organic materials by pulling out the natural sweetness of the bamboo stalk, making insects naturally repelled.
Step 3: After the natural fumigation process is complete and the bamboo has fully dried, the Bamboo is cut into long, thin, even stalks by hand.
Step 4: The flexible bamboo stalks are spun into seamless forms, creating the shape of the design.
Step 5: Once the desired shape has been created, the shape is coated with a rice glue, smoothing out the design. The coated design is allowed to dry in the sunshine or by a fire in the winter months.
Step 6: After the piece has dried, multiple light coats of rice glue are applied to ensure rigidness and longevity. Each layer will dry in the sunlight and be polished by hand. The desired color will be added as the final layer. In our IndieGoGo design, we are featuring our newest Bodhi Tree Collections line with natural bamboo coloring paired with a crisp white lacquer color base.
Step 7: Before finishing touches are made, our local quality control inspects the pieces for flaws and imperfections, ensuring that you get the highest quality product.


The entire process is an ancient tradition that has been passed down for many generations. What’s so spectacular about it is that the environmental sustainability of this beautiful craft was one created out of necessity rather than choice.





$10 - Basic: I'd Like to Help!

Receive information on how to make your bathroom more organic and get your name listed on the Bodhi Tree Collections website as a founding sponsor. You’ll get a BIG thank you and much appreciation for showing your love.




$300 - Complete Set

One of each base shape and your choice of charms for each one, plus the opportunity to vote on our next batch of new charms and listing on Bodhi Tree Collections website as a founding sponsor. We will follow up with you after the campaign for your choice of charm.




$48 - Brush / Toothbrush Holder

With your choice of any one charm, plus the opportunity to vote on our next batch of new charms and listing on Bodhi Tree Collections website as a founding sponsor. We will follow up with you after the campaign for your choice of charm.




$44 - Tissue Box

With your choice of any one charm, plus the opportunity to vote on our next batch of new charms and listing on Bodhi Tree Collections website as a founding sponsor. We will follow up with you after the campaign for your choice of charm.




$35 - Small Candle Holder

With your choice of any one charm, plus the opportunity to vote on our next batch of new charms and listing on Bodhi Tree Collections website as a founding sponsor. We will follow up with you after the campaign for your choice of charm.




$35 - Soap Dish

With your choice of any one charm, plus the opportunity to vote on our next batch of new charms and listing on Bodhi Tree Collections website as a founding sponsor. We will follow up with you after the campaign for your choice of charm.




$50 - Large Tray

With your choice of any one charm, plus the opportunity to vote on our next batch of new charms and listing on Bodhi Tree Collections website as a founding sponsor. We will follow up with you after the campaign for your choice of charm.




$17 - Extra Charm (No Base Shape)

Choice of any charm to go with your base shape — c’mon you’ve got to have some options! This perk is best as an add-on to another perk so you can receive your base shape of choice and more than one charm to go with it. We will follow up with you after the campaign for your choice of charm.









About Bodhi Tree Collections

Bodhi Tree Collections started two years ago, after I visited Vietnam and fell in love with the bamboo and natural lacquer decorative items I discovered during my travels. I met some incredible friends there who turned me onto the process and shared their artwork with me. Ever since, I have been working to bring these handmade items made from organic, sustainable materials to the US. I’ve imported some initial designs and sold them in stores throughout the US both online and off.

In working through the process of designing, importing and selling, I have recognized what I can do to improve the business by creating a fun, configurable product that beautifies the bath in a chemical free, orgainic way; helps to save time and money with shapes that are easy to clean, while maintaining the eco-friendly aspect of the designs that first impressed me. After some meditation and research on the topic I decided to take my next steps with this IndieGoGo campaign. In order to allow my company to take its next steps, I'm giving you the chance to get your hands on these beauties before anyone else does, all while supporting an international network of artists involved and being a good environmental steward in the process.


Other Ways to Contribute

Share Our Campaign Website - www.BodhiTreeCollections.com/campaign
Share Our Main Bodhi Tree Collections Website - www.BodhiTreeCollections.com
Like/Share Us on Facebook - Click Here
Follow Us on Twitter - @BodhiTreeCo
Follow Us on Instagram - @bodhitreecollections
Pin Us on Pinterest - Click Here
Share Our Campaign Video - Click Here


What are the Funds For?

With your pledge, I'll be able to source and transport my base shapes from Vietnam to my warehouse in the USA, with a portion of the proceeds going back to the women that make the bamboo items by hand. I'll also be able to manufacture my charms locally in California and begin marketing and selling the new designs.

Cost Specifics

Master Models: These are solid metal and clay models in the shape of my new designs. I have already created these for my first set of charms. When it’s time to design the next release of charms, I’ll work with local artist who should be reasonably compensated for their work.

Casting Molds: These are the molds created with the Master Models and used to pour the molten metal for mass production. We have already created one mold for the five initial charms, which should last up to 20 or 30 production runs. To make more charms than this, I will also need to create additional molds.

Metal and Materials: Each charm weighs less than half a pound. Your pledge funds will help support the expense of the recycled metal used, other materials in casting and the time of the casters. Then exact quantity will depend on the amount of pledges.

Production of Bamboo Base Shapes: Once the campaign is complete, your pledge will help to get my friends in Vietnam working on the base shapes. It takes them roughly three months to complete all the steps required, so assessing the quantity of the base shape and volume of each will be a first priority after the campaign ends. I’ve already worked with them to design the initial samples and now need to tell them how many of which shapes to make.

Third Party Inspection Company for Bamboo Shapes: In order to avoid inconsistencies in the design and high quality products, we will get another set of eyes to inspect and send a report before the items are shipped.

Importing the Bamboo Base Shapes: Once complete, the bamboo base shapes will need to be packed and shipped over from Vietnam to Southern California. It’s usually best to have them travel by sea.

Packaging: This is how the charms and base shapes will make their way safely to you from our warehouse. I’m working to narrow down a safe way of packing with minimum waste that does the gorgeous pieces justice. A smooth and efficient delivery process will require a Fulfillment Agency. In this way, your eco-friendly designs will arrive safe and sound, and on time.


Risks and Challenges

As with any manufactured products there are risks. Here are a few of the risks that I feel confidently able to overcome:

Loose agreements for timeline: When dealing with villagers in Vietnam, time is much more malleable than we think of it in western cities. Additionally, in Asia the Lunar New Year celebration (which is at the beginning of February this year) means work stops for at least a week if not a week and a half, so timeline could be stretched slightly to allow for the holiday.

Weather: Since the bamboo base shapes are usually cured in the sunshine, prolonged rain in Vietnam could delay completion.

Product Consistency: This is less a problem with the metal charms than it is with our bamboo base shapes. To assure that the products are created exactly as agreed, we’ll employ a 3rd party inspection agency to inspect a sample if the designs before delivery so we know we’ll get what we’re expecting.

Importing Bottlenecks and Schedules: The base shapes will be shipped by sea and are therefore subject to the schedules set by the ocean liners and transportation brokers. This is a risk at both ends, the port in Vietnam as well as the port in Los Angeles. Extenuating circumstances like worker strikes or bad weather can increase the time it takes for the items to arrive.





Thank You!
