Click to enlarge

THE FUTURE / LE FUTUR
--
We've been working very hard to offer fair prices for everyone, so early backers will get a discount of 20% on the RRP of 189€. Starting price will be from 149€ ! And if you choose the duo option to share one with your friend or offering one to your beloved, this will be the best option (35% discount = 124,5€ the watch) !!
Nous avons travaillé dur pour obtenir les prix les plus justes, de telle manière que les plus rapides d'entre vous puissent obtenir - 20% par rapport au prix public de 189€. Les prix commencent donc à 149€ ! Et si vous décidez de choisir l'offre duo à partager avec un ami ou avec la personne qui est à vos côtés, cette dernière est la meilleure (-35%, soit 124,5€ la montre) !! 


STRETCH GOALS / NOUVEAUX OBJECTIFS
--
A NEW COLOR UNLOCKED / UNE NOUVELLE COULEUR DÉBLOQUÉE > 15.000 € FUNDED / FINANCÉS
As we reached €15.000, the black case is unlocked ! You will have the choice to get it at the end of the campaign. Comme nous avons atteint 15.000€ de financement, le boitier noir est débloqué ! Vous aurez donc la possibilité de le choisir dès la fin de la campagne de financement.


A NEW SYSTEM UNLOCKED / UN NOUVEAU SYSTÈME DÉBLOQUÉ > 22.000 € FUNDED / FINANCÉS !
We just reached €22.000, that means we unlock the strap quick release system ! You will have the choice to get it at the end of the campaign. Nous venons tout juste d'atteindre les 22.000€ de financement, ce qui veut dire que nous débloquons le système d’attache rapide de bracelet ! Vous aurez donc la possibilité de le choisir dès la fin de la campagne de financement.



TIMELINES / CALENDRIER
--
After working hard with our suppliers, prototypes are today as close as possible to a production model. This responsiveness allows us to have a tight but effective schedule to work with, for expected deliveries in September, 2016. 
Après avoir longtemps travaillé avec nos fournisseurs, les prototypes sont aujourd'hui le plus proche possible d'un modèle de série. Cette réactivité va nous permettre d'avoir un planning serré mais efficace pour une livraison espérée en septembre 2016.







LAST THINGS / UNE DERNIÈRE CHOSE
--

One year warranty included.

Free shipping EU and North America & 20€ / $23 WORLDWIDE (VAT and duties excluded). 
Watches or bracelets will be chosen at the end of the campaign.

--

Un an de garantie incluse. 
Expédition gratuite pour l'UE et Amérique du Nord & 20€ / 23$ pour le RESTE DU MONDE (hors TVA et frais de douane).
Le choix des montres ou des bracelets se fera à la fin de la campagne.



PRESS KIT / DOSSIER DE PRESSE
--
We hope you liked our project & we really want to thank you !
Please find our press kit for download here.
CREDITS / REMERCIEMENTS
--
Thanks to Sacha, Aurélien, Seb, Schiavo for their artistic help. 
Photos: Olivier . Harrassowski . Photographe
Video: Marius Longo
Music: TAUR - Black Fire

story:
IMPORTANT NOTE: This is a flexible funding campaign, which means all of the t-shirts will be delivered even if we don't reach out fundraising goal :)


Be one of the few people in the universe to own a unique spaced out organic t-shirt!

Space is infinite, but these designs aren't.
Only 100 t-shirts of each design will ever be made.

What?

Spaced Out Shop (SOS) takes real photos of space from NASA’s Hubble Telescope and creates bold designs on quality gear for cosmic enjoyment. We're all about creating awareness of the infinite awesomeness that is space!

Help us launch Spaced Out Shop off the ground and get your hands on a limited-edition Spaced Out organic t-shirt featuring 1 of 16 influential people:

  • Neil deGrasse Tyson
  • Russell Brand
  • The Dalai Lama
  • Albert Einstein
  • Marilyn Monroe
  • Bruce Lee
  • Che Guevara
  • Jane Goodall
  • Joe Rogan
  • Nikola Tesla
  • Steve Jobs
  • Alan Watts
  • Marcus Aurelius
  • Amelia Earhart
  • Chuck Norris
  • Jimi Hendrix

If you’d like to help, but don’t want a t-shirt, we’ve created other perks that start at just $5, and there’s lots of other ways you can help without spending a dollar, such as sharing this page all over the internet and going in the draw to win one of our $500 Custom Spaced Out Tshirts perk.

Who?

Spaced Out Shop was created by Scott Townsend who wanted to create a window into space and time through bold yet simple design, for people to wear, to discuss, and to contemplate.

SOS is Scott's latest adventure into the universe, it's a journey of passion for stellar design and cosmic awareness. Please come along.

SOS HQ is based in Raglan, a small beach town on the west coast of New Zealand. All of our items are made to order by a well-paid team in California, USA and shipped to customers around the world (no sweatshops here).

Our designs are printed on quality, blank garment brands American Apparel, Alternative Apparel, and Anvil using industry-leading DTG printers and CPSIA compliant inks. These are the same blank garments and printing techniques that most established brands use.

We've spared no expense to create quality products that look great, that you will enjoy, and that will last longer than a supernova.

Why?

We need your help to launch Spaced Out Shop off the ground!

Our online store www.SpacedOutShop.com has recently gone live, but as you know, the hard part in starting a new business is getting customers and sales rolling in.

That's why we've started this crowdfunding campaign offering limited designs. We need to raise money and generate the fuel to keep the business thrusting forward through its early stages.

By contributing to this campaign, you're not only supporting a small business to get started, you're scoring a quality t-shirt that very few people in the universe will own.

Be one of our first customers, help us a launch this rocket, and be a part of our journey into the future.

What We're Offering - The Perks


$5 Spaced Out Design Pack

We'll send you a 65+ page PDF with the 16 designs of the influential people (just the design images, not on t-shirts) and information about each person. Also all of the pictures of space we used from the Hubble Telescope and information about each picture.
+ Listed on our website as a hero who came to our SOS
+ We'll follow you on Twitter and send you a tweet of appreciation

$10 for a $25 Gift Voucher

Give us $10USD and we'll give you a $25NZD gift voucher for our website SpacedOutShop.com
+ We'll send you the Spaced Out Design 65+ page PDF Pack
+ Listed on our website as a hero who came to our SOS
+ We'll follow you on Twitter and send you a tweet of appreciation

$20 for 20% Off for Life

A lifetime membership and discount code for 20% off any purchases at SpacedOutShop.com for life! You can use your unique code an unlimited amount of times and it will never expire.
+ We'll send you the Spaced Out Design 65+ page PDF Pack
+ Listed on our website as a hero who came to our SOS
+ We'll follow you on Twitter and send you a tweet of appreciation

$35 for a Limited Design Organic T-shirt

Choose one of the 16 men's or women's Spaced Uut organic t-shirts.
+ A limited edition e-certificate of authenticity stating what number out of 100 your t-shirt is (e.g. 7 of 100)
+ The Spaced Out Design 65+ page PDF Pack
+ Listed on our website as a hero who came to our SOS
+ We'll follow you on Twitter and send you a tweet of appreciation
T-shirt styles, information, sizes, and sizing guide can be found here.

$500 for Custom Spaced Out T-shirts

We'll create a custom Spaced Out design of a person or an object of your choice and send you five t-shirts.

* We'll talk with you to get a good brief of what you want
* There are 11 t-shirt colours to choose from
* More t-shirts can be purchased at extra cost
* You will own the Spaced Out design and we'll send you all the files for you do what you like with
* Includes up to two revisions of the design before printing
* You will be the only person in the universe with these t-shirts

Share to Win the $500 Custom Spaced Out T-shirts perk

Share this campaign with others and to the person who refers the most contributors to the campaign will win our top $500 Custom Spaced Out T-shirts Perk.

How it works: Simply log in to Indiegogo to get your personal tracking URL, then press the share buttons or share your unique URL (to the side of the main video at the top of the page). Spread the word about us with your friends all over the Internet! You can track your own progress by visiting your Indiegogo "My Profile" page and clicking on "Referrals." For more information about this click here.

At the end of the campaign we'll get in contact with the top referrer to let them know they've won. We'll also publish the winner in the updates section of this campaign, our Facebook and Twitter page.

The T-shirt Designs

Below you'll find all of the t-shirt designs on offer and a little bit of info about each. Full information about the influential people and photos of space is in the Spaced Out Design 65+ page PDF.
For information about the t-shirt construction, sizes, and sizes guide click here.

Neil deGrasse Tyson

Neil deGrasse Tyson is a famous American astrophysicist, cosmologist, author, and science communicator.

The original image of space is of Messier 82 (M82). The galaxy is remarkable for its bright blue disk, webs of shredded clouds, and fiery-looking plumes of glowing hydrogen blasting out of its central region.

More information about this influential person and the photo of space will be provided in the Spaced Out Design 65+page PDF pack.

We'll contact you asking what gender and size t-shirt you need after purchase. T-shirt sizes, sizing guide, and information can be found here.


Russell Brand

Russell Brand is an English comedian, actor, author, activist, and a stand-up gentleman.

The original image of space is of a jet in the Carina Nebula. Scorching radiation and fast winds (streams of charged particles) from these stars are sculpting the pillar and causing new stars to form within it. Streamers of gas and dust can be seen flowing off the top of the structure.

More information about this influential person and the photo of space will be provided in the Spaced Out Design 65+page PDF pack.

We'll contact you asking what gender and size t-shirt you need after purchase. T-shirt sizes, sizing guide, and information can be found here.


The Dalai Lama

The Dalai Lama is a monk of the Gelug or "Yellow Hat" school of Tibetan Buddhism, the newest of the schools of Tibetan Buddhism founded by Je Tsongkhapa. The 14th and current Dalai Lama is Tenzin Gyatso.

The original image of space is of M106. A little over 20 million light years away, this is a relatively nearby spiral galaxy.

More information about this influential person and the photo of space will be provided in the Spaced Out Design 65+page PDF pack.

We'll contact you asking what gender and size t-shirt you need after purchase. T-shirt sizes, sizing guide, and information can be found here.


Albert Einstein

Albert Einstein was a German-born theoretical physicist. He developed the general theory of relativity, one of the two pillars of modern physics. Einstein's work is also known for its influence on the philosophy of science.

The original image of space is of the elliptical galaxy NGC 1316. The dust lanes and star clusters of this giant galaxy are evidence that it was formed from a past merger of two gas-rich galaxies.

More information about this influential person and the photo of space will be provided in the Spaced Out Design 65+page PDF pack.

We'll contact you asking what gender and size t-shirt you need after purchase. T-shirt sizes, sizing guide, and information can be found here.

The original image of space is of M106. A little over 20 million light years away, this is a relatively nearby spiral galaxy.

More information about this influential person and the photo of space will be provided in the Spaced Out Design 65+page PDF pack.

We'll contact you asking what gender and size t-shirt you need after purchase. T-shirt sizes, sizing guide, and information can be found here.


Bruce Lee

Bruce Lee was a Hong Kong American martial artist, Hong Kong action film actor, martial arts instructor, philosopher, filmmaker, and the founder of Jeet Kune Do.

The original image of space is of Pismis 24 which lies in the core of the NGC 6357 Nebula. Part of the nebula is ionised by the youngest (bluest) heavy stars in Pismis 24. The intense ultraviolet radiation from the blazing stars heats the gas surrounding the cluster and creates a bubble in NGC 6357.

More information about this influential person and the photo of space will be provided in the Spaced Out Design 65+page PDF pack.

The original image of space is a nebula in the constellation of Sagittarius. This warm planetary nebula harbours one of the hottest stars known and its powerful stellar winds generate waves 100 billion kilometres high.

Chuck Norris

Carlos Ray "Chuck" Norris is an American martial artist, actor, film producer and screenwriter. After serving in the United States Air Force, he began his rise to fame as a martial artist.

The original image of space is of the colliding Antennae Galaxies. The collision, which began more than 100 million years ago and is still occurring, has triggered the formation of millions of stars in clouds of dust and gas in the galaxies. The most massive of these young stars have already sped through their evolution in a few million years and exploded as supernovas.

More information about this influential person and the photo of space will be provided in the Spaced Out Design 65+page PDF pack.

T-shirt Sizes, Sizing Guide & Information


Mens T-shirts

Sizes available: S, M, L, XL, XXL

T-shirt specs
  • Anvil Knitwear Men's t-shirt
  • 100% certified organic soft-spun cotton
  • Pre-shrunk
  • Seamless collar
  • Double-needle sleeve and bottom hem
If you're unsure of what size you need take your favourite fitting t-shirt and measure it against our measurements below. If in doubt, always order a size larger.

Length: measure from the back of the neck to the bottom of the shirt.
Width: measure from armpit to armpit.

Women's T-shirts

Sizes available: S, M, L, XL

Classic T-shirt Specs
  • American Apparel Women's T-shirt
  • 100% organic fine jersey cotton
  • Form-fitting
  • Double stitched
Scoop Neck T-shirt Specs
  • 100% organic Pima cotton
  • Scoop neck with narrow rib collar
  • Set-in sleeves
  • Side seamed
  • Regular fit
  • Garment-washed
If you're unsure of what size you need take your favourite fitting t-shirt and measure it against our measurements below. If in doubt, always order a size larger.

Length: measure from the back of the neck to the bottom of the shirt.
Width: measure from armpit to armpit.

FAQs

Q: Can you ship internationally?
A: Yes :)
Q: How can I select what t-shirt size and gender I want?
A: We'll contact you asking what gender and size t-shirt you need after purchase. 
Q: When will the items be delivered?
A: All of the items will be manufactured and sent out in August 2015.

Q: How much does shipping cost?
A: USA $6, Canda $8, Rest of the world $10.

Q: Where do you get the original images of Space from?
A: All our images come directly from the NASA Hubble Telescope Gallery. Then we create a design and modify the original image.

Q: What happens if you don't meet your funding goal of $10,000?
A: We've opted for a flexible funding campaign, meaning that we will receive any funds raised even if it's below the $10,000 goal. Which means you will receive the perks no matter what. 

Q: Can I use a gift voucher or discount code to buy one of the perks on this Indiegogo campaign?
A: No sorry, they can only be used on our website SpacedOutShop.com

Q: $35 for a t-shirt, don't you think that's a bit much?
A: There's a big cost difference in producing a quality t-shirt like these, and a cheap t-shirt. These t-shirts are made of organic cotton, will hold their shape, and will last.

Q: How are your products made?
A: All of our items are ethically made-to-order by a well-paid team in California, USA, and shipped to customers around the world (no sweatshops here). Our designs are printed on quality, blank garment brands American Apparel, Alternative Apparel and Anvil using industry leading DTG printers and CPSIA compliant inks. The same blank garments and printing techniques that most established brands use. We've spared no expense to create quality products that look great, that you will enjoy, and that will last.

Carlos Ray "Chuck" Norris is an American martial artist, actor, film producer and screenwriter. After serving in the United States Air Force, he began his rise to fame as a martial artist.
The original image of space is of the colliding Antennae Galaxies. The collision, which began more than 100 million years ago and is still occurring, has triggered the formation of millions of stars in clouds of dust and gas in the galaxies. The most massive of these young stars have already sped through their evolution in a few million years and exploded as supernovas.
More information about this influential person and the photo of space will be provided in the Spaced Out Design 65+page PDF pack.
We'll contact you asking what gender and size t-shirt you need after purchase. T-shirt sizes, sizing guide, and information can be found here.
 



Jimi Hendrix
James Marshall "Jimi" Hendrix was an American guitarist, singer, and songwriter. Although his mainstream career spanned only four years, he is widely regarded as one of the most influential electric guitarists in the history of popular music, and one of the most celebrated musicians of the 20th century. 
The original image of space is of the Crab Nebula, a supernova remnant and pulsar wind nebula in the constellation of Taurus.
More information about this influential person and the photo of space will be provided in the Spaced Out Design 65+page PDF pack.
We'll contact you asking what gender and size t-shirt you need after purchase. T-shirt sizes, sizing guide, and information can be found here.
 



T-shirt Sizes, Sizing Guide & Information
 Mens T-shirtsSizes available: S, M, L, XL, XXLT-shirt specs
Anvil Knitwear Men's t-shirt

100% certified organic soft-spun cotton
Pre-shrunk
Seamless collar
Double-needle sleeve and bottom hem
If you're unsure of what size you need take your favourite fitting t-shirt and measure it against our measurements below. If in doubt, always order a size larger.Length: measure from the back of the neck to the bottom of the shirt.Width: measure from armpit to armpit.
Women's T-shirtsSizes available: S, M, L, XLClassic T-shirt Specs
American Apparel Women's T-shirt
100% organic fine jersey cotton
Form-fitting
Double stitched
Scoop Neck T-shirt Specs
100% organic Pima cotton
Scoop neck with narrow rib collar
Set-in sleeves
Side seamed
Regular fit
Garment-washed
If you're unsure of what size you need take your favourite fitting t-shirt and measure it against our measurements below. If in doubt, always order a size larger.Length: measure from the back of the neck to the bottom of the shirt.Width: measure from armpit to armpit.
FAQs

Q: Can you ship internationally?A: Yes :)


Q: How can I select what t-shirt size and gender I want?A: We'll contact you asking what gender and size t-shirt you need after purchase. 
Q: When will the items be delivered?A: All of the items will be manufactured and sent out in August 2015.Q: How much does shipping cost?A: USA $6, Canda $8, Rest of the world $10.Q: Where do you get the original images of Space from?A: All our images come directly from the NASA Hubble Telescope Gallery. Then we create a design and modify the original image.Q: What happens if you don't meet your funding goal of $10,000?A: We've opted for a flexible funding campaign, meaning that we will receive any funds raised even if it's below the $10,000 goal. Which means you will receive the perks no matter what. Q: Can I use a gift voucher or discount code to buy one of the perks on this Indiegogo campaign?A: No sorry, they can only be used on our website SpacedOutShop.com

Q: $35 for a t-shirt, don't you think that's a bit much?A: There's a big cost difference in producing a quality t-shirt like these, and a cheap t-shirt. These t-shirts are made of organic cotton, will hold their shape, and will last.
Q: How are your products made?A: All of our items are ethically made-to-order by a well-paid team in California, USA, and shipped to customers around the world (no sweatshops here). Our designs are printed on quality, blank garment brands American Apparel, Alternative Apparel and Anvil using industry leading DTG printers and CPSIA compliant inks. The same blank garments and printing techniques that most established brands use. We've spared no expense to create quality products that look great, that you will enjoy, and that will last.

story:
O’Riginals Trading Company brings you the Sterling 23. A style forged in the industrial past, born in between two World Wars. The Sterling 23 harkens back to a different age with a design that hints to the future. 


Visit us at O'Riginals Trading Co. Emporium.

Sterling 23s are designed tough for the modern world with plated light-weight Stainless Steel frames and UV Protected Polarized Mineral Glass Lenses or Polarized or Non-Polarized Polycarbonate Revo Coated Impact and Scratch Resistant Lenses. They’re great on the slopes, riding to Sturgis or accessorizing your Steampunk style. 

PRODUCTION UPDATE

The Sterlings are shipping in batches. The first 500 have shipped and the next production batch should be delivered to me in the next 20 days.  

I am taking pre-orders on the website for the second run of Sterling 23s.  These will be in the June order and delivered after the crowdfund has been fulfilled.  It is a limited run of 500.  You can see it all at the O'Riginals Trading Co. Emporium.

FIRST STRETCH GOAL UNLOCKED!!!!!

Hard Cases for All Sterling 23s!!

I fell in love with the side-shield style years ago after seeing a pair in a television drama. Like most 21st century consumers I scoured the Internet to buy a pair. They didn’t exist. I was in deep despair. 

I can now find very cheap glasses that have side-shields but the quality is what you would find at your local Bank Branch when they give away 'Wayfarer' glasses. 

Sterling 23s are not those. Sterling 23s are made with the finest materials available and are some of the most expensive glasses to manufacture

Through research I found glasses with side-shields were actually safety glasses from the industrial age. In the first part of the last century, before the use of plastics in manufacturing; worn by factory workers, pilots and motorcycle riders, to name a few.


As you see when folded, the temple bars fold front, the side-shields fold back.

I secured a pair via auction, received them and then tried to figure out how to make them into sunglasses; I destroyed them. 

I bought a second pair and began tinkering - it was a success. I purchased a glass grinder and blank, polarized green lenses and began restoring old safety glasses to be new, beautiful sunglasses. 

When restored, the glasses looked as if they came from a ‘future past.’ 

Wearing my own restorations, I was constantly stopped and asked where I got my glasses. I told the story of where they came from and how I restored them and the next question was ‘Can I get a pair?’ I was on to something. I began selling the glasses I restored; these were antique glasses that were sold for over $250.

The response was so strong that I knew what I had to do… manufacture my own line of Sunglasses with Side-Shields. I was determined to manufacture The Sterling 23 using the classic design with 21st century materials at a price that was more affordable with quality as my top priority. 

Two years and a large investment of time and capital later, we are now set to start production. 

The Sterling 23s are the highest quality sunglasses with side-shields on the consumer market. 

Be a backer today and secure your Sterling 23s by The O’Riginals Trading Co.

The Sterling 23 is available with two separate lens options, Glass or Polycarbonate.

The Sterling 23 Classic -Durable Steel Plated Frames with the Finest Polarized UV  Mineral Glass Lenses with your choice of either Green, Amber or Grey. 




The Sterling 23 Sport - Same Durable Steel Plated Frame Construction- Lightweight Impact/Scratch Resistant Polarized or Non-Polarized UV Polycarbonate lenses. Perfect for the Motorcycle or the Mountain or any outdoor activity with a multitude of colors.

Size

Frame 125mm

Lens 48mm x 45mm

story:
About Viktor Luna

Hello!  My name is Viktor Luna, a recent contestant and finalist on Project Runway Season 9. 

I was born in Guadalajara, Mexico and raised in Los Angeles.  At a young age my mother taught me the foundation of how to create a garment.  Ever since, my interest in the fashion world has increased.  I have always had the desire to design, and therefore decided to move to New York City where I would pursue an education in fashion.  I enrolled in the Fashion Institute of Technology and took numerous courses for a year.  Going forward, I was given the opportunity to intern at Zero Maria Cornejo where I obtained most of my design knowledge and production.  Following my internship, I was inspired to start my own clothing line.  Just like many others, I continue to face an everyday battle of maintaing a continuous collection on a very small budget.  However, my determination and devotion to what I do strengthens my attitude and self confidence.  

Many of my friends encouraged me to audition for Project Runway.  I did not think I was quite at the level to compete on live television.  At the same time I was trying to put the idea of Project Runway out of my head, I couldn't help but wonder what the experience would be like.  Randomly seeing the casting call on Facebook made me think about it even harder:  Maybe it's fate.  Anyway, it's only a show...it can't hurt me; it might be a great experience.  I continued to put the idea off for as long as I could and oddly enough, on the exact day of the casting, I made an impulsive final decision.  I grabbed my garment bag filled with all my previous work and ran out the door! 

Arriving at the show, I was full of nerves.  The first round was probably the most nerve wracking experience of my life.  Surely enough, I passed round one and was more than ready to conquer my battles in round two.  Here, I was able to show the judges more about who I am and what kind of work I do.  Nearing the end of season 9, I was cast as one of the finalists. 

Project Runway is known to be a torturous journey, but during my time there I was in heaven.  I loved spending my time in the workroom with the other creative contestants as well as doing what I love!  It gave me the opportunity to challenge myself to do bigger and more complex things while having the luxury to receive critiques from experts in the fashion industry.  The most touching aspect was the kind, but honest, responses that I received about my designs.  That was the key factor that encouraged me to proudly present my creations to millions of fans and fashionistas.  I was given the opportunity to launch my collection during the Mercedes-Benz fashion week. Taking part in that milestone was an unforgettable experience and a dream come true.  My experience at Project Runway was absolutely incredible, and I have no regrets!

The most gratifying aspect of being a designer is watching all of my hard work and finished products come to life as clients, celebrities, and supportive fans invest in some of my pieces and wear them!  I am very driven and take all my designing very seriously. Nothing makes me happier than to see people enjoying my designs as much as I do.

The Viktor Luna brand was founded in 2008 and has been gradually developing into great success with the help of Project Runway, fans, supporters, family, and friends! 

 

Special Rewards

In addition to your fantastic support, if you help fund my business by donating:

$20, you will receive a entrance to my show along with a thank you card and sticker

$50, you will receive entrance to my show, a customized tote bag with the Viktor Luna logo along with a thank you card and sticker

$75, you will receive  entrance to my show, a customized runway print t-shirt with the Viktor Luna logo along with a thank you card and sticker 

$100, you will receive entrance to my show, a custom printed t-shirt from the Viktor Luna collection cut and made for you along with a thank you card and sticker

$250, you will receive entrance to my show, a customized polo shirt with a logo in the upper corner  along with a thank you card and sticker 

$500, you will receive entrance to my show including a VIP and backstage pass, a customized t-shirt with the Viktor Luna logo, a customized tote bag along with a thank you card and sticker 

$750, you will receive entrance to my show including a VIP and backstage pass, a customized t-shirt with the Viktor Luna logo, a customized tote bag, an accessory from the Viktor Luna collection along with a thank you card and sticker

$1000, you will receive entrance to my show including a VIP and backstage pass, a customized t-shirt with the Viktor Luna logo on it, a customized tote bag, a lunch date with Viktor Luna at Bergdorf's Cafe along with a thank you card and sticker

$2,500, you will receive entrance to my show including a VIP access pass, a customized t-shirt with the Viktor Luna logo, a customized tote bag, an exclusive garment from the collection chosen from a set list along with a thank you card and sticker

$5,000, you will receive entrance to my show including a VIP access pass, a custom made Viktor Luna garment chosen by you from the collection, an invite to come to the atelier to meet Viktor, lunch at Bergdorf's Cafe, a customized t-shirt with the Viktor Luna logo, a customized tote bag, along with a thank you card and sticker 

$10,000, you will receive everything that I am offering as shown in the donations above! 

Just remember, no matter what donation you choose to make, you will all receive entrance to my Spring/Summer 2013 presentation at New York Fashion Week and have the luxury to mingle with many other fashionable fans and enjoy all of the goodies from the sponsors. The show will also be broadcast on the internet at www.viktorluna.com.  

Because of your generous donations, I will be able to...

  • Complete my Spring/Summer 2013 collection.  This will be my most recent project, and I am very excited to embark on this new journey.  I will be taking a huge leap from my previous work and concentrating more with luxury fabrics, crystals, embellishments, colors, leather, accessories, prints, etc.  I will be applying my special techniques in order to enhance my creations.  I will strive to make this collection gorgeous to the eye. 
  • Follow through with my inspirations. I have been inspired by many aspects throughout life; whether it be through my recent travels to Miami, Mexico City, Los Angeles, and New York or auditioning for Project Runway, I always seem to keep dreaming! Now that summer is here, we all spend more time outside and have the ability to express ourselves, and that is why I want to make my Spring/Summer 2013 collection the best one yet!  I envision a muse for this collection to be an edgy sophisticated Tilda Swinton. 

Don't worry, if you cant donate you can still help! 

Tweeting/following me on twitter, liking my Facebook page, checking my blog on BlogSpot, watching videos on YouTube, you name it! 

The more support and public knowledge, the better!

Spread the news to people you cross paths with everyday to enhance my new spring/summer 2013 collection! 

It's YOU that will ultimately make my Spring Summer 2013 collection a SUCCESS! 

Many Thanks!

I want to thank each and every one of you from the bottom of my heart. Your contributions to my business mean the world to me, and I will always be grateful for that!

story:
At HEX we are always looking to innovate. That's just what we've done with our Technical Collection. These bags are amazing as you will see when you scroll down. They are made from super heavy-duty materials with hours of thought put into every detail. They are padded, protected, proportioned, and sized to function perfectly for all your carry and travel needs.

But on top of all that we wanted something more. We started thinking "out of the box" (or out of the bag) of a way to make cleaner bags. Bags that would stand with us in a germ-filled world. And that's just what we did.

This anti-microbial technology targets harmful microbes by altering their ability to convert nutrients into energy, inhibiting microbial survival and reproduction.

Think about how many things your bag comes into contact with every day - it's not a pretty picture. Now more than ever, we need to be as sanitary as possible. Our bags are right there with you. Everywhere you go, the bags are working to help reduce germs and promote better hygiene.

We also have an innovative pocket designed into the top of the bags that will hold a remote charging block, so you don't have to worry about using those unsanitary public charging stations - if they will even exist anymore.

If you want to know more details about our Anti-Microbial technology, please scroll to the bottom and get your science game on!

So take a look at all the amazing features of these bags and we think you'll see why we are so excited to bring them to market.

The Backpack

Our Backpack is an engineering marvel. You can fit sooo much stuff in here! But it's how the bag is designed that makes the difference. The magnetic secured laptop compartment allows for one hand removal and stow - no more need for that third hand.  And it is large (holds up to a 16"), padded with EVA foam, and and lined in soft faux-fur. All the  inside pockets and organizers are sized specifically to fit hard drives, power packs, etc. The interior divider allows you more space for a tablet while still keeping the roomy main compartment free for all your daily needs. There is a hideaway rainfly, a exterior utility strap, luggage handle pass through for travel on a roller suitcase, a lay-flat water bottle holder,  and a combo passport/phone pocket. Add that to the 2 front pockets with nice hidden magnetic closures and a molded EVA foam back panel and you have one serious backpack. 

Backpack Dimension - 17.5"L x 11.5"H x 5"D | 22L | 3 lbs  

The Duffel

Our Duffel is designed to be the only bag you need to make a work/life balance possible.  A luxurious laptop compartment, along with multiple front pockets and organizers allow you to have your professional necessities at hand for work. Even the front organizer pocket is lined in a wipe clean acrylic so it can be used either for business or as a cosmetics pocket for travel. The wireless charger pocket is right on top of the bag and there is a large EVA padded and faux-fur lined laptop pocket that will hold up to a 15" laptop. A generous main compartment hidden behind the work/personal divider with a shoe garage and lay-flat water bottle holder means this bags will take you right from work to the gym, or vice-verse.  Is it your work bag, your getaway bag, your gym bag?  YES!

 

Duffel Dimension - 16"L x 10.5"H x 8.5"D | 23L | 2.5 lbs  

The Messenger

Our Messenger is a giant leap forward for active professionals. Its slim profile means it doesn't get in your way whether on a street, in a subway, or even on a skateboard. But don't let its slim lines fool you, this bag is decked out with amazing features. The wireless charger pocket is right on the front flap so it's easy to set your bag down and charge your phone on top. There is also a quick access pocket easily accessible on the front for your most needed essentials. Stay hydrated with the lay-flat water bottle pocket, keep your phone safe in the soft, lined exterior phone pocket - there are even velcro stash pockets at the strap junctions where the strap meets the bag body. There are cinch straps to carry extra layers. There is a huge deluxe organizer pocket that will keep all your accessories neat. A generous main compartment, and a faux-fur and EVA foam padded laptop sleeve that accommodates up o a 15" laptop. And don't forget the hideaway rain fly to keep all your goodies dry. Like we said, this is not like any other Messenger you have seen.

Messenger Dimension - 15.5"L x 11.5"H x 5"D | 15L | 2 lbs  

Available Colors:


 

Here's some "scienc-y" info for those of you who just gotta know more ;)

While the term “antibacterial” may be more well known, antimicrobials take germ protection a step further in that they are also effective against molds, and fungi.

Our antimicrobial technology targets harmful microbes by altering their ability to convert nutrients into energy, inhibiting microbial survival and reproduction. We use a zinc pyrithione process delivered in a liquid dispersion form that incorporates the solution directly within the textile fibers. Our treatment is registered with the EPA and FDA as well as notified with the EU BPR and is BluesIgn® and Okeo-Tex certified.

Our fabrics were laboratory tested* using antimicrobial test methods ATCC 100 & ATCC 30 and compared against a control sample. No product can claim 100% elimination or guarantee effectiveness against all kinds of microorganisms and pathogens. However, these tests showed our fabric to repel and resist up to 99% of bacteria, mold, and fungus.

This means that whatever your bag comes in contact with, the bag itself is working to eliminate harmful germs and bacteria. We call this process “active hygienics” and it means that any transmission of microorganisms to or from your bag will be diminished.

We are pleased to bring this technology to market in response to the need for heightened hygiene practices and to provide our customers the best product experience possible.

Regarding COVID-19: Most antimicrobial processes (including ours) have not yet been specifically tested on COVID-19. However, the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and World Health Organization (WHO) recommend the use of antibacterial and antimicrobial products as part of a generalized preventative routine against SARS-CoV-2, the virus that causes COVID-19. (1) (2)

(1) https://www.epa.gov/pesticide-registration/list...

(2) https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-...

* as tested by SGS-CTSC Standards Technical Services Co, Ltd.

The results of these tests are based on controlled laboratory conditions which cannot account for all possible real-world situations.
story_txt:
At HEX we are always looking to innovate. That's just what we've done with our Technical Collection. These bags are amazing as you will see when you scroll down. They are made from super heavy-duty materials with hours of thought put into every detail. They are padded, protected, proportioned, and sized to function perfectly for all your carry and travel needs.But on top of all that we wanted something more. We started thinking "out of the box" (or out of the bag) of a way to make cleaner bags. Bags that would stand with us in a germ-filled world. And that's just what we did.This anti-microbial technology targets harmful microbes by altering their ability to convert nutrients into energy, inhibiting microbial survival and reproduction.Think about how many things your bag comes into contact with every day - it's not a pretty picture. Now more than ever, we need to be as sanitary as possible. Our bags are right there with you. Everywhere you go, the bags are working to help reduce germs and promote better hygiene.We also have an innovative pocket designed into the top of the bags that will hold a remote charging block, so you don't have to worry about using those unsanitary public charging stations - if they will even exist anymore.If you want to know more details about our Anti-Microbial technology, please scroll to the bottom and get your science game on!So take a look at all the amazing features of these bags and we think you'll see why we are so excited to bring them to market.The BackpackOur Backpack is an engineering marvel. You can fit sooo much stuff in here! But it's how the bag is designed that makes the difference. The magnetic secured laptop compartment allows for one hand removal and stow - no more need for that third hand.  And it is large (holds up to a 16"), padded with EVA foam, and and lined in soft faux-fur. All the  inside pockets and organizers are sized specifically to fit hard drives, power packs, etc. The interior divider allows you more space for a tablet while still keeping the roomy main compartment free for all your daily needs. There is a hideaway rainfly, a exterior utility strap, luggage handle pass through for travel on a roller suitcase, a lay-flat water bottle holder,  and a combo passport/phone pocket. Add that to the 2 front pockets with nice hidden magnetic closures and a molded EVA foam back panel and you have one serious backpack. Backpack Dimension - 17.5"L x 11.5"H x 5"D | 22L | 3 lbs  The DuffelOur Duffel is designed to be the only bag you need to make a work/life balance possible.  A luxurious laptop compartment, along with multiple front pockets and organizers allow you to have your professional necessities at hand for work. Even the front organizer pocket is lined in a wipe clean acrylic so it can be used either for business or as a cosmetics pocket for travel. The wireless charger pocket is right on top of the bag and there is a large EVA padded and faux-fur lined laptop pocket that will hold up to a 15" laptop. A generous main compartment hidden behind the work/personal divider with a shoe garage and lay-flat water bottle holder means this bags will take you right from work to the gym, or vice-verse.  Is it your work bag, your getaway bag, your gym bag?  YES! Duffel Dimension - 16"L x 10.5"H x 8.5"D | 23L | 2.5 lbs  The MessengerOur Messenger is a giant leap forward for active professionals. Its slim profile means it doesn't get in your way whether on a street, in a subway, or even on a skateboard. But don't let its slim lines fool you, this bag is decked out with amazing features. The wireless charger pocket is right on the front flap so it's easy to set your bag down and charge your phone on top. There is also a quick access pocket easily accessible on the front for your most needed essentials. Stay hydrated with the lay-flat water bottle pocket, keep your phone safe in the soft, lined exterior phone pocket - there are even velcro stash pockets at the strap junctions where the strap meets the bag body. There are cinch straps to carry extra layers. There is a huge deluxe organizer pocket that will keep all your accessories neat. A generous main compartment, and a faux-fur and EVA foam padded laptop sleeve that accommodates up o a 15" laptop. And don't forget the hideaway rain fly to keep all your goodies dry. Like we said, this is not like any other Messenger you have seen.Messenger Dimension - 15.5"L x 11.5"H x 5"D | 15L | 2 lbs  Available Colors:
 Here's some "scienc-y" info for those of you who just gotta know more ;)While the term “antibacterial” may be more well known, antimicrobials take germ protection a step further in that they are also effective against molds, and fungi.Our antimicrobial technology targets harmful microbes by altering their ability to convert nutrients into energy, inhibiting microbial survival and reproduction. We use a zinc pyrithione process delivered in a liquid dispersion form that incorporates the solution directly within the textile fibers. Our treatment is registered with the EPA and FDA as well as notified with the EU BPR and is BluesIgn® and Okeo-Tex certified.Our fabrics were laboratory tested* using antimicrobial test methods ATCC 100 & ATCC 30 and compared against a control sample. No product can claim 100% elimination or guarantee effectiveness against all kinds of microorganisms and pathogens. However, these tests showed our fabric to repel and resist up to 99% of bacteria, mold, and fungus.This means that whatever your bag comes in contact with, the bag itself is working to eliminate harmful germs and bacteria. We call this process “active hygienics” and it means that any transmission of microorganisms to or from your bag will be diminished.We are pleased to bring this technology to market in response to the need for heightened hygiene practices and to provide our customers the best product experience possible.Regarding COVID-19: Most antimicrobial processes (including ours) have not yet been specifically tested on COVID-19. However, the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and World Health Organization (WHO) recommend the use of antibacterial and antimicrobial products as part of a generalized preventative routine against SARS-CoV-2, the virus that causes COVID-19. (1) (2)(1) https://www.epa.gov/pesticide-registration/list...(2) https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-...* as tested by SGS-CTSC Standards Technical Services Co, Ltd.The results of these tests are based on controlled laboratory conditions which cannot account for all possible real-world situations.

Our crowdfunding campaign officially ended on Sunday, May 24th

We have officially launched our website/online store for those who are interested in purchasing our breakout designs, as well as what's to come for the Summer & near-future!

https://301ad.world/

story:
OUR PRODUCTS

The first stage of production will include the following items from our first collection:

1. Head Cover - Toque

 

2. Head Cover - Tube Scarf

 

3. Head Cover - Scarf

 

4. The Top

5. Hiking Top

 

6. Jacket

7. Pants

EXCLUSIVE PERKS

In addition to the above, the following items are exclusively available during our crowdfunding campaign:

1. Antimicrobial Microfiber Face Towel

 

2. Unisex Oola T-shirt

PERKS

 

FUNDING MILESTONES

We put a lot of love in fashioning our elegant and efficient products -- our first testers agree. We have invested our life savings in researching fabrics, designing a first collection of outfits, producing several iterations of prototypes and towards a down payment for production. We are crowdfunding to help us raise the additional funds required to complete production. Our target of $15,000 will be used to produce headpieces, the multisport top and the hiking top. Exceeding our funding target will enable us to include more products in the campaign. 

 

OUR STORY

Meet the team behind Oola:

The idea of Oola germinated at the top of Mount Kilimanjaro, where two friends, Haya Al Ghanim and Amina Ahmadi (the co-founders of Oola) saw each other's journey to reach the summit in clothing that was appropriate for the climb, but didn't give them the coverage they would have desired. For both, an outdoor run or ride entails tireless shopping sprees at major sports stores and a whole lot of creativity (and luck). Haya and Amina often found themselves having to mix and match a lot of pieces from various stores to make an outfit work - which costs a fortune!

They quickly realised this was a common issue faced by women who feel more comfortable in looser-fitted, long sleeved sportswear made of technical fabrics. They partnered with Lilian Gabriel De Almeida Barbosa, a fashion designer with a background in physical therapy, who embraced the challenge of designing a line of activewear that is loose-fitting and stylish, without compromising on sports and fitness performance.

After a rigorous process of sketching, multiple visits to factories around the world to identify suitable trade partners and numerous prototype iterations, a first collection of Oola sportswear is now ready to be produced. The first phase of production will include the various headpieces and the multisport top. The next phases will include additional styles of sports tops, trousers and jackets.

CO-FOUNDERS BIOs

HAYA AL GHANIM

CEO, Co-founder

A Qatari tech buff and amateur athlete with a love for the outdoors, Haya knows how hard it is to find sportswear that is modest, modern and functional. Starting later in the game, Haya began her fitness journey at age 28. She was inspired by a 78 year-old who crossed the finish line during the Boston Marathon in 2013, “I thought, what an accomplishment. I’m 28 and can’t even fathom having to run a 10K, let alone a full marathon.” 

Oola Sportswear is the brainchild of Haya’s desire to enjoy the great outdoors while staying inline with her values and culture. “My drive is a result of being able to provide Muslim women with a whole new experience in sports and fitness.” After tireless shopping sprees at major sports stores and a whole lot of creativity (and luck), Haya often found herself having to mix and match a lot of pieces from various stores to make an outfit work.

Haya hopes that Oola Sportwear will make room for women in the Muslim world to feel comfortable while enjoying outdoor sports as well as lower the barrier to entry for women looking to compete in sports professionally. 

When Haya is not outdoors working up a sweat, she coaches tech entrepreneurs, mentoring them to launch their own businesses. She holds an MBA from MIT Sloan School of Management. Haya enjoys cycling, hiking, kayaking, and running.

AMINA AHMADI

Design & Product Development Director, Co-founder

An architect, design thinker and a self-proclaimed hiking fiend, Amina struggled with finding sportswear that was lightweight, breathable and modest. “Not finding suitable clothing for outdoor sports while remaining within the realm of my values was frustrating and often led to me not participating in a number of outdoor activities.”

Intimidated by sports from an early age, Amina’s interest for fitness was sparked later on in life at age 29. It wasn’t until February 2012, when Amina discovered her passion for fitness and health. “I enrolled in a weeklong program included a daily training, mountain hikes, healthy eating and relaxation. Joining outdoor activities and being immersed in nature with views that would take anyone’s breath away, I was hooked. Hiking had now become my addiction.” Amina continued to travel and made sure to incorporate hiking into almost every trip. 

On January 1st, 2015, Amina became one of many to summit Mount Kilimanjaro in Tanzania, as part of a fundraising campaign for Palestine Children’s Relief Fund. It was during this feat that Amina realized the lack of modest, functional and suitably designed clothing for women in hijab. Being an architect, a creative with a love for design, it was only natural that Amina would develop sportswear that is modest, contemporary and fashionable. “I want Oola to encourage other women to be active, challenge boundaries, enjoy the outdoors without thinking twice about apparel and comfort.” 

Amina holds an MSc in Advanced Architectural Studies from UCL. She enjoys hiking, cycling and maintaining a healthy lifestyle.

LILIAN GABRIEL DE ALMEIDA BARBOSA

Fashion Designer, Co-founder

A Brazilian citizen and passionate fashion designer, Lilian encompasses the perfect match of sports and design. With degrees in physical therapy (specialized in orthopedics and sports traumatology) and fashion design, Lilian would prove a natural fit for Oola’s design team.

At the young age of eight, her passion for art shone. From drawing to painting to embroidery, Lilian continued to hone her creative skills. “I was 26 years-old when I first sat at a sewing machine. There was no stopping me, I had fallen in love.” Discontent with her career in healthcare, Lilian took a leap of faith, changing careers, developing her creative design skills.

“Being a part of the Oola team, where the main goal is to excel in sports and fitness, without having to compromise religious and cultural beliefs is very rewarding.” Lilian is happy to be working in a space that allows her to be inspired, creating elegant and unique designs.

When Lilian isn’t working her magic as a designer, she can be found traveling the world. She has called Boston, Chicago, London and Vienna her home in just four years. Lilian loves traveling, cultural exchange, and enjoys running along beach stretches wherever possible. She also teaches Pilates. She has a degree in physical therapy, specializing in Orthopaedics and Sports Traumatology from Brazil. Lilian also holds a Diploma in Fashion Design from the School of Fashion Design in Boston, Massachusetts.

 

FAQs

 

1- Where is your clothing made?

Our first collection is made in facilities in Tainan, Taiwan.

2- How do I wear the head pieces?

Whichever way you want! The way Haya and Amina wear them is similar to the graphics above.  

3- When I wash my Oola sportswear, what are the care instructions?

Your tops should be machine washed with cold water. Make sure you do not bleach, tumble dry on low heat, do not iron and  no dry cleaning.

Your head pieces (toque, tube scarf and scarf) should be  machine washed  cold, but better if hand washed. Make sure you do not bleach, do not tumble dry, do not iron and no dry clean. Only line dry.

4- What are the shipping charges?

Shipping cost determined by weight and it ranges between USD 13-22 except for the group deal. We do not pay for import duties and other taxes. For backers based in Qatar, we will reach out with details about where and when to collect your perks, free of charge. 

5- Where will your clothing ship from?

All orders will ship from Doha, Qatar.

6- When can I expect my order to arrive?

The estimated shipping date for each perk is as stated under each perk. We will contact you at the end of the campaign for your size, color and combination preferences, where applicable, and we will keep in touch to inform you when your order is ready for shipping. Shipping within GCC should take 3-5 days from the date of shipment. International orders should take around 1-2 weeks.

7- What if my order just doesn’t fit right?

We are unable to offer exchanges or returns because it could jeopardize our project. Please make sure you check the size chart below for Oola tops. Our clothes are meant to be loose-fitting, so if you prefer a fitted piece, go for a size smaller.

Oola Tops Size Chart 

Unisex T-Shirt Size Chart

8 - I am based in Qatar. Do I need to disclose by address during check out, even though I will be collecting my perk?

Indiegogo does require you to disclose your address to confirm your perk. This will be helpful to us to arrange collection points that are convenient for you to collect your perk. 

9- I am unable to click on the payment button even though I enter the shipping information. 

Please make sure you enter ‘00000’ as postal code for addresses in Qatar or any location not using postal code.

FOLLOW US

story:
A new Canadian startup is taking the intimidating, and making it exhilarating - Daily Planet on Discovery Channel
StitchKit Hopes to Bring Electronic Fashion to Schools - Make:
MakeFashion Unveils StitchKit - Hackster.io
StitchKit: Anyone can design wearable tech fashion - Bouncy.news
MakeFashion makes it easier to make fashion - Metro News Calgary
Sparkling LED Dresses - Decorate with the StitchKit - Fabcross

 


Through MakeFashion, located in Calgary, Canada, we have been doing FashionTech runway shows around the world for the past six years. We produced over 100 wearable tech garments and showcased at over 60 international events. We introduce high-end fashion designers and artists to the exciting world of wearables through a series of informative, hands-on, designer-lead workshops. MakeFashion has showcased around the world including New York, Rome, and Shenzhen, so we know a thing or two about wearables and fashion! 

 
Because of MakeFashion, we also started running STEAM workshops, introducing people to technology through fashion. This has had such a profound and transformative impact on the lives of the people we teach, as well as ourselves. StitchKit is inspired by the work we have done in this space, and the amazing people, and teams we have worked with over the last 6 years. Throughout this campaign, we will be sharing stories and creations from those who have motivated and inspired StitchKit.
 
 
A Custom StitchKit Arduino Board

StitchKit comes with a custom Arduino-based board (based on the ATMega32U4) that is made specifically for FashionTech and wearables. The controller (the brain of a fashion tech/wearable piece) was designed to withstand movements of daily wear and use, yet is compact enough to be incorporated and hidden into your fashion or wearable piece. This is based on our experiences using several types Arduino boards and having them break during runway shows, or when people are wearing fashion tech pieces on a runway. 

We also designed this board to be powerful with lights and so far, we've tested 300 lights at full white brightness with no issues, and over 500 for rainbow colors!

Lots of Different Sensors

A number of different sensors, such as sound, proximity (distance), light, vibration, buttons, touch, accelerometers and more, are available depending on which kit you choose. The cool thing, is we are plugging into the Grove sensor system by Seeed Studio, who we've worked closely with to develop StitchKit. All Grove sensors will work with the StitchKit board, and we will be creating additional add-on sensor kits in the future!

All of the LED lights! 

Lights, lights, and more lights! We typically use a few types of LED strips for both our workshops and runways (such as anything related to WS2812b's). So we included a bunch of them in all of the kits, plus a special sewable LED strip (the first of its kind!)

Batteries aren't included with StitchKit because of international shipping regulations. However, standard USB power banks work just great with the StitchKit board, lights, and sensors!

 

StitchKit is for anyone and everyone interested in fashion, technology, wearables, or cosplay and wants to create really cool things. Our aim is to reduce the barriers into technology and fashion, letting you be creative.

For kids and parents, this is a fun way to learn the basics of electronics and programming, and we think it is super fun! This past Halloween, we did a workshop with kids who created FashionTech Halloween costumes, and the results were amazing!

These super cool fidget spinner costumes were created by kids and they were a huge hit in the neighbourhood where they went trick or treating during Halloween this past year. 

This is a great beginner kit to engage students in fun projects! Something we find really exciting about StitchKit is that it enables technology to be used in classrooms outside of Computer Science. Over the next year, we will be working with teachers locally in Canada and internationally to create a curriculum that educators can use around FashionTech. We believe this is the best way to teach STEAM for girls. If you’d like to get involved, shoot us an email at hello@wearlabs.ca!

For designers, this kit includes much of what you need to start in FashionTech! Not only have we tested the board, lights and sample code, but we’ve been using them in our runways and workshops around the world already. It works great for us and we know it will for you as well!

At MakerFaire Xi'an 2017, we spent over one month working with several first-time local designers and StitchKit to create wonderful FashionTech pieces for a runway show!

Some of our team and ambassadors are costumer designers, and cosplayers; check out how well this kit can be used to create cool costumes, props and other interesting things. 

These tech couture costumes were created by Angela Dale, a talented designer, costume creator, and all around awesome maker. She creates pieces for TV, Film, among other industries. Check out some of her work here.

 

The main team behind StitchKit consists of:

  • Shannon Hoover
  • Teddy Seyed
  • Ryan Bailey
  • Maria Elena Hoover

But we are also a large group of talented engineers, designers, cosplayers, videographers, musicians, and educators. We hope you enjoy our campaign and look forward to you joining our StitchKit family and helping to create amazing wearables and FashionTech pieces!

For StitchKit, we've partnered with:

  • Seeed Studios: an open source hardware products and manufacturing company that enables hardware making. They are headquartered in Shenzhen with operations in San Francisco and Taiwan.
  • MakeFashion: a Fashion Tech startup located in Calgary, Canada, that has been doing FashionTech runway shows around the world for the past six years. 

Risks and challenges

We understand the complexities of creating FashionTech products. In order to reduce the frustration of our backers, we have been working in China for the last two years to ensure that the project is as close as possible to mass production before we launched our initial Kickstarter project, and we are now closer to shipping than ever with our Indiegogo InDemand campaign. We've also partnered with Seeed Studios to ensure smoother timelines and delivery process.

Although a glance at the project timeline will show a massive amount of work already done to ensure that StitchKit is as close to production ready as possible, there are still some standard risks and factors left to overcome. In our current stage, this primarily includes logistics, and import customs. We’ve been preparing to take on these and any other unforeseen circumstances that Murphy and his law have waiting.

In order to minimize risk, the production run will be limited to 60% of our factory's maximum capacity. Shipping will be performed on a daily to weekly basis following the “pizza delivery approach” where products get shipped as soon as they are ready, rather than waiting for bulk shipment. We have ordered enough components to ensure that we can successfully meet the demand of our original Kickstarter backers and our Indiegogo backers.

Throughout this campaign, we will be sharing stories and creations from those who have motivated and inspired StitchKit.  A Custom StitchKit Arduino Board
StitchKit comes with a custom Arduino-based board (based on the ATMega32U4) that is made specifically for FashionTech and wearables. The controller (the brain of a fashion tech/wearable piece) was designed to withstand movements of daily wear and use, yet is compact enough to be incorporated and hidden into your fashion or wearable piece. This is based on our experiences using several types Arduino boards and having them break during runway shows, or when people are wearing fashion tech pieces on a runway. 
We also designed this board to be powerful with lights and so far, we've tested 300 lights at full white brightness with no issues, and over 500 for rainbow colors!

Lots of Different Sensors
A number of different sensors, such as sound, proximity (distance), light, vibration, buttons, touch, accelerometers and more, are available depending on which kit you choose. The cool thing, is we are plugging into the Grove sensor system by Seeed Studio, who we've worked closely with to develop StitchKit. All Grove sensors will work with the StitchKit board, and we will be creating additional add-on sensor kits in the future!
All of the LED lights! Lights, lights, and more lights! We typically use a few types of LED strips for both our workshops and runways (such as anything related to WS2812b's). So we included a bunch of them in all of the kits, plus a special sewable LED strip (the first of its kind!)Batteries aren't included with StitchKit because of international shipping regulations. However, standard USB power banks work just great with the StitchKit board, lights, and sensors! StitchKit is for anyone and everyone interested in fashion, technology, wearables, or cosplay and wants to create really cool things. Our aim is to reduce the barriers into technology and fashion, letting you be creative.For kids and parents, this is a fun way to learn the basics of electronics and programming, and we think it is super fun! This past Halloween, we did a workshop with kids who created FashionTech Halloween costumes, and the results were amazing!These super cool fidget spinner costumes were created by kids and they were a huge hit in the neighbourhood where they went trick or treating during Halloween this past year. This is a great beginner kit to engage students in fun projects! Something we find really exciting about StitchKit is that it enables technology to be used in classrooms outside of Computer Science. Over the next year, we will be working with teachers locally in Canada and internationally to create a curriculum that educators can use around FashionTech. We believe this is the best way to teach STEAM for girls. If you’d like to get involved, shoot us an email at hello@wearlabs.ca!For designers, this kit includes much of what you need to start in FashionTech! Not only have we tested the board, lights and sample code, but we’ve been using them in our runways and workshops around the world already. It works great for us and we know it will for you as well!At MakerFaire Xi'an 2017, we spent over one month working with several first-time local designers and StitchKit to create wonderful FashionTech pieces for a runway show!Some of our team and ambassadors are costumer designers, and cosplayers; check out how well this kit can be used to create cool costumes, props and other interesting things. These tech couture costumes were created by Angela Dale, a talented designer, costume creator, and all around awesome maker. She creates pieces for TV, Film, among other industries. Check out some of her work here. The main team behind StitchKit consists of:
Shannon Hoover
Teddy Seyed
Ryan Bailey
Maria Elena Hoover
But we are also a large group of talented engineers, designers, cosplayers, videographers, musicians, and educators. We hope you enjoy our campaign and look forward to you joining our StitchKit family and helping to create amazing wearables and FashionTech pieces!For StitchKit, we've partnered with:

Seeed Studios: an open source hardware products and manufacturing company that enables hardware making. They are headquartered in Shenzhen with operations in San Francisco and Taiwan.

MakeFashion: a Fashion Tech startup located in Calgary, Canada, that has been doing FashionTech runway shows around the world for the past six years. 
Risks and challengesWe understand the complexities of creating FashionTech products. In order to reduce the frustration of our backers, we have been working in China for the last two years to ensure that the project is as close as possible to mass production before we launched our initial Kickstarter project, and we are now closer to shipping than ever with our Indiegogo InDemand campaign. We've also partnered with Seeed Studios to ensure smoother timelines and delivery process.Although a glance at the project timeline will show a massive amount of work already done to ensure that StitchKit is as close to production ready as possible, there are still some standard risks and factors left to overcome. In our current stage, this primarily includes logistics, and import customs. We’ve been preparing to take on these and any other unforeseen circumstances that Murphy and his law have waiting.In order to minimize risk, the production run will be limited to 60% of our factory's maximum capacity. Shipping will be performed on a daily to weekly basis following the “pizza delivery approach” where products get shipped as soon as they are ready, rather than waiting for bulk shipment. We have ordered enough components to ensure that we can successfully meet the demand of our original Kickstarter backers and our Indiegogo backers.

story:
Adresse Paris presents the Elon coat: THE Ultimate Coat You’ll Wear 365 Days-a-Year

Introducing ADRESSE Paris, a unique, new fashion brand that mixes form with function and sophistication with stylish practicality. Designed for the urban man, our clothes are inspired by and crafted to match multifaceted and busy lifestyles. Our coat is constructed to make life easier - with style;  whether walking around town, commuting to the office, on your bike, in heavy rain or and headed a romantic dinner with someone special. No matter the occasion or the weather, our techwear makes it mark on the urban lifestyle in a very functional and fashionable way.

------

ADRESSE Paris, la nouvelle marque de mode masculine qui associe style et ingéniosité pour mieux profiter de la vie en ville, lance la première pièce de son vestiaire citadin et ambitieux : le manteau Elon.

Emprunté à un grand nom de la Silicon Valley, Elon résonne comme la promesse d’un produit fait pour et par la ville. Hybride et polyvalent, Elon a été confectionné par des passionnés avec l’idée d’accompagner l’homme urbain dans toutes ses journées. Son design sobre et épuré, sa coupe élégante ne laissent à première vue rien présager de ses nombreuses fonctionnalités.

------

Try before you buy

We invite you to discover The Elon coat in person - try it on, experience its beautiful construction and tailored sophistication. See, firsthand, its posh practicality.

From October, 22nd The Elon coat will be available for complimentary personal fittings at our partner store : Sauver le Monde des hommes, 8 Rue Beaurepaire, 75010 Paris at the regular opening hours.

Sizes available at fitting are S-M-L-XL (XS and XXL be available to order, please refer to the size chart for sizing).

After the campaign the coat will also be available in store at his final price : 450€.

 

Waterproof/windproof/water repellent

3 layer construction

Our mission is to keep you comfortable and stylish; warm when it's cold, cool when it's hot and completely dry when it's raining. That's why we used a 3 layer construction for The Elon coat (similar to extreme sports gear) . The first layer is water repellent and scratch-resistant, the second layer is waterproof and thermoregulating and the third layer provides warmth and comfort.

 

Schoeller Nanosphere®

The Elon coat is made with the most advanced fabrics that utilize  The Schoeller Nanosphere®, this truly amazing textile finishing technology enables this coat to keep you cool, comfortable and weather protected all day, and night, long. The nanoparticles, in the fabric, form a protective barrier that prevents water, oil and dirt from being absorbed through the 3 layer construction.

 

 

Taped seams

Found on only the best, high-end outdoor gear, taped seams are crucial to guarantee that your garment will be 100% waterproof. Basic or needle stitching can leave holes in fabric allowing water to seep in. Taping is an extra step that seals seams making them airtight.  

 

Wind shielding ribbed cuffs

Another smart feature that comes from outdoor gear : wind shielding ribbed cuffs. Make sure to stay warm in heavy winds or when riding your bike.

 

Stretch fabric - easy to wear

With its 2% elastane fabric the Elon coat is really easy to wear and lets you move as much as you want (fabric composition : 61% polyester, 24% viscose, 13% polyurethane, 2% elastane).
 

 

Long lasting components

If all the fabric features above are not enough, the external layer of our coat is also abrasive resistant. It got the same results at the Martindale abrasive test than the fabric used for public transport. 

We also used YKK® zippers. YKK is the world largest zipper manufacturer. Their products are known to last decades.

And those are just examples among others : Coolmax© lining, Dorlet® snaps, Mode Harmony® drawstrings...

 

Thermoregulated.  Wear this coat for every season and any reason.

C_change® technology from Schoeller

Inspired by nature, c_change® technology ensures the optimum body climate, no matter the weather. At higher temperatures or during your sprint to catch the subway, the polymer structure of the c_change® membrane, within fabrics, opens so moisture can escape to the outside air. In colder temps, or at times of low activity, the membrane tightens to keep you warm.

 

Coolmax® technology

With its Coolmax® lining, The Elon coat combines quality construction and performance to keep you cool and dry.

 

Removable hood

We made The Elon coat to suit any situation : unexpected rain on the way to happy hour with your friends or a romantic dinner with someone special. Utilize the hood on your way there, then remove it and store in its dedicated inner pocket. The hood will hide away in seconds!

 

If you need to ride your bike in the rain, we designed the hood to be helmet friendly and added a visor.

 

Adaptable neck protection

The neck is one of the most exposed and cold-sensitive areas of the body. With a classically constructed coat, the neck is not always protected. We addressed this and included adaptable neck protection. For a precise fit : adjust the coverage and protection with the snap system. Useful when you're riding your bike, motorbike, skateboard or walking against the wind.

 

10 smart pockets

At ADRESSE Paris we see beauty in practicality. That's why we added 10 smart pockets to the Elon coat. Don't let urban challenges stop you.

 

1 easy access phone pocket + earphones access and buckle

Connect directly to your mobile phone without opening your coat! We also added an earphone cable access clip to keep wires easy to reach and untangled. Live the urban life in music.

 

 

2 zippered key pockets

Keep your keys safe thanks to the internal zippered pockets.

 

2 polar fleece pockets 

Once you've tried those you won't want to live without them. They keep hands warm and dry. They are located in the regular side pockets you can find on a Mackintosh. Right next to those polar fleece pockets, we've added 2 anti-theft pockets (see below).

 

2 anti-theft pockets

Because we know how frustrating it is to lose valuables, we made anti-theft pockets. In the regular side pockets of the coat we added hidden zippered pockets. Keep everything from wallets to gifts to whatever you choose in these pockets.

 

1 credit card pocket

No need to look for your credit card or your transportation pass anymore. Zip these necessities away safely and keep them at easy access.

 

 

 

1 tablet pocket and 1 hood storage pocket

You need to carry essentials during your day. That's why we even made pockets for your tablet or other technology.

 

Bike friendly features

Whether you are riding a motorbike, a bicycle or are running to your next meeting, you need to be able to move easily and freely. The Elon coat is constructed with an opening at the back AND a convenient two-way zipper in the front.

 

They tried the Elon coat

Select your size

The model in our pictures is 1m80 (72kg) tall and wears The Elon coat in Medium.

We know that sizes are different depending on your country that's why we've set-up an email where you can check with our team that you're making the right choice. 

Shoot an email at Aurelie : contact@adresse.paris

Please note that after the campaign the coat will be in store at 450€.

 

Schoeller

Schoeller is one the best manufacturer for technical clothes in the world. They've invested in R&D since the beginning of the company in 1867. Usually working for outdoor clothes brands, we decided to do this coat with them to guarantee you the best fabric quality. 

Schoeller is doing a lot and more! They even developed an environmental standard "Bluesign". It guarantees an ecological production from the fabric to the dyes. 

We are sure you know several men that would love The Elon coat, so please don't hesitate to share this page on your Social Media! 

Tag your posts with #ELONcoat

Or, if you prefer, talk about it the old school way. Word of mouth recommendations are invaluable.

 

 

Make sure your coat will be delivered before Christmas with our Super-Early, Early and Christmas special offers! Free shipping within Europe.

The evolution of our society is at the core of the creation of ADRESSE Paris. This includes the rapidly-growing urbanization. This is what inspired Alex & Pierre (ADRESSE Paris funders) to support this brand new and completely fashion forward product line.

As we are a start-up, unlike large manufacturers, we can't afford to produce huge inventories. Crowdfunding enables us to supervise production just for you, our backers. It also allows us to control risk assessments. Thanks to this platform, streamlined and focused projects like ours are possible.

All funds raised, via this platform, will be reinvested to produce The Elon coat and develop more fashionably functional garments.

The coats featured in the photos are pre-production samples. All development and wear testing is complete and the fabric and elements are ready for production. We are working with top European manufacturers with whom we have excellent business relationships. Of course, unforeseen issues can arise, however our team has prepared for months, to secure a rock-solid production and delivery plan.

However, should anything unexpected occur, we will keep you informed, both during the campaign and afterwards.

 

Have questions?

Or chat with us: contact@adresse.paris

story:
Now available on our website! Zeniick.com

Find us on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, and Instagram
  

THANK YOU BACKERS! 

We have one mission: provide watch lovers with a simple, unique and a well-designed watch collection!

 

Cool Material: "The simple watches have clean lines, an array of colors and genuine leather bands."

IAMTHETREND: "Zeniick watches are on a mission to provide watch lovers with a simple, unique and a well-designed watch collection."

SLUG Magazine: "Zeniick Watches is a local company that makes classy and contemporary wrist watches"

ZipRage: "Zeniick also found a way to produce the watches for only $20.  This is a project I can get behind."

Materialicious: "Zeniick watches feature a simple, yet unique design that sets them apart among the highly competitive watch market." 

Urbane Menswear: "Cool modern watches by Zeniick, visit their project"

 

 Our watches are made from a leatherette material with a soft plastic, the back of the watch is stainless steel, and also made from quartz.

 

Thank you for checking out Zeniick!
