story:
Designed in Cleveland, Ohio, GOVO Badge Holder & Wallet is the world’s most functional and durable badge holder and wallet. 

When thinking about how many items people need to carry every day, we often come to the answer of wallet, phone and keys. There is one thing we always neglect but very important, which is the ID Badge we carry to work. We found so much inconveniences of carrying and using a work ID that none of today’s product have a good solution. From there we set our goal to create a wearable device that brings good experience and can be used not only as badge holder but also a wallet to simplify items we carry. 

 The construction of GOVO Badge Holder & Wallet came from inspiration of military gears that require durability and light weight at the same time. “Versatile, Durable, Light weight” are three key principles we kept in every steps when we developed this product.

 

 

 

 When we design GOVO Badge Holder & Wallet, we want it to be super durable for everyday use. There is a reason we choose polycarbonate as the material for primary version of GOVO Badge Holder. Polycarbonate is a very strong type of plastic. It is 40% stronger than ABS plastic that are widely used on many products . It can endure higher and colder temperature than most of plastics. But it is more expensive than them. We tested the polycarbonate version of the badge holder, the result proved it is very strong and durable. There is one part of video you can see from campaign video showing it holds 20 lbs of weight. The front cover and back piece are made from polycarbonate while the clip, screw and spring are made from steel.

 

Production Image of Polycarbonate GOVO Badge Holder & Wallet

Production Image of Polycarbonate GOVO Badge Holder & Wallet

Production Image of Polycarbonate GOVO Badge Holder & Wallet

Packages ready for delivery 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Best gift for everyone! Each GOVO Badge Holder & Wallet comes in a nice and neat  package.

 

Image of tooling

 

 GOVO Badge Holder & Wallet can hold 1-4 cards. Its' Card-Securing system holds card securely whenever it is loaded with only one card or four cards. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The patent pending Multi-Carry System makes GOVO Badge Holder & Wallet ultimately wearable. It can be clipped on your belt, pockets, shirts, jacket, suit, backpack or note book. You can also hang it on a lanyard, keychain and carabiner OR simply put it in your pocket.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 Every part of GOVO Badge Holder & Wallet was engineered to do its job perfectly and endure heavy duty usage. The front cover is made of thickened high strength transparent polycarbonate. We designed a frame structure on the polycarbonate back cover which allow us to thicken the material without adding too much weight. The clip is made by manganese steel secured by metal screw and reinforced structure to the holder. Most importantly, cards are secured by a metal spring system which holds well whenever it is loaded with four cards or only one card.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 When you have more than one sensing ID cards need to carry. You can put one in the front and another in the back of GOVO Badge Holder & Wallet. It allows you to sense cards from both sides. 

 

 GOVO RFID Blocking Card helps to protect your credit/debit cards' information from data thieves. Add this item to give protection to your cards.

Most of ID badge use low frequency to communicate with sensor. GOVO RFID Blocking Card blocks high frequency signal to protect your credit card but will not block low frequency ID badge signal.  (For some ID card using high frequency, the RFID blocking card might block their signal ) 

 

 IMPORTANT NOTE: Please choose your pledge amount from pledge list on campaign page. We will not ship rewards of personal adjusted pledges that are not listed on the campaign page, unless it is approved by GOVO Team.

GOVO Badge Holder & Wallet comes in four different colors: Dark Gray, Blue, Purple and Black.

story:
Kahmune is a luxury marketplace for skin tone footwear and fashion. We design all of our products in 10 skin tone hues in order to provide all women with a true nude option. No more settling for beige and tan- we believe that all women deserve to have the option to find their perfect nude. We've created an array of shades designed to suit the darkest of complexions all the way through to the fairest. 

 

 

In addition to that little black dress and the perfect red lipstick, we believe a good skin tone shoe is a wardrobe essential. They elongate the legs and go with every outfit! Unfortunately, for most women the only options available to them are various shades of beige and tan. In 2016 our founder was forced to buy a pair of white pumps and paint them to match her skin in order to have her own nude shoe. Never again. Since our first successful Indiegogo campaign in 2017 we've made it our goal to create nude shoes that work for women of all complexions. With 10 shades on offer, we're proud to say we have a 100% match rate to date.  

 

 

We spent countless hours researching skin tones in order to ensure that whether you are fair with pink undertones or more of a mid-tone with hints of olive we have a shade for you. All of you deep dark ladies fear not- we've got something for you as well!

In a world that's becoming increasingly diverse, we understand how important it is that we all feel represented.We're redefining the word nude one shoe at a time to give you the color match you deserve. Never again will you have to say "they don't have my shade."

 

The release of our debut collection sent shockwaves into the fashion industry. Since we started we've been fortunate enough to be featured in over 75+ print and online publications.


 

More importantly, we've helped inspire hundreds of women across the globe to be proud of the skin they're in.  We design for go-getter and women who believe the world is a better place 
when we support each other.  We're proud to be on the feet of business executives and students alike. Our Kahmunity members recognize that they  can admire the beauty of others
without questioning their own. 

Whether shown off at work or at a party, here's what members of our Kahmunity have to say about their nudes.

 

Celebrities such as Tamera Mowry  and Lupita Nyong'o are huge fans of comfortable our shoes are and how well they match their skin tones.

 

Our shoes are:

 

 

With your help we plan on introducing two new finishes and one new style to our collection: suede, patent, and our new scrappy sandal. Due to the precision of our shades we will have to custom dye our new suede and patent leather finishes.

 

Suede:

 

 

 

Patent:

 
 

 

 

 

Sandal:

 

 

 

Our new collection will include our updated insoles. Each insole includes  4mm of memory foam padding.

 

You will have the option to choose form 4 heel heights in our best selling pump and 3 shoe styles. All of our offerings will be amiable in Nappa, patent, or suede.

 

 

 

All styles and leathers are available in all 10 of our skin tone shades. Our shade names are inspired by the skin tones of the women in these cities and regions.  

 

 

As our products are handmade in Italy, we recognize that due to COVID-19 there may be some delays. Our anticipated timeline is as follows:

story:
Was ist KNIT-IT?

KNIT-IT ist ein Onlinekonfigurator für Strickjacken und Strickpullover.

Die Strickplattform ermöglicht Dir als qualitätsbewussten Modekonsumenten auf den Entstehungs-
prozess des Kleidungsstücks Einfluss zu nehmen. Aus reinem Konsumenten wird ein Créateur.

Durch die Entscheidung über Muster, Farbe, Material, Grösse, Zubehör, durch das Einspeisen von Bildern, die als Strickmuster übersetzt werden entsteht die Grundlage für ein einzigartiges Kleidungsstück mit persönlicher Bindung – Dein Lieblingsstück!
Auch ohne Grossmutter oder das Studieren und Erlernen des Strickhandwerks bekommst Du auf kurzem, transparenten Weg ein qualitativ hochwertiges, eigens für Dich erstelltes Kleidungsstück. Lange Suche nach etwas Passendem in Verkaufsläden oder auf Onlineplattformen entfällt. Saisonale Abhängigkeit entfällt. Du machst Dich unabhängig vom vorhandenen Marktangebot.

Jedes Design kann optional auch für andere User online zur Verfügung gestellt werden. Bei weiteren Bestellungen wirst Du als Créateur finanziell am Gewinn beteiligt.
 

Wer steht hinter KNIT-IT?

Die Online-Plattform KNIT-IT ist ein Geschäftsmodell von Julia Miske. Ich bin Diplom- Designerin und arbeite seit mehr als 12 Jahren selbständig in der Gestaltungsbranche.

Ich liebe Qualität, Handgemachtes, Persönliches, Natürliches, Stilvolles, eine Schönheit, die von innen heraus entsteht und sich mit der Zeit entfaltet. All' diese Vorlieben und noch viel Herzblut lasse ich in KNIT-IT einfliessen.

 

Was möchte ich mit KNIT-IT bewirken?

  • Zum bewussten, genussvollen Konsumieren im Modebereich (Slow Fashion) animieren
    - ein Kleidungsstück wertschätzen.
  • Dazu beitragen, dass weniger Produkte, dafür aber bessere zu den Käufern gelangen
    - Produkte mit "Seele und Tiefgang".
  • Eine Brücke schlagen zwischen Tradition und Moderne.
  • Schönheit der Natur mit individuellen Ideen und modernen Mitteln verbinden.
  • Regionale, nachhaltige Produktion zu fairen Konditionen fördern.

    Nicht zuletzt freue ich mich über glückliche, gut gekleidete Menschen.

Wie kannst Du mich unterstützen?

Jeder Euro zählt! Jede Weiterempfehlung zählt! Jedes Gespräch über KNIT-IT zählt!

Verlinkungen, Tipps, „I like`s!“ ...

Tue das, was Dir möglich ist, um die KNIT-IT-Kampagne bekannt zu machen!

Danke für alles Kleine und Grosse!

 

Wofür plane ich das Geld, was ich durch das Crowdfunding einnehme, einzusetzen?

  1. Für den ersten Materialeinkauf
  2. Für die Prototyp-Entwicklung
  3. Für die Programmierung der Online-Plattform

story:
Hello! My name is Chris Wilson. I am a high school junior and the sole proprietor of Chris Leigh Designs. Chris Lee is a t-shirt business that features my own artwork. I'm super excited to be trying to get my art out there in a way that people will be able to keep for a long time!

Okay folks, allow me to break it down for you all:

  • Right about now my business is quite small. Super tiny. Like a baby ant. But that's alright! Why? Because that just means I get to work more closely with all the lovely supporters I have! That being said, I'm shooting for $1000 to give my business a good kick in the pants to get it off the ground.

Perks! I know ya love 'em. Check out the Perks section to see what certain donations could get you!

I get that not everyone has money lying around begging to be given to teenagers. So here's why I'm asking for this amount of money:

  1. Supplies: To make some of my units (magnets, buttons, etc.) I need to print things out of my home. This requires ink money. And those of you with a printer can vouch for this when I say that ink isn't exactly getting cheaper nowadays... The magnet and button units require metal pieces and magnets as well. Also, for t-shirts, I do need to purchase printing transfers and the shirts themselves.

  2. Mailing: I plan to work part of my business through mailing units. Though mailing in itself doesn't cost a fortune, the price of it can add up over time and it'd be great just to have a set fund that I can go in to in order to get the units out to people outside of my area.

  3. Insurance: Over the course of the last few months, my family and I have put out about $1000 towards this project. I'd like to make sure that there's a bit of funds put away in case anything were to break or go wrong.

As I may have mentioned earlier in this message, I am a junior in high school. And though I do attend a public school at the moment, it seems that things have gotten more and more expensive. SAT prep classes are like, $700 for a few weeks these days. This is not okay. Not okay at all. I've hoped that through my business I would be able to not only spread my art around and make people happy; but also further my education. If all goes well, I may even get to help my little brother out with school too!

Starting a business is a big step for someone my age and it sure isn't easy. But it's all about sticking with it and doing all that I can to keep this baby afloat and I really hope you guys will be able to help me do that.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know some of you guys really can't contribute monetarily. And that's fine. It doesn't mean you can't help out a little girl with a plan! I'd be super duper grateful if you could even just give this business a few shares on your social media. Tell your friends! Tell your family! Tell that weird person in the subway station that's always dancing really hard! It's all really appreciated. 

Unicorns and Rainbows,

-Chris

story:
Bedroom in a box

With the growing market of in-home/catalogue businesses such as Avon, Scentsy, Partylite, Mary-Kay and etc. Our Fusion Decor Ottawa team was inspired to give this business an interior design twist. The idea is to create an easy way for confused home owners, and renters to buy and decorate a bedroom. The bedroom in a box would include everything someone needs to make a bedroom beautiful, with the exception of furniture (Ex: Bed linen, Wall art, Curtains, Curtain rod, and Decorative accents). Pick a colour, pick a style and next thing you know, your bedroom in a box will be waiting for you at the door. It's as easy as 1,2 and 3. 


What We Need & What You Get

Our business is now celebrating its one year anniversary. And we have been doing really well. And with our experience, we have noticed that this is a market gap. We are looking for partners who can help us finance our project. The financing would help us brand, execute the launch, and delivery of our first bedrooms in a box.  The financing would also help us hire someone for a 1 year coordinating contract.  In return we promise to offer you exclusive prizes and rewards offered in the side bar. If you are donating above 500$ as a corporation or business, it would be our pleasure to connect with and advertise you as a partner on our website. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We apprecite any help ! We understand that not everyone will be able to provide financial support. If you wish to help in other ways, we would truly appreciate your help in promoting the project on facebook and on twitter. You can also help by visiting our current website and by liking our current facebook page.

    • www.fusiondecorottawa.com
    • https://www.facebook.com/fusiondecorottawa

story:
About Us

At Tatriz, our mission is to empower women through employment. We do this by working with artisans to design fashionable, unique clothing which utilises their traditional skills. Through our partnerships with local foundations, we provide a fair wage, ensure healthy working conditions and a sustainable source of income for our target communities.

We believe in making positive global connections. When you purchase our garments, you not only take home a one-of-a-kind fashion piece, you also sponsor rural livelihoods and promote ethical fashion.

About Our Partners

We are working with AlKhair & Al Ata Foundation in Jordan which has established a garment factory in the village of Karak with a specialisation in embroidery. While they are skilled artisans, many of the women in this community have never earned a wage before and we hope to create a product which leverages their talents and creates a sustainable source of income.

What We Need
We are looking for seed funding to begin designing our first collection and producing prototypes. To do this, we need to send our designers out to Jordan to work with our artisans, create designs and source materials. We'd also like to send our management team out to audit the factory, find partners and document the journey to create marketing and promotion materials to aid us in the first round of sales and next round of fund-raising.

40% on airfare for 2 designers and the Tatriz team.
50% on designing and producing samples (materials, labour and shipping).
10% on producing and shipping perks.

story:
Qui est Nathaniel?

Nathaniel Pocock est un athlète québécois de snowboard cross, originaire
de Compton, Québec. Il vit maintenant à Montréal, où il poursuivra des
études à l'université Concordia à l’automne. Il s’entraîne à temps plein et
doit travailler pour payer les frais reliés à la pratique de son sport.

Il a grandi sur les pistes du mont Owl’s Head, où il y découvre une vraie
passion pour la planche à neige. Il suit un parcours différent de ses trois
sœurs qui pratiquent le ski de compétition. Il est autodidacte n’ayant pas
d’entraînements de snowboard cross en région. C’est avec beaucoup de
détermination, qu’il débute la compétition sur le circuit Nord Américain en
2010. Nommé athlète québécois de snowboard cross en 2012, il s'affiche
maintenant comme l'un des meilleurs Québécois et même Canadiens sur
le circuit. Son rêve est bien simple; joindre l'équipe nationale et participer
aux jeux olympiques ainsi qu'aux x-games.

 Où vont vos dons?  

Une saison de compétition est très dispendieuse. Malgré l'aide de
l'association snowboard Québec, de la station de ski d’Owl’s Head ainsi
que de quelques commanditaires et de ses ressources personnelles,
Nathaniel ne peut y arriver seul. C'est pour cette raison que vos dons
(quel que soit le montant) peuvent faire une réelle différence. Les dons
vont directement pour payer les dépenses reliées aux courses, soient les
déplacements, les hébergements, les inscriptions, les entraîneurs sur la
neige et dans le gymnase.

 Merci d'avance pour votre soutien.

 

Who is Nathaniel?

Nathaniel Pocock loves snowboarding and has chosen snowboard cross as his discipline. Growing up on the slopes of Owl’s Head in Quebec’s Eastern Townships, Nathaniel now lives in Montreal to begin studying at Concordia University this fall.

Nathaniel’s three sisters, Lara, Aimée and Camille have all been involved in competitive alpine skiing but he chose a different path in an area where snowboard cross was not an option as a sport.

Autumn 2010, Nathaniel moved to Canmore, Alberta, to train full time with a coach and riders based at Lake Louise. That season he began competing on the North American circuit and in the spring of 2012 was named the outstanding Quebec snowboard cross athlete. He is now recognized as one of the best snowboard cross competitors in Quebec and Canada. His dream is to join the National Team and compete internationally.

Your donations?

Nathaniel trains year round even as he works full time outside of the snowboarding season. Despite his earnings, financial help from Snowboard Quebec and sponsors such as Fred Korman at Owl’s Head, Nathaniel has difficulty covering all of his expenses. Your donations would help pay for coaching, year round training, expenses related to travel on the competition circuit and more. A donation of even 10$-20$ would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you

story:
My name is Mitchell Sebastian, I want to thank you for taking a look at my campaign. I am 16 years old and have been riding a snowmobile since I was 2. My dad took me to my first event at age 8 where I got to race with other kids my age. I knew then that I wanted to be a professional snowmobile racer. When I turned 12 my dad and I started traveling to races so I could get more experience. In 2009 I won a very big race at the junior level. In 2010, we did it again. If you Google my name along with "starting them young" you will find an article written about me from the folks at Vintagesleds. Since then we have stepped up to the "grown-up" classes with much success. I am proud to be a 2-time winner of the Tracy Kruger Memorial Speedrun. Last year I finished my season with 27 podium finishes and 13 class wins. This is my calling, my dream if you will to become a professional factory driver. I know I can do it, I just need some help. This is where I need you, to help me reach that next level. Here is the next level : Cross Country racing. I have already purchased a new 22 foot trailer to work out of and a used 2009 snowmobile to convert into the racer I need it to be. If you have a heart for, or a passion for racing, you will understand this well. You need alot of parts and services to add to the sled to make it perform. What I am asking from you, If you feel my passion or even a passion within yourself...please consider helping me. Your contribution to my race...it counts ! It matters!

What I need from you and what I want to do for you: I need dollars to purchase upgrades for this snowmobile: New skis, New shock packages, tracks, studs, clutches, suspensions etc. This entry into Cross Country racing is going to be a new discipline for me and to win, I must be prepared. What I want to do for you : From the 1st person to the last. I will personally mail you a 'Mitchell Sebastian Team 65' decal for your car or truck, so everyone knows you are helping. At the end of the season, I will mail you a photo of my sled in action. And to the larger helpers, since space is limited on the snowmobile. I will get these folks on the sled as well as on the trailer. We usually do t-shirts too. You will look awesome in a 'Team 65 Racing' shirt!! I am seeking 10,000.00 to help with the parts and services to make my race sled top notch. I've bought the sled. I've bought the trailer. I need YOU to help me go faster and win some races!! In 4 years, I've only gotten better! Lets race to the top together. Thank you and God bless you for looking! One last thing... If I don't make my goal, the funds I do raise will be used as effectively as possible to race ahead. Tell your friends, ask them to get on board too ! We can do this ! Mitchell
